original: shin tu thal ches pas chog ste /
analyzed: shin tu thal ches pas chog ste /
translated: This is too much of an extreme.

original: skabs su bab pa dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: skabs su bab pa dpyad par bya'o //
translated: We will analyze what is relevant here.

original: mgon po sems can kun bdag nyid //
analyzed: mgon po sems can kun bdag nyid //
translated: Homage to the protector, the very nature of all sentient beings,

original: dpal ldan bde chen la btud de //
analyzed: dpal ldan bde chen la btud de //
translated: to the glorious one, to great bliss,

original: rnal 'byor rgyud kyi rjes 'brangs nas //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rgyud kyi rjes 'brangs nas //
translated: following the Yoga Tantra,

original: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim bshad bya //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim bshad bya //
translated: I will explain the stage of vajra repetition.

original: mgon po ste bcom ldan 'das dpal rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag po la btud cing phyag 'tshal nas rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa ste mi phyed mi shigs pa'i rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du bshad cingüîΩbsnyad par bya'o //
analyzed: mgon po ste bcom ldan 'das dpal rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag po la btud cing phyag 'tshal nas rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa ste mi phyed mi shigs pa'i rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du bshad cing bsnyad par bya'o //
translated: Having bowed to and paid homage to the protector, the glorious Vajrasattva, the Lord of all Tathagatas, I will explain, I will expound, the stage of vajra repetition, the stage of indivisible, indestructible vajra repetition, just as it is.

original: mgon po ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: mgon po ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the protector like?

original: sems can kun bdag nyid de brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i 'gro ba la khyab par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can kun bdag nyid de brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i 'gro ba la khyab par byed pa'o //
translated: He is the very nature of all sentient beings, pervading the animate and inanimate world.

original: dpal ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dag ste /
analyzed: dpal ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dag ste /
translated: Glory is the two accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: gang la de dag yod pa ni dpal ldan no //
analyzed: gang la de dag yod pa ni dpal ldan no //
translated: He who possesses them is the glorious one.

original: bde chen ni thar pa ste de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bde ba chen po de la'o //
analyzed: bde chen ni thar pa ste de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bde ba chen po de la'o //
translated: Great bliss is liberation, and because it is the cause of that, it is great bliss.

original: rnal 'byor rgyud kyi rjes 'brangs nas //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rgyud kyi rjes 'brangs nas //
translated: Following the Yoga TantraüîΩ.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this,

original: rnal 'byor rgyud ni dpal gsang ba 'dus pa zhes bya ba'i ming can no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rgyud ni dpal gsang ba 'dus pa zhes bya ba'i ming can no //
translated: the Yoga Tantra is the one called the Glorious Guhyasamaja.

original: de'i rjes 'brangs nas zhes bya ba ni de las btus zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: de'i rjes 'brangs nas zhes bya ba ni de las btus zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: Following that means that it is extracted from that.

original: yi ge'i don to //
analyzed: yi ge'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the syllables.

original: yang na mgon po ni blang bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na mgon po ni blang bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, the Lord is to be taken up.

original: thams cad stong pa'i chos nyid ni 'gro ba ma lus pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir sems can kun bdag nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad stong pa'i chos nyid ni 'gro ba ma lus pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir sems can kun bdag nyid do //
translated: The nature of all things empty is the nature of all beings without exception, and therefore it is the nature of all beings.

original: dpal ni chos kyi sku ste de dang ldan pa'i phyir dpal ldan no //
analyzed: dpal ni chos kyi sku ste de dang ldan pa'i phyir dpal ldan no //
translated: Glory is the Dharma body, and because it is endowed with that, it is glorious.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i byang chub chen po rnams kyi nang nas mchog gi byang chub kyi ngo bo bde ba yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i byang chub chen po rnams kyi nang nas mchog gi byang chub kyi ngo bo bde ba yin no //
translated: It is bliss, the essence of the supreme enlightenment of the great enlightenment of the Sravakas and so forth.

original: de la btud nas rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa ste /
analyzed: de la btud nas rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa ste /
translated: Having bowed to that, the stage of vajra repetition.

original: rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i ma ning gi bzlas pa'i mtshan nyid bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i ma ning gi bzlas pa'i mtshan nyid bshad par bya'o //
translated: The nature of the recitation of the neutral, which is naturally pure, will be explained.

original: rnal 'byor rgyud kyi rjes 'brangs nas //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rgyud kyi rjes 'brangs nas //
translated: Following the Yoga Tantra

original: zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin te spyi'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin te spyi'i don to //
translated: As before, this is the general meaning.

original: yang na de bzhin du mgon po ni phung po la sogs pa thams cad kyi gtso bor gyur pa yin no//
analyzed: yang na de bzhin du mgon po ni phung po la sogs pa thams cad kyi gtso bor gyur pa yin no//
translated: Or else, in the same way, the Lord is the principal one of all the aggregates and so forth.

original: yod pa'i dngos po ni sems can zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yod pa'i dngos po ni sems can zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The existent thing is called the sentient being.

original: byang chub kyi sems so //üîΩkun ni rtsa @53a * //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems so // kun ni rtsa @53a * //
translated: It is the thought of awakening.

original: stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis so //
analyzed: stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis so //
translated: All means the seventy-two thousandüîΩnƒÅdƒ´s.

original: de'i bdag nyid ces bya ba ni rtsa las byung ba'i byang chub sems kyis 'gro ba ma lus pa skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ces bya ba ni rtsa las byung ba'i byang chub sems kyis 'gro ba ma lus pa skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: Its nature is the production of all migrating beings by the bodhicitta that arises from the nƒÅdƒ´s.

original: dpal ni shes rab ste de dang ldan pa ni dpal ldan no //
analyzed: dpal ni shes rab ste de dang ldan pa ni dpal ldan no //
translated: Glory is wisdom. Endowed with that, he is glorious.

original: bde chen ni lhan cig skyes pa'i de kho na nyid rang gi ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: bde chen ni lhan cig skyes pa'i de kho na nyid rang gi ngo bo nyid de /
translated: Great bliss is the essence of the innate reality.

original: btud nas rnal 'byor rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas rdo rje bzlas pa ste rnam par shes pa dang rlung gi de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin can gyi bzlas pa bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba yang spyi'i don to //
analyzed: btud nas rnal 'byor rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas rdo rje bzlas pa ste rnam par shes pa dang rlung gi de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin can gyi bzlas pa bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba yang spyi'i don to //
translated: Having bowed to that, I will explain the vajra recitation, which is the nature of the reality of consciousness and wind, following the Yoga Tantra.

original: yang na mgon po ni man ngag bzhi pa'i rang gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: yang na mgon po ni man ngag bzhi pa'i rang gi ngo bo'o //
translated: Or else, the protector is the essence of the four instructions.

original: kun ni dga' ba la sogs pa 'dod chags dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'dod chags bar ma rnams so //
analyzed: kun ni dga' ba la sogs pa 'dod chags dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'dod chags bar ma rnams so //
translated: All is the passion, non-passion, and middling passion of joy and so forth.

original: sems can ni smig rgyu la sogs pa'i rtags lnga'o //
analyzed: sems can ni smig rgyu la sogs pa'i rtags lnga'o //
translated: The sentient beings are the five signs such as the mirage.

original: de'i bdag nyid ni de rnams dang ro gcig pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis rang gis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ni de rnams dang ro gcig pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis rang gis rig par bya'o //
translated: Its nature is that which is to be known by oneself through being of one taste with them.

original: dpal ni dam tshig phyag rgya ste de dang 'brel pas thob par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dpal ldan no //
analyzed: dpal ni dam tshig phyag rgya ste de dang 'brel pas thob par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dpal ldan no //
translated: Glory is the pledge seal, and it is glorious because it is to be attained through being connected with that.

original: bde chen ni dpe las byung ba'i lhan cig skyes pa'i de kho na nyid kyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: bde chen ni dpe las byung ba'i lhan cig skyes pa'i de kho na nyid kyi ngo bo'o //
translated: Great bliss is the essence of the innate reality that arises from the example.

original: btud pa ni rjes su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: btud pa ni rjes su 'jug pa'o //
translated: Bowing means following.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin te sbas pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin te sbas pa'o //
translated: Vajra repetition is as before, i.e., hidden.

original: yang na mgon po ni 'ja' tshon gyi rnam par snang ba'o //
analyzed: yang na mgon po ni 'ja' tshon gyi rnam par snang ba'o //
translated: Or else, the Lord is the appearance in the form of a rainbow.

original: sems can ni sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: sems can ni sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis so //
translated: Sentient beings are the twelve examples of illusion.

original: de'i bdag nyid ni de'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ni de'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Their nature is their essence.

original: dpal ni longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku dag ste /
analyzed: dpal ni longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku dag ste /
translated: Glory is the Enjoyment Body and the Emanation Body.

original: de dang ldan pa'i phyir dpal ldan no //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i phyir dpal ldan no //
translated: Because it possesses that, it is glorious.

original: bde chen ni chos kyi sku ste /
analyzed: bde chen ni chos kyi sku ste /
translated: Great bliss is the Dharma Body.

original: de las byung ba'i phyir bde chen no //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i phyir bde chen no //
translated: Because it arises from that, it is great bliss.

original: de la btud nas /
analyzed: de la btud nas /
translated: Having bowed to that,

original: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim bshad bya //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim bshad bya //
translated: I will explain the stage of vajra repetition.

original: zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin te sbas pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin te sbas pa yin no //
translated: This is as before, i.e., hidden.

original: mgon po ni rang bzhin rnams te de dag sdud par byed pa po nyid yin pa'i phyir mgon po'o //
analyzed: mgon po ni rang bzhin rnams te de dag sdud par byed pa po nyid yin pa'i phyir mgon po'o //
translated: The Lord is the natures, because he is the very one who gathers them.

original: sems can thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir sems can kun ni rnam par shes pa gsum yin te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir sems can kun ni rnam par shes pa gsum yin te /
translated: All sentient beings are the three consciousnesses, because they are the cause of all sentient beings.

original: de rnams sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas 'od gsal bar 'jug pa'i phyir sems can kun pa dag nyid do //
analyzed: de rnams sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas 'od gsal bar 'jug pa'i phyir sems can kun pa dag nyid do //
translated: Since those are entered into clearlight by the process of mantra and seal, they are all sentient beings.

original: dpal ni stong pa dang shin tu stong pa dang chen po stong pa rnams te /
analyzed: dpal ni stong pa dang shin tu stong pa dang chen po stong pa rnams te /
translated: Sri is emptiness, great emptiness, and supreme emptiness.

original: de dag sdud pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dpal ldan no //
analyzed: de dag sdud pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dpal ldan no //
translated: Since those are gathered together, it is the glorious.

original: thams cad stong pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir bde chen te /
analyzed: thams cad stong pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir bde chen te /
translated: Since all are the nature of emptiness, it is great bliss.

original: de la btud nas /
analyzed: de la btud nas /
translated: Having bowed to that,

original: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim bshad bya //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim bshad bya //
translated: I will explain the stage of vajra repetition.

original: zhes bya @53b ba ni snga ma bzhin te yang sbas pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya @53b ba ni snga ma bzhin te yang sbas pa yin no //
translated: As before, it is also hidden.

original: rtag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mgon po'o //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mgon po'o //
translated: Since it is eternal, it is the protector.

original: sems can thams cad kyi rgyud la yod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir sems can kun ni 'dod chags dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'dod chags bar ma rnams te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi rgyud la yod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir sems can kun ni 'dod chags dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'dod chags bar ma rnams te /
translated: Since it exists in the continuums of all sentient beings, all sentient beings are those with attachment, those without attachment, and those with middling attachment.

original: de dag bzhi pa dang lhan cig 'dres pa'i phyir sems can kun bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de dag bzhi pa dang lhan cig 'dres pa'i phyir sems can kun bdag nyid do //
translated: Since those are mixed together with the fourth, it is the nature of all sentient beings.

original: dpal ni ye shes kyi phyag rgya ste de dang snyoms par zhugs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dpal ldan no //
analyzed: dpal ni ye shes kyi phyag rgya ste de dang snyoms par zhugs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dpal ldan no //
translated: The glory is the wisdom consort, and he is endowed with glory because he is in union with her.

original: rnal 'byor pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad mas yang dag par khong du chud par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir bde chen no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad mas yang dag par khong du chud par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir bde chen no //
translated: He is great bliss because he is to be realized by the valid cognition of the yogi's direct perception.

original: de la btud nas /
analyzed: de la btud nas /
translated: Having bowed to him,

original: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim bshad bya //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim bshad bya //
translated: I will explain the stage of vajra recitation.

original: zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin te /
translated: This is as before.

original: mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: mthar thug pa'o //
translated: It is the ultimate.

original: rdo rje'i sku nyid yin pa'i phyir mgon po'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i sku nyid yin pa'i phyir mgon po'o //
translated: He is the lord because he is the vajra body.

original: sems can ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: sems can ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: Sentient beings are ultimate reality.

original: kun ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa ste /
analyzed: kun ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa ste /
translated: All is relative reality.

original: de dag tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir sems can kun bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de dag tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir sems can kun bdag nyid do //
translated: He is the nature of all sentient beings because he is the nature that is not different from them.

original: dpal ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste de dang ldan pa'i phyir dpal ldan no //
analyzed: dpal ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste de dang ldan pa'i phyir dpal ldan no //
translated: Glory is nonabiding nirvana, and he is endowed with glory because he possesses it.

original: chen po ni sems can gyi khams rnams so //
analyzed: chen po ni sems can gyi khams rnams so //
translated: Great is the realm of sentient beings.

original: bde ba ni smin pa dang grol ba la sogs pa bde ba chen po'i go 'phang thob par byed pa yin pas bde chen te /
analyzed: bde ba ni smin pa dang grol ba la sogs pa bde ba chen po'i go 'phang thob par byed pa yin pas bde chen te /
translated: Bliss is the attainment of the state of great bliss, such as the maturation and liberation, and so forth.

original: de la btud nas bshad par bya //
analyzed: de la btud nas bshad par bya //
translated: Having bowed to that great bliss, I will explain.

original: zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa kho na yin no //
translated: This is the ultimate meaning.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo nyid yin pa'i phyir mgon po'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo nyid yin pa'i phyir mgon po'o //
translated: He is the lord because he is the principal of the mandala.

original: sems can kun ni sems can gyi rigs rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: sems can kun ni sems can gyi rigs rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: All sentient beings are the four types of sentient beings.

original: de dag 'od zer gyi sbyor bas bkug ste bdag nyid la 'jug par byed pa'i phyir sems can kun bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de dag 'od zer gyi sbyor bas bkug ste bdag nyid la 'jug par byed pa'i phyir sems can kun bdag nyid do //
translated: Since he draws them in with the application of light rays and causes them to enter into himself, he is all sentient beings.

original: dpal ni spro ba ste de dang ldan pa'i phyir dpal ldan no ;
analyzed: dpal ni spro ba ste de dang ldan pa'i phyir dpal ldan no ;
translated: Glory is the emanation, and since he possesses that, he is glorious.

original: / chen po ste dkyil 'khor pa rnams bde ba ste bde ba chen po'i ting nge 'dzin skyed par byed pa de la btud nas bshad par bya zhes pa ni drang ba'i don to //
analyzed: / chen po ste dkyil 'khor pa rnams bde ba ste bde ba chen po'i ting nge 'dzin skyed par byed pa de la btud nas bshad par bya zhes pa ni drang ba'i don to //
translated: Having bowed to that great bliss, I will explain. This is the interpretable meaning.

original: ye shes lnga'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir mgon po'o //
analyzed: ye shes lnga'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir mgon po'o //
translated: He is the lord because he is the nature of the five intuitions.

original: sems can thams cad kyi gnas kyi gtso bo ni sna'i rtse mo ste de rnams su thig le'i gzugs kyis gnas pa'i phyir sems can kun bdag nyid do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi gnas kyi gtso bo ni sna'i rtse mo ste de rnams su thig le'i gzugs kyis gnas pa'i phyir sems can kun bdag nyid do //
translated: The principal place of all sentient beings is the tip of the nose, because it is located there in the form of a drop.

original: spro dang bsdu ba dang ldan pa'i phyir dpal ldan no //
analyzed: spro dang bsdu ba dang ldan pa'i phyir dpal ldan no //
translated: It is glorious because it possesses the expansion and contraction.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir bde chen no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir bde chen no //
translated: It is great bliss because it is the essence of the thought of enlightenment.

original: de la btud nas te /
analyzed: de la btud nas te /
translated: Having bowed to that,

original: dran par byas nas bshad par bya //
analyzed: dran par byas nas bshad par bya //
translated: having remembered it, one should explain it.

original: zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i don to //üîΩmgon po ni sa @54a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i don to // mgon po ni sa @54a * //
translated: This is the definitive meaning.

original: la sogs pa'i khams rnams te /
analyzed: la sogs pa'i khams rnams te /
translated: The protector is the elements of earth, etc.

original: de dag gi rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir mgon po'o //
analyzed: de dag gi rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir mgon po'o //
translated: It is the protector because it is their very nature.

original: sems can kun ni dkyil 'khor bzhi ste de rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la byin gyis rlob par byed pa nyid yin pas khyab par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir sems can kun bdag nyid do //
analyzed: sems can kun ni dkyil 'khor bzhi ste de rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la byin gyis rlob par byed pa nyid yin pas khyab par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir sems can kun bdag nyid do //
translated: It is the nature of all sentient beings because it is the pervader of the four mandalas of all sentient beings, since it is the very one that empowers the Tathagatas in them.

original: dpal ni 'od zer dmar po la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dpal ni 'od zer dmar po la sogs pa ste /
translated: Glory is the red light, etc.

original: de spro ba dang ldan pa'i phyir dpal ldan no //
analyzed: de spro ba dang ldan pa'i phyir dpal ldan no //
translated: It is glorious because it is delightful.

original: chen po ste g-yas la sogs pa'i dbye bas rgyu ba de rnams bde ba ste /
analyzed: chen po ste g-yas la sogs pa'i dbye bas rgyu ba de rnams bde ba ste /
translated: It is great, since it moves through the divisions of the right and so forth.

original: sna'i rtse mor thun phyed phyed kyi dus su 'dzin pa de ni bde chen no //
analyzed: sna'i rtse mor thun phyed phyed kyi dus su 'dzin pa de ni bde chen no //
translated: That is bliss, since it is held at the tip of the nose at the time of half a period.üîΩThat is great bliss.

original: de la btud nas te phyag 'tshal nas bshad par bya zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin te dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de la btud nas te phyag 'tshal nas bshad par bya zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin te dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
translated: Having bowed to that, having paid homage to that, it should be explained.

original: thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mgon po ste drug pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mgon po ste drug pa'o //
translated: The sixth is the Lord, since it is superior to all.

original: sems can thams cad la khyab par byed pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la khyab par byed pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes te /
translated: The gnosis of the dharmadhatu pervades all sentient beings.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir sems can kun bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir sems can kun bdag nyid do //
translated: It is the nature of that, and so it is the nature of all sentient beings.

original: dpal ni ye shes lnga ste /
analyzed: dpal ni ye shes lnga ste /
translated: Glory is the five gnoses.

original: de rnams sdud par byed pa yin pa'i phyir dpal ldan no //
analyzed: de rnams sdud par byed pa yin pa'i phyir dpal ldan no //
translated: It is glorious because it is the collector of those.

original: chen po ste rnam par shes pa lnga'i bde ba ni 'od gsal ba'i chos nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: chen po ste rnam par shes pa lnga'i bde ba ni 'od gsal ba'i chos nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'o //
translated: It is great, since the bliss of the five consciousnesses becomes the nature of the reality of clear light.

original: de la btud nas te phyag 'tshal nas bshad par bya zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin te dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la btud nas te phyag 'tshal nas bshad par bya zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin te dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Having bowed to him, i.e., having saluted him, I will explain.

original: mgon po ni byang chub rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: mgon po ni byang chub rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The Lord is the three kinds of enlightenment,

original: de thob pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mgon po'o //
analyzed: de thob pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mgon po'o //
translated: because he has attained them.

original: sems can kun ni spros pa dang bcas pa dang spros pa med pa dang / shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa rnams te /
analyzed: sems can kun ni spros pa dang bcas pa dang spros pa med pa dang / shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa rnams te /
translated: All beings are those with elaborate conduct, those with simple conduct, and those with very simple conduct.

original: de dag nyams su len pa'i phyir sems can kun bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de dag nyams su len pa'i phyir sems can kun bdag nyid do //
translated: Because he practices them, he is the embodiment of all beings.

original: dpal ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: dpal ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
translated: Glory is the accumulation of merit.

original: bde chen ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: bde chen ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //
translated: Great bliss is the accumulation of wisdom.

original: de dag dang ldan pa ni dpal ldan bde chen te /
analyzed: de dag dang ldan pa ni dpal ldan bde chen te /
translated: Endowed with them, he is the glorious great bliss.

original: de la btud nas bshad par bya //
analyzed: de la btud nas bshad par bya //
translated: Having bowed to him, I will explain.

original: zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: This is the literal meaning explanation.

original: kun ni srog ces bya ba'i rlung ngo //
analyzed: kun ni srog ces bya ba'i rlung ngo //
translated: All means the life-force wind.

original: sems can ni thur du sel ba zhes bya ba'i rlung ngo //
analyzed: sems can ni thur du sel ba zhes bya ba'i rlung ngo //
translated: Beings means the downward-voiding wind.

original: bdag nyid ni me dang mnyam pa'i rlung ngo //
analyzed: bdag nyid ni me dang mnyam pa'i rlung ngo //
translated: The self means the fire-coinciding wind.

original: mgon po ni gyen du rgyu ba'i rlung ngo //
analyzed: mgon po ni gyen du rgyu ba'i rlung ngo //
translated: The protector is the upward moving wind.

original: dpal ni khyab byed kyi rlung ngo //
analyzed: dpal ni khyab byed kyi rlung ngo //
translated: The glory is the pervading wind.

original: de rnams kyi de kho na nyid yongs su shes pa'i phyir bde chen no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi de kho na nyid yongs su shes pa'i phyir bde chen no //
translated: Because of the thorough knowledge of their reality, there is great bliss.üîΩHaving bowed to that, having paid homage, it is to be explained.

original: de la btud nas te phyag 'tshal nas bshad par bya zhes pa ni sgra ji bzhin pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la btud nas te phyag 'tshal nas bshad par bya zhes pa ni sgra ji bzhin pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: This is not the literal meaning.

original: 'o na rdo rje bzlas pa zhes @54b bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rdo rje bzlas pa zhes @54b bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is the meaning of the term ‚Äúvajra repetition‚Äù?

original: rdo rje tshig ni sgra spangs pa'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir rlung tsam gyi bzlas pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje tshig ni sgra spangs pa'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir rlung tsam gyi bzlas pa ste /
translated: It is the repetition of just the wind, because it is said, ‚ÄúVajra speech is free from sound.‚Äù

original: yang dang yang du 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis sems dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: yang dang yang du 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis sems dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: It is the control of the mind by the process of repeatedly inhaling and so on.

original: rnal 'byor rgyud ces bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
analyzed: rnal 'byor rgyud ces bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the term ‚Äúyoga tantra‚Äù?

original: 'dus pa'i rgyud phyi ma las /
analyzed: 'dus pa'i rgyud phyi ma las /
translated: The Continuation of the Guhyasamaja Tantra says:

original: thabs dang shes rab snyoms 'jug pa //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab snyoms 'jug pa //
translated: The union of method and wisdom

original: rnal 'byor zhes ni mngon par brjod //
analyzed: rnal 'byor zhes ni mngon par brjod //
translated: Is called yoga.

original: ces 'byung ba'i phyir de gtso bor gyur pa'i rgyud ni rnal 'byor rgyud de /
analyzed: ces 'byung ba'i phyir de gtso bor gyur pa'i rgyud ni rnal 'byor rgyud de /
translated: Because of this, a tantra in which that is primary is a yoga tantra.

original: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Yoga Tantras are the Sri-Vairocanabhisambodhi, the Sri-Vajra- catuh-pitha, the Sri-Vajra-shikhin, the Sri-Vajra-guhya, the Sri-Vajra- amala, the Sri-Guhya-samaja, and so on.

original: rgyud ni rgyun te /
analyzed: rgyud ni rgyun te /
translated: A Tantra is a continuum.

original: de yang rgyu'i rgyud dang 'bras bu'i rgyud dang / thabs kyi rgyud ces bya ba rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de yang rgyu'i rgyud dang 'bras bu'i rgyud dang / thabs kyi rgyud ces bya ba rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: It is of three kinds: the causal continuum, the resultant continuum, and the continuum of the means.

original: de la rgyu'i rgyud ni tshangs pa'i gnas pa la sogs pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo la sogs pa ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la rgyu'i rgyud ni tshangs pa'i gnas pa la sogs pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo la sogs pa ston par byed pa'o //
translated: The causal continuum is that which teaches the Brahma-viharas, the doors of liberation, and so on.

original: 'bras bu'i rgyud ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la sogs pa ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rgyud ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la sogs pa ston par byed pa'o //
translated: The resultant continuum is that which teaches the mandala- wheel of the Tathagatas, and so on.üîΩThe continuum of the means is that which teaches the mantras, the mudras, and so on.üîΩHaving understood the Yoga Tantras in this way, I will explain them.

original: thabs kyi rgyud ni sngags dang phyag rgya la sogs pa ston par byed pa de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi rnal 'byor rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs te yang dag par rtogs nas bshad par bya zhes bya ba 'dis ni lung tshad ma yin par bstan pa'i phyirüîΩ/ gang gi 'dod pa tsam yin pa 'gog cing /
analyzed: thabs kyi rgyud ni sngags dang phyag rgya la sogs pa ston par byed pa de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi rnal 'byor rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs te yang dag par rtogs nas bshad par bya zhes bya ba 'dis ni lung tshad ma yin par bstan pa'i phyirüîΩ/ gang gi 'dod pa tsam yin pa 'gog cing /
translated: This shows that the Yoga Tantras are valid scriptures.

original: bdag nyid kyang mang du thos pa nyid yin par ston par byed do //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang mang du thos pa nyid yin par ston par byed do //
translated: He also shows himself to be one who has heard much.

original: da ni gang gi dbang du byas pa dpyad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni gang gi dbang du byas pa dpyad pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to analyze who is the one for whom this is composed,üîΩhe says:

original: bskyed pa'i rim la legs gnas shing //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim la legs gnas shing //
translated: For those who are well-established in the creation stage

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa 'dod rnams kyi //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa 'dod rnams kyi //
translated: and desire the completion stage,

original: thabs 'di rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis //
analyzed: thabs 'di rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis //
translated: this method was taught by the perfect Buddha

original: skas kyi rim pa lta bur gsungs //
analyzed: skas kyi rim pa lta bur gsungs //
translated: like the steps of a staircase.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te re zhig sgrub pa pos dang por dang po'i rnal 'byor la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi rim pas sam /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te re zhig sgrub pa pos dang por dang po'i rnal 'byor la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi rim pas sam /
translated: First, the practitioner, by the sequence of the three samadhis beginning with the first yoga,

original: rdo rje bzhi po'i rim pas lha'i rnam par bskyed nas /
analyzed: rdo rje bzhi po'i rim pas lha'i rnam par bskyed nas /
translated: or by the sequence of the four vajras, generates the deity's form.

original: rigs brgya'i rab tu dbye bas lus rnam par dben pa la 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: rigs brgya'i rab tu dbye bas lus rnam par dben pa la 'jug par byed do //
translated: Then, through the classification of the hundred families, he enters into the isolation of the body.

original: de'i rjes la phul du byung ba thob par gyur nas lha'i sku shin tu gsal ba 'bad pa med pa kho nar mthong zhing 'gro ba yang de'i rnam pa kho nar mthong ba gang yin pa de rnams ni bskyed pa'i rim la legs gnas te /
analyzed: de'i rjes la phul du byung ba thob par gyur nas lha'i sku shin tu gsal ba 'bad pa med pa kho nar mthong zhing 'gro ba yang de'i rnam pa kho nar mthong ba gang yin pa de rnams ni bskyed pa'i rim la legs gnas te /
translated: After that, having attained the excellent, seeing only the very clear divine body without effort, and also seeing only that form when going, those who are well-established in the creation stage

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: have the meaning of the term ‚Äúperfection of the creation stage.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir bskyed pa'i rim pa la legs par gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'das pa'i dus las gyur pa'i rkyen sbyar te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bskyed pa'i rim pa la legs par gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'das pa'i dus las gyur pa'i rkyen sbyar te /
translated: Because they will be well-established in the creation stage, the condition that arises from the past is applied.

original: des na don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na don ni 'di yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning.

original: @55a * // bskyed pa'i rim pa mthar phyin par gyur pa la legs par gnas pa rnams so //
analyzed: @55a * // bskyed pa'i rim pa mthar phyin par gyur pa la legs par gnas pa rnams so //
translated: Those who are well-established in the perfection of the creation stage.

original: de lta bu'i rnal 'byor pa rnams gal te rdzogs pa'i rim pa ste spros pa med pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ngo bo'i rim pa 'dod cing mngon par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnal 'byor pa rnams gal te rdzogs pa'i rim pa ste spros pa med pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ngo bo'i rim pa 'dod cing mngon par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: If such yogis desire and wish for the completion stage, the stage of the unelaborated, nonconceptual nature,

original: rnal 'byor pa de rnams kyi thabs 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa de rnams kyi thabs 'di lta ste /
translated: then the method for those yogis is as follows.

original: bsgom pa'i rim pa rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis te de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsungs pa ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i rim pa rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis te de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsungs pa ni bstan pa'o //
translated: The stage of meditation taught by the perfect Buddhas, that is, the Tathagatas, is the teaching.

original: skas kyi rim pa lta bu ni 'dzeg pa'i lam lta bu ste /
analyzed: skas kyi rim pa lta bu ni 'dzeg pa'i lam lta bu ste /
translated: Like the steps of a ladder, it is like the path of ascent.

original: ji ltar skas kyi rim ba'i lam nas 'dzeg pa'i skyes bu ni rim gyis khang bzangs la sogs pa'i rtse mo mthon por phyin par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar skas kyi rim ba'i lam nas 'dzeg pa'i skyes bu ni rim gyis khang bzangs la sogs pa'i rtse mo mthon por phyin par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as a person ascending by the path of the steps of a ladder will gradually reach the high peak of a palace, etc.,

original: rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pa bsgoms pas rim gyis ngag la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i rim gyis rtag tu dgyes pa'i rang bzhin gyi rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang mi slob pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin gyi chos kyi sku'i ngo bo thob
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pa bsgoms pas rim gyis ngag la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i rim gyis rtag tu dgyes pa'i rang bzhin gyi rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang mi slob pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin gyi chos kyi sku'i ngo bo thob
translated: in the same way, by meditating on the stages of vajra repetition, etc., one will gradually reach the stage of the nature of permanent bliss, the stage of Great Vajradhara, the essence of the Dharmakaya, the nature of the path of no learning.

original: bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas smos pa ni lung tshad ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir te sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas smos pa ni lung tshad ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir te sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: The mention of the perfect Buddhas is to show that this is a valid scripture, and it is to be taken literally.

original: da ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'i rten rlung gi tshogs gang yin pa de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'i rten rlung gi tshogs gang yin pa de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the collection of winds that are the basis of the stage of vajra repetition, it says:

original: sems can rnams kyi srog gyur pa //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi srog gyur pa //
translated: The life of sentient beings,

original: rlung zhes bya ba las kun byed //
analyzed: rlung zhes bya ba las kun byed //
translated: the wind called ‚Äúall activity.‚Äù

original: de ni rnam shes bzhon pa ste //
analyzed: de ni rnam shes bzhon pa ste //
translated: It is the mount of consciousness,

original: lnga yi bdag nyid bcu yang yin //
analyzed: lnga yi bdag nyid bcu yang yin //
translated: fivefold, and also tenfold.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs pa'i don ni 'di yin te /üîΩsnying ga na gnas pa'i srog ces bya ba'i rlung gcig pu kha dang sna dag las phyi rol du byung ba'i ngang tshul can 'jag mig gi srin bu nas brtsams te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs pa'i don ni 'di yin te / snying ga na gnas pa'i srog ces bya ba'i rlung gcig pu kha dang sna dag las phyi rol du byung ba'i ngang tshul can 'jag mig gi srin bu nas brtsams te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar gyi 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad la khyab par byed pa ni srog yin no //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar gyi 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad la khyab par byed pa ni srog yin no //
translated: The one wind called ‚Äúlife‚Äù that abides in the heart has the nature of flowing out through the mouth and nose. It pervades the entire world system, from the insects in the grass up to the peak of existence. It is life.

original: de ji lta bu zhe na sems can rnams kyi ste sems can gyi rigs rnam pa bzhi'i srog gyur pa ni srog gi dbang po dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de ji lta bu zhe na sems can rnams kyi ste sems can gyi rigs rnam pa bzhi'i srog gyur pa ni srog gi dbang po dang 'dra'o //
translated: How is it so? It is the life of sentient beings, like the faculty of life of the four types of sentient beings.

original: ci 'di 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi nang nas gcig yin nam /
analyzed: ci 'di 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi nang nas gcig yin nam /
translated: Is it one of the great elements?

original: 'on te thams cad kyi bdag nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te thams cad kyi bdag nyid yin zhe na /
translated: Or is it the nature of all?

original: rlung zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rlung zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says ‚Äúwind‚Äù

original: rlung ni 'byung ba chen po'i ngo bo 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dang brkyang ba dang bskum pa'i mtshan nyid kyi las can yin no //
analyzed: rlung ni 'byung ba chen po'i ngo bo 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dang brkyang ba dang bskum pa'i mtshan nyid kyi las can yin no //
translated: Wind has the nature of the great elements and the function of moving out and in and of extending and contracting.

original: gal te de ltar na phyi rol gyi rlung yang de lta bu kho na yin te /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na phyi rol gyi rlung yang de lta bu kho na yin te /
translated: If that is so, then external wind is just like that.üîΩSince it is similar to that, why is it not apprehended?

original: de yang de dang mtshungs pa yin pas ci'i phyir gzung bar mi bya snyam @55b pa'i dgos pa bsus nas rnam shes bzhon pa ste zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de yang de dang mtshungs pa yin pas ci'i phyir gzung bar mi bya snyam @55b pa'i dgos pa bsus nas rnam shes bzhon pa ste zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Having anticipated that with, ‚ÄúThe consciousness is its mount,‚Äù he says,

original: rnam par shes pa ni don mthong ba'i mtshan nyid can yin zhing de ni rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni don mthong ba'i mtshan nyid can yin zhing de ni rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: Consciousness has the characteristic of seeing objects and it is of eight types:

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug go //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug go //
translated: the consciousness of the ground of all, the afflicted mentality, and the six active consciousnesses.

original: de rnams kyi bzhon pa ni skul par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi bzhon pa ni skul par byed pa ste /
translated: Its mount is that which impels it,

original: rta dang rta la zhon pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rta dang rta la zhon pa bzhin no //
translated: like a horse and its rider.

original: 'di ltar 'byung ba chen po lnga'i bdag nyid can gyi lus kyi nang na gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa brgyad po gang yin pa de las ma gtogs pa bya ba gzhan mi dmigs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'byung ba chen po lnga'i bdag nyid can gyi lus kyi nang na gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa brgyad po gang yin pa de las ma gtogs pa bya ba gzhan mi dmigs te /
translated: As it is said:

original: de la don mthong rnam par shes //
analyzed: de la don mthong rnam par shes //
translated: Consciousness sees objects.

original: de yi khyad par sems las byung //üîΩzhes gang bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de yi khyad par sems las byung // zhes gang bshad pa'o //
translated: Its specific states are mental factors.

original: chos mngon pa las /üîΩrnam shes ngar sems bdag nyid can //
analyzed: chos mngon pa las / rnam shes ngar sems bdag nyid can //
translated: And in the Abhidharma it is said:

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Consciousness is the nature of self-grasping.

original: de bas na rtog pa 'ba' zhig gi rang bzhin can de ni ji srid rlung gi khams kyis bskul bar ma byas pa de srid du de la don 'dzin pa'i nus pa med de /
analyzed: de bas na rtog pa 'ba' zhig gi rang bzhin can de ni ji srid rlung gi khams kyis bskul bar ma byas pa de srid du de la don 'dzin pa'i nus pa med de /
translated: Therefore, as long as the nature of mere conceptualization is not activated by the wind element, it has no capacity to apprehend objects.

original: grum pos rta med par yul gzhan du phyin pa med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: grum pos rta med par yul gzhan du phyin pa med pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like a lame person who cannot go to another place without a horse.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni rlung gis bskul nas don 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni rlung gis bskul nas don 'dzin par byed do //
translated: Therefore, it is only when activated by the wind element that it apprehends objects.

original: gal te rlung gis bskul nas rnam par shes pa don 'dzin gyi rang nyid kyis ma yin na ji ltar mdo dang 'gal ba ma yin /
analyzed: gal te rlung gis bskul nas rnam par shes pa don 'dzin gyi rang nyid kyis ma yin na ji ltar mdo dang 'gal ba ma yin /
translated: If it is the wind that is the cause of the apprehension of objects, and not the consciousness itself, how is this not a contradiction with the sutras?

original: bzang skyong gis zhus pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: bzang skyong gis zhus pa'i mdo las /
translated: In the Bhadrakalpita-vy≈´ha-s≈´tra,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: the BhagavƒÅn said:

original: bzang skyong ji ltar bya ba'i mthus 'khrul 'khor 'khor ba de bzhin du las dang rjes su mthun pa'i dbang gis lus kyi 'khrul 'khor g-yo'o //
analyzed: bzang skyong ji ltar bya ba'i mthus 'khrul 'khor 'khor ba de bzhin du las dang rjes su mthun pa'i dbang gis lus kyi 'khrul 'khor g-yo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBhadrapƒÅla, just as a machine moves through the power of its mechanism, in the same way, through the power of karma, the machine of the body moves.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ni rten dang 'jug pa sna tshogs pa can yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ni rten dang 'jug pa sna tshogs pa can yin no //
translated: This consciousness element has various supports and functions.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ni lus skyed par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir byed pa po yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ni lus skyed par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir byed pa po yin no //
translated: This consciousness element is the agent because it is the producer of the body.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ni chos kyi dbyings la brten pa'i phyir mi zad pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ni chos kyi dbyings la brten pa'i phyir mi zad pa yin no //
translated: This consciousness element is inexhaustible because it is based on the realm of phenomena.

original: sngon gyi rten gyi lus rjes su dran pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ni blo phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon gyi rten gyi lus rjes su dran pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ni blo phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: This element of consciousness is a perfect intellect because it is the memory of the body of the previous existence.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ni nyi ma'i 'od zer dang mtshungs par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ni nyi ma'i 'od zer dang mtshungs par blta bar bya ste /
translated: This element of consciousness should be seen as similar to the rays of the sun.

original: dper na nyi ma'i 'od zer ni phyis dang ro rul ba ste dri mi zhim pa rnams dang / padma la sogs pa'i dri zhim po rnams la yang 'char te de rnams la @56a * //
analyzed: dper na nyi ma'i 'od zer ni phyis dang ro rul ba ste dri mi zhim pa rnams dang / padma la sogs pa'i dri zhim po rnams la yang 'char te de rnams la @56a * //
translated: For example, the rays of the sun shine on feces, urine, pus, and rotten flesh, which are foul-smelling, and on the sweet fragrance of lotuses and so on.

original: 'di ni dri zhim pa'o snyam pa'i 'du shes kyang mi 'byung zhing /
analyzed: 'di ni dri zhim pa'o snyam pa'i 'du shes kyang mi 'byung zhing /
translated: The sun does not have the notion, ‚ÄúI am fragrant‚Äù or ‚ÄúI am foul-smelling.‚Äù

original: dri mi zhim pa bor nas nyi ma'i gam du 'gro ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dri mi zhim pa bor nas nyi ma'i gam du 'gro ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor does the sun abandon the foul-smelling and go to the fragrant.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ni phag la sogs pa mi gtsang ba'i tshogs za ba'i skye gnas su skye ba len te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ni phag la sogs pa mi gtsang ba'i tshogs za ba'i skye gnas su skye ba len te /
translated: In the same way, this element of consciousness takes rebirth in the wombs of pigs and so on, which are born from the accumulation of impurities.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams nyes pa de rnams kyis gos pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang bshad pa'o zhe na bden te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams nyes pa de rnams kyis gos pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang bshad pa'o zhe na bden te /
translated: The elements are not defiled by those faults, nor is the consciousness element.

original: de ni mdo dang 'gal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni mdo dang 'gal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But this is not contradictory to the sutra.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pas lus g-yo bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pas lus g-yo bar byed pa yin te /
translated: Because the sutra says that consciousness moves the body,

original: de yang rlung gi bzhon pa dang ldan par gyur pas yin no zhes bya ba'i khyad par gyi rjes su 'brang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de yang rlung gi bzhon pa dang ldan par gyur pas yin no zhes bya ba'i khyad par gyi rjes su 'brang bar bya'o //
translated: and that is due to the wind constituent that is its mount.

original: 'on te 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe ji ltar 'byung ba chen po lnga dang bral ba skye gnas gzhan du 'khyam par gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe ji ltar 'byung ba chen po lnga dang bral ba skye gnas gzhan du 'khyam par gyur te /
translated: But if you say that at the time of death, when the body is separated from the five great elements, it wanders to another place of birth,

original: de'i tshe rlung med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer na de skad du brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe rlung med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer na de skad du brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: then at that time there is no wind.

original: dri za ni dbang po'i tshogs phra mo dang ldan pa kho na yin te 'ba' zhig ni ma yin la /
analyzed: dri za ni dbang po'i tshogs phra mo dang ldan pa kho na yin te 'ba' zhig ni ma yin la /
translated: This is not the case, because the gandharva is only endowed with a subtle collection of faculties, not alone.

original: dbang po'i tshogs phra mo'i nang du 'dus pa'i lus kyi dbang po ni khams bzhi'i rang bzhin can nyid yin pas rlung yod pa de'i phyir des skul bar byed do //
analyzed: dbang po'i tshogs phra mo'i nang du 'dus pa'i lus kyi dbang po ni khams bzhi'i rang bzhin can nyid yin pas rlung yod pa de'i phyir des skul bar byed do //
translated: The body faculty, which is included in the collection of subtle matter, is composed of the four elements, and since wind exists, it is that which impels.

original: yang na 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gi bag chags dag gis rig sngags kyi chu mig la sprul bzhin du skul bar byed do //
analyzed: yang na 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gi bag chags dag gis rig sngags kyi chu mig la sprul bzhin du skul bar byed do //
translated: Or, it is impelled by the latent impressions of attachment and aversion, just as a spring of magic spells is impelled.

original: dbyig gnyen gyi zhal snga nas kyis de'i tshe dri za rjes su chags pa'i khong khro ba dang lhan cig par gyur pa'i sems gnyis po dag las gang yang rung ba zhig mngon du gyur pa yin no zhes gang bshad pa'o //
analyzed: dbyig gnyen gyi zhal snga nas kyis de'i tshe dri za rjes su chags pa'i khong khro ba dang lhan cig par gyur pa'i sems gnyis po dag las gang yang rung ba zhig mngon du gyur pa yin no zhes gang bshad pa'o //
translated: Vasubandhu explains that at that time, either of the two minds that are accompanied by the desire and anger of the gandharva is actualized.

original: yang las kyi rlung gis bskul ba na 'gro ba drug tu 'khyam par 'gyur ba las 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: yang las kyi rlung gis bskul ba na 'gro ba drug tu 'khyam par 'gyur ba las 'gal ba med do //
translated: There is no contradiction in the statement that when impelled by the karma-vƒÅyu, it wanders in the six destinies.

original: de'i phyir srog ces bya ba'i rlung 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i bzhon pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir srog ces bya ba'i rlung 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i bzhon pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this vƒÅyu called ‚Äúlife‚Äù is the mount of consciousness.

original: de ni phung po'i dbye bas lnga'i bdag nyid de srog dang / thur du sel ba dang me dang mnyam du gnas pa dang gyen du rgyu ba dang / khyab byed ces bya ba rnam pa lnga yin no //
analyzed: de ni phung po'i dbye bas lnga'i bdag nyid de srog dang / thur du sel ba dang me dang mnyam du gnas pa dang gyen du rgyu ba dang / khyab byed ces bya ba rnam pa lnga yin no //
translated: It is fivefold by way of the divisions of the aggregates, and is of the nature of life, downward-voiding, fire, upward-moving, and pervading.

original: de la srog ni snying ga'i phyogs na gnas pa'o //üîΩthur du sel ba ni bshang sgo na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de la srog ni snying ga'i phyogs na gnas pa'o // thur du sel ba ni bshang sgo na gnas pa'o //
translated: Life is located in the region of the heart.üîΩThe downward-voiding is located in the anus.

original: gyen du rgyu ba ni lkog ma na gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gyen du rgyu ba ni lkog ma na gnas pa yin no //
translated: The upward-moving is located in the throat.

original: me dang mnyam du gnas pa ni lte ba'i phyogs na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: me dang mnyam du gnas pa ni lte ba'i phyogs na gnas pa'o //
translated: The fire is located in the region of the navel.

original: khyab byed ni yan lag gi tshigs thams cad la gnas pa @56b ste de ni gnas kyi dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: khyab byed ni yan lag gi tshigs thams cad la gnas pa @56b ste de ni gnas kyi dbye ba yin no //
translated: The pervading is located in all the joints of the limbs. This is the division of locations.

original: mi bskyod pa dang rin chen 'byung ldan dang 'od dpag tu med pa dang don yod grub pa dang / rnam par snang mdzad kyi ngo bo zhes bya ba ni lha nyid yin no //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa dang rin chen 'byung ldan dang 'od dpag tu med pa dang don yod grub pa dang / rnam par snang mdzad kyi ngo bo zhes bya ba ni lha nyid yin no //
translated: The gods are called Ak·π£obhya, Ratnasa·πÉbhava, AmitƒÅbha, Amoghasiddhi, and Vairocana.

original: dbang po'i sgo'i rgyun las ni //
analyzed: dbang po'i sgo'i rgyun las ni //
translated: From the stream of the sense doors,

original: srog dang rtsol bar rgyu ba dang // rtag pa'i dus su rgyu ba ni //üîΩsrog ces bya ba yin par bshad //
analyzed: srog dang rtsol bar rgyu ba dang // rtag pa'i dus su rgyu ba ni // srog ces bya ba yin par bshad //
translated: The life-force and the downward-voiding [vƒÅyu] are said to be the life-force.

original: rlung dang gcin dang phyis dang // de bzhin du ni khu ba sogs //
analyzed: rlung dang gcin dang phyis dang // de bzhin du ni khu ba sogs //
translated: The upward-moving [vƒÅyu] is explained as the life-force.

original: 'og 'dren 'di ni thur sel bar //üîΩrtag tu rnal 'byor pas zhes bya //
analyzed: 'og 'dren 'di ni thur sel bar // rtag tu rnal 'byor pas zhes bya //
translated: The downward-voiding [vƒÅyu] is said to be the downward-voiding [vƒÅyu].

original: dgod dang za dang ldag pa dang // kun du 'thung dang 'jib par ni //üîΩgang zhig rtag tu mnyam gnas pa //
analyzed: dgod dang za dang ldag pa dang // kun du 'thung dang 'jib par ni // gang zhig rtag tu mnyam gnas pa //
translated: The yogƒ´ should always know the downward-voiding [vƒÅyu].

original: mnyam du gnas zhes bya ba yin ;üîΩ/ gyen du 'gro zhing sdud ba dang // bza' dang myang sogs za ba ni //
analyzed: mnyam du gnas zhes bya ba yin ; / gyen du 'gro zhing sdud ba dang // bza' dang myang sogs za ba ni //
translated: The upward-moving [vƒÅyu] is said to be the upward-moving [vƒÅyu].

original: shes dang lhan cig rnal 'byor rig / gyen rgyu'i las su shes par bya //
analyzed: shes dang lhan cig rnal 'byor rig / gyen rgyu'i las su shes par bya //
translated: The yogƒ´ should always know the upward-moving [vƒÅyu].

original: khyab dang 'dzin pa nyid dang ni //üîΩ'gro ba de bzhin ldog pa dang // tshigs rnams kun du khyab pas na //üîΩkhyab byed ces ni bya bar bshad //
analyzed: khyab dang 'dzin pa nyid dang ni // 'gro ba de bzhin ldog pa dang // tshigs rnams kun du khyab pas na // khyab byed ces ni bya bar bshad //
translated: The pervading [vƒÅyu] is said to be the pervading [vƒÅyu].üîΩThe yogƒ´ should always know the pervading [vƒÅyu].

original: ces bya ba ni las kyi dbye ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni las kyi dbye ba'o //
translated: The equalizing [vƒÅyu] is said to be the equalizing [vƒÅyu].üîΩThe yogƒ´ should always know the equalizing [vƒÅyu].

original: srog ni sngon po de bzhin du //
analyzed: srog ni sngon po de bzhin du //
translated: The life-force [vƒÅyu] is blue.

original: thur sel kha dog ser por bsgrags //
analyzed: thur sel kha dog ser por bsgrags //
translated: The downward-clearing is declared to be yellow.

original: me dang mnyam nas dmar po ste //
analyzed: me dang mnyam nas dmar po ste //
translated: The equalizing of fire is red,

original: de bzhin gyen rgyu ljang gur brjod //
analyzed: de bzhin gyen rgyu ljang gur brjod //
translated: and likewise the upward-moving is said to be green.

original: khyab byed rlung ni dkar pa'am //
analyzed: khyab byed rlung ni dkar pa'am //
translated: The pervading wind is white,

original: zla ba bzhin du ser skyar brjod //
analyzed: zla ba bzhin du ser skyar brjod //
translated: or is said to be pale yellow like the moon.

original: srog ni kun gzhi'i rnam shes te //
analyzed: srog ni kun gzhi'i rnam shes te //
translated: The life-force is the all-base consciousness,

original: nyon mongs can yid thur sel yin //
analyzed: nyon mongs can yid thur sel yin //
translated: the afflicted mind is the downward-clearing,

original: me mnyam yid kyi rnam par shes //
analyzed: me mnyam yid kyi rnam par shes //
translated: the equalizing of fire is the mental consciousness,

original: gyen rgyu'i yid kyi dbang po ste //
analyzed: gyen rgyu'i yid kyi dbang po ste //
translated: the upward-moving is the mental faculty,

original: 'jug pa'i rnam shes rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam shes rang bzhin no //
translated: and the engaging consciousness is its nature.

original: khyab byed rlung zhes bya ba yin //
analyzed: khyab byed rlung zhes bya ba yin //
translated: The so-called pervading wind

original: srog ni rnam shes phung po ste //
analyzed: srog ni rnam shes phung po ste //
translated: is the aggregate of consciousness,

original: thur sel tshor ba yin par brjod //
analyzed: thur sel tshor ba yin par brjod //
translated: and the downward-clearing is said to be feeling.

original: me dang mnyam nas 'du shes te //
analyzed: me dang mnyam nas 'du shes te //
translated: The equalizing of fire is discernment,

original: 'du byed gyen rgyur rnam par bshad //
analyzed: 'du byed gyen rgyur rnam par bshad //
translated: and formation is explained as the upward-moving.

original: gzugs kyi phung po dag pas ni //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po dag pas ni //
translated: By the purity of the aggregate of form,

original: khyab byed kun du brjod pa yin //
analyzed: khyab byed kun du brjod pa yin //
translated: the pervading is said to be all-pervading.

original: nyin dang mtshan du lus las ni //
analyzed: nyin dang mtshan du lus las ni //
translated: Day and night, from the body,üîΩon the left, on the right, on both,

original: g-yon dang g-yas dang gnyi ga dang // dal dang gnyi ga dag tu ni //
analyzed: g-yon dang g-yas dang gnyi ga dang // dal dang gnyi ga dag tu ni //
translated: slowly, and on both,

original: de rnams rgyu bar yang dag brjod //
analyzed: de rnams rgyu bar yang dag brjod //
translated: They are said to move in the five.

original: 'chi ba'i dus su lnga pa ni //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus su lnga pa ni //
translated: At the time of death, the fifth

original: shi ba'i lus las 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: shi ba'i lus las 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: arises from the body of the dead.

original: chu yi khams ni srog rlung ste //
analyzed: chu yi khams ni srog rlung ste //
translated: The water element is the life-force wind.

original: sa ni thur du sel bar 'dod //
analyzed: sa ni thur du sel bar 'dod //
translated: Earth is considered to be downward-voiding.

original: me yi khams ni gyen rgyu yin //
analyzed: me yi khams ni gyen rgyu yin //
translated: The fire element is the upward-moving wind.

original: me dang mnyam gnas rlung zhes brjod //
analyzed: me dang mnyam gnas rlung zhes brjod //
translated: Fire and space are called the equalizing wind.

original: nam mkha'i khams ni dag pa yin //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams ni dag pa yin //
translated: The space element is pure.

original: khyab byed yan lag tshigs kun @57a * //
analyzed: khyab byed yan lag tshigs kun @57a * //
translated: The pervading wind is in all the limbs and joints.

original: gnas ; / de rnams zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang dbang dang dgug pa dang las thams cad pa ste des ni rang bzhin pa dang dus dang bya ba bshad do //
analyzed: gnas ; / de rnams zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang dbang dang dgug pa dang las thams cad pa ste des ni rang bzhin pa dang dus dang bya ba bshad do //
translated: Those are the pacifying, increasing, controlling, summoning, and all-activity winds.

original: srog ces bya ba'i rlung de nyid rnam pa bcur 'gyur te sngar bshad pa rnam pa lnga dang / dbang po'i dbye bas rgyu ba dang / rnam par rgyu ba dang ; yang dag par rgyu ba dang / rab tu rgyu ba dang / nges par rgyu ba zhes bya ba gzhan lnga'o //
analyzed: srog ces bya ba'i rlung de nyid rnam pa bcur 'gyur te sngar bshad pa rnam pa lnga dang / dbang po'i dbye bas rgyu ba dang / rnam par rgyu ba dang ; yang dag par rgyu ba dang / rab tu rgyu ba dang / nges par rgyu ba zhes bya ba gzhan lnga'o //
translated: That life-force wind itself has ten aspects: the five previously explained and, by the division of the faculties, the moving, fully moving, perfectly moving, well moving, and definitely moving winds.

original: de la rgyu ba zhes bya ba'i rlung ni mig gi dbang po la brten nas gzugs kyi bya ba rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: de la rgyu ba zhes bya ba'i rlung ni mig gi dbang po la brten nas gzugs kyi bya ba rdzogs par byed do //
translated: The wind called ‚Äúmoving‚Äù causes the function of form to be completed in dependence on the eye faculty.

original: rnam par rgyu ba ni rna ba la brten nas sgra'i bya ba byed do //üîΩyang dag par rgyu ba ni sna'i dbang po la brten nas dri'i bya ba byed do //
analyzed: rnam par rgyu ba ni rna ba la brten nas sgra'i bya ba byed do // yang dag par rgyu ba ni sna'i dbang po la brten nas dri'i bya ba byed do //
translated: The wind called ‚Äúmoving about‚Äù causes the function of sound to be completed in dependence on the ear.üîΩThe wind called ‚Äúmoving properly‚Äù causes the function of smell to be completed in dependence on the nose faculty.

original: rab tu rgyu ba ni lce'i dbang po la brten nas ro'i bya ba byed do //
analyzed: rab tu rgyu ba ni lce'i dbang po la brten nas ro'i bya ba byed do //
translated: The wind called ‚Äúmoving well‚Äù causes the function of taste to be completed in dependence on the tongue faculty.

original: nges par rgyu ba zhes bya ba'i rlung ni lus kyi dbang po la brten nas reg bya'i bya ba byed do //
analyzed: nges par rgyu ba zhes bya ba'i rlung ni lus kyi dbang po la brten nas reg bya'i bya ba byed do //
translated: The wind called ‚Äúmoving definitely‚Äù causes the function of tactility to be completed in dependence on the body faculty.

original: yang de rnams thams cad ni mig dang rna ba dang yid la byed pa dang / gzugs rnams kyi tshogs la brten nas mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams skyed par byed do //
analyzed: yang de rnams thams cad ni mig dang rna ba dang yid la byed pa dang / gzugs rnams kyi tshogs la brten nas mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams skyed par byed do //
translated: All of them generate the eye consciousnesses and so forth in dependence on the collection of eyes, ears, mental activity, and forms.

original: de ltar na rlung gcig kho na lnga dang bcu nyid du gyur nas rnam par shes pa skul bar byed pas ni gar byed pa'i gnas kyi 'khor ba las rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rgyan blangs te 'khor ba na gnas pa'i gar mkhan rnams gar byed du bcug
analyzed: de ltar na rlung gcig kho na lnga dang bcu nyid du gyur nas rnam par shes pa skul bar byed pas ni gar byed pa'i gnas kyi 'khor ba las rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rgyan blangs te 'khor ba na gnas pa'i gar mkhan rnams gar byed du bcug
translated: Having taken up various ornaments from the wheel of the abode of dance, it causes the dancers who abide in cyclic existence to dance.

original: ste / gtsang ma'i gnas ni ma gtogs par //
analyzed: ste / gtsang ma'i gnas ni ma gtogs par //
translated: Except for the pure abodes,

original: sna tshogs las ni rgyan ldan pas //üîΩgang du gar ni ma byas pa'i //
analyzed: sna tshogs las ni rgyan ldan pas // gang du gar ni ma byas pa'i //
translated: endowed with various karmic ornaments,üîΩthere is no place

original: gar gyi gnas ni 'ga' yang med //
analyzed: gar gyi gnas ni 'ga' yang med //
translated: where dance is not performed.

original: ces gang brjod pa'o //
analyzed: ces gang brjod pa'o //
translated: This is what is said.

original: de ltar rdo rje bzlas pa'i rten bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rdo rje bzlas pa'i rten bstan nas /
translated: Having thus explained the basis of vajra repetition,

original: da ni go rims bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: da ni go rims bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: now, in order to explain the sequence,üîΩit is said:

original: rlung gi de nyid rim gyis ni //
analyzed: rlung gi de nyid rim gyis ni //
translated: The reality of wind graduallyüîΩengages the reality of mantra.

original: sngags kyi de nyid yang dag 'jug / sngags kyi rdzogs pa rtogs nas ni //
analyzed: sngags kyi de nyid yang dag 'jug / sngags kyi rdzogs pa rtogs nas ni //
translated: Having realized the perfection of mantra,

original: rdo rje bzlas pa rnams la slob //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa rnams la slob //
translated: one trains in vajra repetition.

original: ces gsungs pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: ces gsungs pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: rlung lnga dang nye ba'i rlung lnga'i de kho na nyid gang yin pa de ni don dam pa'o //
analyzed: rlung lnga dang nye ba'i rlung lnga'i de kho na nyid gang yin pa de ni don dam pa'o //
translated: The reality of the five winds and the five subsidiary winds is the ultimate.

original: de'i rim gyis te go rims kyi sngags a'a li dang k'a lis bskyed pa'i yi ge gsum gyi rang bzhin can rnams kyi de nyid da /
analyzed: de'i rim gyis te go rims kyi sngags a'a li dang k'a lis bskyed pa'i yi ge gsum gyi rang bzhin can rnams kyi de nyid da /
translated: By their sequence, in the order of the three syllables generated by the vowels and consonants, they are of the nature of the three syllables.

original: de bzhin nyid la yang dag par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la yang dag par 'jug pa'o //
translated: They enter into reality, into thusness.

original: de nas yi ge gsum gyi rang bzhin du gcig pa'i sngags rnams kyi rdzogs pa ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de nas yi ge gsum gyi rang bzhin du gcig pa'i sngags rnams kyi rdzogs pa ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Then, the perfection of the mantras, which are of the nature of the three syllables, is their complete nature.

original: de rtogs nas de @57b mngon du byas nas rnal 'byor pa rdo rje bzlas pa rnams te /
analyzed: de rtogs nas de @57b mngon du byas nas rnal 'byor pa rdo rje bzlas pa rnams te /
translated: Having realized that, having actualized that, the yogis, the vajra reciters,

original: rgyud las gsungs pa'i bcu gcig po rnams la slob pa ni legs par slob pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyud las gsungs pa'i bcu gcig po rnams la slob pa ni legs par slob pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: are well trained in the eleven topics taught in the tantra.

original: 'dir bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The idea here is this.

original: re zhig rlung rnams ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi rang bzhin du gyur nas sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gnyis kyis bye brag tu snang ba rnam par rig pa brgyad kyis bsdus pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pas 'khor ba'i 'khorüîΩlo skyed par byed do //
analyzed: re zhig rlung rnams ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi rang bzhin du gyur nas sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gnyis kyis bye brag tu snang ba rnam par rig pa brgyad kyis bsdus pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pas 'khor ba'i 'khor lo skyed par byed do //
translated: The winds, for a while, having become the nature of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, appear distinctly as the two worlds of sentient beings and their environments. They are the support of consciousness, which is included in the eight consciousnesses. Thus, they generate the wheel of samsara.

original: de'i phyir ji srid de rnams pham par ma byas pa de srid du sems rtse gcig par mi 'gyur ba de rtse gcig pa nyid ni de kho na nyid bsgoms pa'i stobs las 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji srid de rnams pham par ma byas pa de srid du sems rtse gcig par mi 'gyur ba de rtse gcig pa nyid ni de kho na nyid bsgoms pa'i stobs las 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, as long as they are not defeated, there will be no one-pointed mind. One-pointedness is attained through the power of meditating on reality.

original: thub pa chen po'i chos phung po //
analyzed: thub pa chen po'i chos phung po //
translated: The great sage‚Äôs Dharma aggregatesüîΩare eighty-four thousand.

original: brgyad khri dag dang bzhi stong gi / gang gis de nyid mi shes pa //
analyzed: brgyad khri dag dang bzhi stong gi / gang gis de nyid mi shes pa //
translated: Whoever does not know reality,

original: de yi thams cad 'bras bu med //
analyzed: de yi thams cad 'bras bu med //
translated: all their efforts are fruitless.

original: ces gang bshad pa dang / de bzhin du gzhung mdzad pas kyang //
analyzed: ces gang bshad pa dang / de bzhin du gzhung mdzad pas kyang //
translated: And the author of the treatise also says:

original: gnyis med mthong ba grol bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes kyang gsungs so //
analyzed: gnyis med mthong ba grol bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes kyang gsungs so //
translated: Seeing nonduality, one is liberated.

original: de'i de kho na nyid ni yungs kar phra mo'i tshad tsam gyi thig le'i rnal 'byor yin te /
analyzed: de'i de kho na nyid ni yungs kar phra mo'i tshad tsam gyi thig le'i rnal 'byor yin te /
translated: Its reality is the yoga of the bindu, which is the size of a small mustard seed.

original: de bzhin du yang re zhig 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa'i bya ba'i rang bzhin can gyi bya ba thams cad 'jug par byed pa'i rlung de rnams ni rtsol ba'i dbang gis 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang re zhig 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa'i bya ba'i rang bzhin can gyi bya ba thams cad 'jug par byed pa'i rlung de rnams ni rtsol ba'i dbang gis 'byung ngo //
translated: Likewise, the winds that have the nature of the activities of coming and going and so on are produced by the power of effort.

original: rtsol ba yang rnam par dpyad na kun du rtsol bar byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi don 'dod pa las 'byung ste /
analyzed: rtsol ba yang rnam par dpyad na kun du rtsol bar byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi don 'dod pa las 'byung ste /
translated: When effort is analyzed, it arises from the desire for the object that has the nature of the agent of effort.

original: de yang sems dang ldan pa'i 'du byed kyi bye brag gi rang bzhin yin pas rnam par shes pa las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de yang sems dang ldan pa'i 'du byed kyi bye brag gi rang bzhin yin pas rnam par shes pa las 'byung ngo //
translated: Since that is the nature of a formation associated with mind, it arises from consciousness.

original: de ltar na rgyud las 'brel pas 'brel pa'i phyir rlung dang rnam par shes pa dag ni gcig nyid yin te de'i bzhon pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na rgyud las 'brel pas 'brel pa'i phyir rlung dang rnam par shes pa dag ni gcig nyid yin te de'i bzhon pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, because of the connection of the continuum, the winds and consciousness are one, because the winds are the mount of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa yang don dam par dpyad na byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang don dam par dpyad na byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin yin te /
translated: When consciousness is analyzed in terms of the ultimate, it has the nature of bodhicitta.

original: de bzhin du yang thabs dang shes rab snyoms par zhugs pas dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa thams cad ro gcig tu gyur pa'i byang chub kyi sems kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i ngo bor nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang thabs dang shes rab snyoms par zhugs pas dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa thams cad ro gcig tu gyur pa'i byang chub kyi sems kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i ngo bor nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, by the union of method and wisdom, all faculties, objects, and consciousnesses become of one taste, and one experiences the bodhicitta, the essence of the relative and the ultimate.

original: de la kun rdzob kyi rten gyi de kho na nyid yin zhing don dam pa ni don dam pa'i de kho na nyid yin no //üîΩrten dang brten pa dag tha mi dad pa'i phyir rnam par shes @58a * //
analyzed: de la kun rdzob kyi rten gyi de kho na nyid yin zhing don dam pa ni don dam pa'i de kho na nyid yin no // rten dang brten pa dag tha mi dad pa'i phyir rnam par shes @58a * //
translated: In this regard, the relative is the reality of the support, and the ultimate is the reality of the supported.üîΩSince the support and the supported are not different, the reality of consciousness is the reality of wind.

original: pa'i de kho na nyid gang yin pa de rlung gi de kho na nyid yin te 'byung ba gang las 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: pa'i de kho na nyid gang yin pa de rlung gi de kho na nyid yin te 'byung ba gang las 'byung zhe na /
translated: From what element does it arise?

original: las las she na mi rung ste //
analyzed: las las she na mi rung ste //
translated: It is not suitable to say that it arises from karma,

original: de dang 'byung ba ma 'bral zhing //
analyzed: de dang 'byung ba ma 'bral zhing //
translated: because it is not separate from the elements.

original: las kyi bag chags sems la gnas //
analyzed: las kyi bag chags sems la gnas //
translated: The latent tendencies of karma exist in the mind.

original: rlung las she na rlung gang las //
analyzed: rlung las she na rlung gang las //
translated: If it arises from wind, from what wind?

original: rtsol ba las byung gang las te //
analyzed: rtsol ba las byung gang las te //
translated: It arises from the wind of effort.

original: 'dod las she na khyod kyis ni //
analyzed: 'dod las she na khyod kyis ni //
translated: If it arises from desire, you have said

original: lam de khas blangs ma yin nam //
analyzed: lam de khas blangs ma yin nam //
translated: Is that not the path you have accepted?

original: zhes gang bshad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes gang bshad pa'o //
translated: Thus it is explained.

original: de'i phyir thig le'i gzugs can gyi de nyid rlung gi de kho na nyid de'i rim pa ni rigs dang nyon mongs pa'i dbye bas gnas khyad par can du dgod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i bsgom pa ste gnas de rnams dang / gdong dang snying ga dang gsang ba'i gnas gsum mo //
analyzed: de'i phyir thig le'i gzugs can gyi de nyid rlung gi de kho na nyid de'i rim pa ni rigs dang nyon mongs pa'i dbye bas gnas khyad par can du dgod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i bsgom pa ste gnas de rnams dang / gdong dang snying ga dang gsang ba'i gnas gsum mo //
translated: Therefore, the meditation that precedes the placement of the reality of the form of the drop and the reality of the wind in special places, by way of the divisions of the spiritual levels and the afflictions, is the placement of those places, which are the three places of the face, heart, and genitals.

original: kha cig ni smin ma'i dbus dang lte ba'i dbus dag kyang yin no zhes kyang rjod par byed do //
analyzed: kha cig ni smin ma'i dbus dang lte ba'i dbus dag kyang yin no zhes kyang rjod par byed do //
translated: Some say that the middle of the eyebrows and the middle of the navel are also those places.

original: rim pa 'dis ni rlung gi de kho na nyid khong du chud nas /
analyzed: rim pa 'dis ni rlung gi de kho na nyid khong du chud nas /
translated: By this process, having understood the reality of the wind,

original: sngags kyi de kho na nyid la rab tu 'jug ste /
analyzed: sngags kyi de kho na nyid la rab tu 'jug ste /
translated: one enters into the reality of the mantra.

original: de yang ji lta bu zhe na sngags thams cad ni a'a li k'a lis bskyed pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu zhe na sngags thams cad ni a'a li k'a lis bskyed pa yin te /
translated: And what is that? All mantras are generated by the vowels and consonants.

original: dbyangs dang gsal bya'i dbye bas yi ge phyi mo bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'o //
analyzed: dbyangs dang gsal bya'i dbye bas yi ge phyi mo bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'o //
translated: The forty-nine phonemes are divided into vowels and consonants.

original: de rnams ni sde tshan brgyad kyi ngo bo nyid la brten nas yi ge dang tshig la sogs pa'i rim pas chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong skyed par byed cing /
analyzed: de rnams ni sde tshan brgyad kyi ngo bo nyid la brten nas yi ge dang tshig la sogs pa'i rim pas chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong skyed par byed cing /
translated: Based on the nature of these eight groups, the eighty-four thousand aggregates of Dharma are generated through the stages of letters, words, and so on.

original: phyi rol gyi rim pa'i gnas bcu bzhi dang / rang gi gzhung lugs kyi rim pas rig pa'i gnas lnga skyed par byed de /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rim pa'i gnas bcu bzhi dang / rang gi gzhung lugs kyi rim pas rig pa'i gnas lnga skyed par byed de /
translated: The fourteen external stages and the five internal stages of knowledge are generated.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: bslab dang rtog dang brda sprod dang // nges tshig skar ma'i gnas shes dang // sdeb sbyor bsdu ba drug pa ste //
analyzed: bslab dang rtog dang brda sprod dang // nges tshig skar ma'i gnas shes dang // sdeb sbyor bsdu ba drug pa ste //
translated: The six branches are grammar, logic, metrics, lexicography, astronomy, and synonymy.

original: rig byed yan lag drug par 'dod //
analyzed: rig byed yan lag drug par 'dod //
translated: These are asserted to be the six branches of the Vedas.

original: nges brjod mchod sbyin snyan tshig dang // de bzhin srid srung bzhi pa ste //üîΩrig pa'i gnas ni thams cad du //
analyzed: nges brjod mchod sbyin snyan tshig dang // de bzhin srid srung bzhi pa ste // rig pa'i gnas ni thams cad du //
translated: The four Vedas are the Rig Veda, the Yajur Veda, the Sama Veda, and the Atharva Veda.

original: rig byed bzhir ni brjod pa yin //üîΩrig byed yul la dpyod byed pa'i //
analyzed: rig byed bzhir ni brjod pa yin // rig byed yul la dpyod byed pa'i //
translated: The four Vedas are said to be the Vedas of all knowledge.

original: bdag nyid can ni spyod pa yin //
analyzed: bdag nyid can ni spyod pa yin //
translated: The Veda of conduct is that which analyzes the objects of the Vedas.

original: rig pa'i bstan bcos rtog ba yin //
analyzed: rig pa'i bstan bcos rtog ba yin //
translated: The Veda of creation is the treatise of knowledge.

original: de yang lha drug rim pa las //
analyzed: de yang lha drug rim pa las //
translated: Moreover, they are six branches.üîΩSƒÅ·πÉkhya, worship, logic,

original: grangs can mchod 'os rig pa dang // 'jig rten rgyang 'phen bde gshegs pa //
analyzed: grangs can mchod 'os rig pa dang // 'jig rten rgyang 'phen bde gshegs pa //
translated: LokƒÅyata, and the Sugata,

original: de bzhin du ni dpyod pa can //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni dpyod pa can //
translated: and likewise, the Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsaka,

original: de rnams yan lag bzhi ru bsgrags //üîΩsngon byung gtam ni ston byed pa'i //
analyzed: de rnams yan lag bzhi ru bsgrags // sngon byung gtam ni ston byed pa'i //
translated: are proclaimed to be the four branches.üîΩThe one that teaches the stories of the past
