original: mtshan nyid can ni sngon rabs yin //
analyzed: mtshan nyid can ni sngon rabs yin //
translated: is the treatise of itihƒÅsa.

original: 'jig rten 'dod chags bral ba'i phyir //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dod chags bral ba'i phyir //
translated: Because it is free from worldly attachment,

original: bstan pa chos kyi bstan bcos so //
analyzed: bstan pa chos kyi bstan bcos so //
translated: it is the treatise of Dharma.üîΩThose are the fourteen sciences.

original: de rnams @58b ni rig pa'i gnas bcu bzhi ste /üîΩyan lag rnams dang rig byed bzhi //
analyzed: de rnams @58b ni rig pa'i gnas bcu bzhi ste / yan lag rnams dang rig byed bzhi //
translated: The four Vedas,

original: dpyod can rig pa rgyas pa dang // sngon rabs chos kyi bstan bcos te //
analyzed: dpyod can rig pa rgyas pa dang // sngon rabs chos kyi bstan bcos te //
translated: the Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsƒÅ, the PurƒÅ·πáa, the Dharma≈õƒÅstra,

original: de rnams rig pa bcu bzhi yin //üîΩzhes gang bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams rig pa bcu bzhi yin // zhes gang bshad pa'o //
translated: those are the fourteen sciences.

original: rang gi gzhung lugs kyi rim pas na lnga ste /
analyzed: rang gi gzhung lugs kyi rim pas na lnga ste /
translated: According to our own textual system, there are five:

original: 'di ltar sgra rig pa dang / gtan tshigs rig pa dang / gso ba rig pa dang / nang rig pa dang / bzo'i las kyi gnas rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra rig pa dang / gtan tshigs rig pa dang / gso ba rig pa dang / nang rig pa dang / bzo'i las kyi gnas rig pa'o //
translated: the science of grammar, the science of logic, the science of healing, the inner science, and the science of arts and crafts.

original: de rnams kyi bye brag ni 'phags pa byams pas gsungs pas 'dir rgyas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bye brag ni 'phags pa byams pas gsungs pas 'dir rgyas par mi bya'o //
translated: The specific divisions of these are taught by the noble Maitreya, but they will not be elaborated here.

original: de lta na yi ge phyi mo ni man ngag gi rang bzhin ma lus pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba yin zhing de yang yi ge aa las byung ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yi ge phyi mo ni man ngag gi rang bzhin ma lus pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba yin zhing de yang yi ge aa las byung ba kho na yin te /
translated: Thus, the alphabet is the cause of all the nature of the instructions, and that arises from the letter A.

original: aa ni yig 'bru kun gyi mchog / don chen yi ge dam pa yin //
analyzed: aa ni yig 'bru kun gyi mchog / don chen yi ge dam pa yin //
translated: A is the supreme of all letters, the holy letter of great meaning.

original: khong nas 'byung ba skye ba med //
analyzed: khong nas 'byung ba skye ba med //
translated: It arises from within, unborn.

original: tshig tu brjod pa spangs pa ste //
analyzed: tshig tu brjod pa spangs pa ste //
translated: It is free from verbal expression.

original: zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is what is said.

original: de nyid thung du lnga'i ngo bo nyid kyis phung po dang rnam par shes pa lnga'i ngo bo yin zhing /
analyzed: de nyid thung du lnga'i ngo bo nyid kyis phung po dang rnam par shes pa lnga'i ngo bo yin zhing /
translated: That itself is the nature of the five short vowels, and thus it is the nature of the five aggregates and five consciousnesses.

original: de nyid ma ning bzhi po ma gtogs pa bcu gnyis kyis phyi dang nang gi yul dang dbang po'i rang bzhin nyid yin pas skye mched bcu gnyis kyi ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ma ning bzhi po ma gtogs pa bcu gnyis kyis phyi dang nang gi yul dang dbang po'i rang bzhin nyid yin pas skye mched bcu gnyis kyi ngo bo yin no //
translated: That itself is the nature of the twelve, excluding the four neutral letters, and thus it is the nature of the twelve sense bases, the nature of the outer and inner objects and faculties.

original: dbyangs bcu drug gi ngo bo nyid kyis zla ba'i cha bcu drug gi rang bzhin dang / tshes grangs kyi rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: dbyangs bcu drug gi ngo bo nyid kyis zla ba'i cha bcu drug gi rang bzhin dang / tshes grangs kyi rang bzhin yin no //
translated: The nature of the sixteen vowels is the nature of the sixteen parts of the moon, and the nature of the lunar days.

original: de nyid nyis 'gyur du gyur pas skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: de nyid nyis 'gyur du gyur pas skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi ngo bo yin no //
translated: By doubling that, it is the nature of the thirty-two marks of a great being.

original: yi ge aa'i dbye bas khams bco brgyad kyi rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: yi ge aa'i dbye bas khams bco brgyad kyi rang bzhin yin te /
translated: By the division of the letter A, it is the nature of the eighteen elements.üîΩShort, long, and guttural,üîΩwith the three vowels,

original: thung du ring po 'phar ba dang // dbyangs rnams gsum dang sprel ba dang // sna las rjes 'byung dbye ba yis //
analyzed: thung du ring po 'phar ba dang // dbyangs rnams gsum dang sprel ba dang // sna las rjes 'byung dbye ba yis //
translated: and the division of nasal and non-nasal,

original: grangs las bco brgyad bdag nyid de //
analyzed: grangs las bco brgyad bdag nyid de //
translated: from the enumeration, it is of the nature of eighteen.

original: dbye ba ni thung du dang ring po dang gang du bskyed pa dang / bteg pa dang / smad pa dang / dbyangs can dang / sna las rjes su byung ba dang bcas pa dang / sna las rjes su byung ba med pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dbye ba ni thung du dang ring po dang gang du bskyed pa dang / bteg pa dang / smad pa dang / dbyangs can dang / sna las rjes su byung ba dang bcas pa dang / sna las rjes su byung ba med pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The divisions are short, long, guttural, aspirated, low, with vowels, with nasal, and without nasal.

original: de bzhin du de nyid gsal ba'i ngo bo thabs kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du de nyid gsal ba'i ngo bo thabs kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Similarly, that itself, with the nature of clarity, is the nature of method.

original: rjes su 'jug pa'i dbyangs dang bcas pa'i mtha' gnas gsum dang 'brel pa med par mi 'byung ba rnams dang ldan pa las thabs dang shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid bzhi bcu gnyis 'gyur du byas pa las yi ge aa nyid dpe byad bzang po brgya cu'i rang
analyzed: rjes su 'jug pa'i dbyangs dang bcas pa'i mtha' gnas gsum dang 'brel pa med par mi 'byung ba rnams dang ldan pa las thabs dang shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid bzhi bcu gnyis 'gyur du byas pa las yi ge aa nyid dpe byad bzang po brgya cu'i rang
translated: The vowels and consonants are endowed with the three unities at the end, which do not occur without a melody.üîΩüîΩFrom the twelve vowels and consonants, which are the nature of method and wisdom, the letter a itself is the nature of the one hundred and ten marks of a greatüîΩbeing.

original: bzhin yin no //
analyzed: bzhin yin no //
translated: The letter A itself has the nature of one hundred and twenty minor marks, because it is endowed with the thirty-two vowels and the sixty-four consonants, which are not possible without the three locations at the end of the vowels.

original: gang gi phyir de med na yi ge thams cad brjod par nus pa ma yin te /üîΩrnam par shes pa med pa'i lus bzhin du don gyi bya ba cung zad @59a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de med na yi ge thams cad brjod par nus pa ma yin te / rnam par shes pa med pa'i lus bzhin du don gyi bya ba cung zad @59a * //
translated: Since without it, all letters are unable to express meaning,

original: kyang mi byed pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: kyang mi byed pa de'i phyir /
translated: like a body without consciousness, it does not perform the function of meaning.

original: yi ge phyi mo ni aa las byung ba yin zhing /
analyzed: yi ge phyi mo ni aa las byung ba yin zhing /
translated: Therefore, the alphabet arises from A,

original: de ni bud med dang skyes pa dang ma ning dbye bas yi ge gsum gyi rang bzhin du gyur nas /
analyzed: de ni bud med dang skyes pa dang ma ning dbye bas yi ge gsum gyi rang bzhin du gyur nas /
translated: and that has the nature of the three letters, divided into female, male, and neutral.

original: spro bar byed pa dang gang bar byed pa dang / bum pa lta bu'i bye brag gis nyin dang mtshan du rlung nyi khri chig stong drug brgya rgyu ba'i dbye bas sems can gyi khams thams cad la khyab ste gnas so //
analyzed: spro bar byed pa dang gang bar byed pa dang / bum pa lta bu'i bye brag gis nyin dang mtshan du rlung nyi khri chig stong drug brgya rgyu ba'i dbye bas sems can gyi khams thams cad la khyab ste gnas so //
translated: It is the pervader of all the realms of sentient beings, abiding as the division of the winds moving twenty-one thousand times in a day and night through the divisions of the emanation, filling, and vase-breathing.

original: de nyid zhi ba la sogs pa'i dbye ba las mi shigs pa'i yi ger bzhugs te las kyi tshogs sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid zhi ba la sogs pa'i dbye ba las mi shigs pa'i yi ger bzhugs te las kyi tshogs sgrub par byed do //
translated: That itself, by the division of pacification and so forth, abides as the indestructible letter and accomplishes the accumulation of karma.

original: de nyid sgra'i bye brag rnam pa bcu la brten nas sngags kyi 'khor lo rnam pa sna tshogs pa skyed par byed do ;
analyzed: de nyid sgra'i bye brag rnam pa bcu la brten nas sngags kyi 'khor lo rnam pa sna tshogs pa skyed par byed do ;
translated: That itself, based on the ten divisions of sound, generates the various wheels of mantra.

original: / rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud dpal rdo rjes 'og las /
analyzed: / rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud dpal rdo rjes 'og las /
translated: The glorious Vajra of MahƒÅyoga Tantra says:

original: yi ge dang ni dbyangs dang sgra //
analyzed: yi ge dang ni dbyangs dang sgra //
translated: The letter, the vowel, the sound,üîΩThe cry, the noise, the voice, the roar, the shout, the clear, and the cut‚Äî

original: nga ro ku co sgra skad dang // 'ur sgra brtsegs dang gsal ba dang // gcod de sgra yi mtshan nyid bcu //
analyzed: nga ro ku co sgra skad dang // 'ur sgra brtsegs dang gsal ba dang // gcod de sgra yi mtshan nyid bcu //
translated: these are the ten characteristics of sound.

original: lkog ma mchu rkan so la sogs //
analyzed: lkog ma mchu rkan so la sogs //
translated: The throat, lips, palate, teeth, and so on

original: dbye ba dag gis dmigs 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: dbye ba dag gis dmigs 'gyur zhing //
translated: are the divisions that are observed.

original: yi ge tshig gsal rten du 'gyur //
analyzed: yi ge tshig gsal rten du 'gyur //
translated: The clear words of the letters are the basis.

original: de ni yi ge yin par brjod //

analyzed: de ni khyab bdag lus la gnas //

analyzed: de srid kho nar phyugs shes bya //

analyzed: thams cad na ni gnas pa ste //

analyzed: tshangs pa dam par brjod pa ste //

analyzed: sngags kyi de nyid shes nas ni //

analyzed: sngags kyi de kho na nyid de las sngags kyi rdzogs pa 'byung ngo //

analyzed: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /

analyzed: mgo bo la sogs pa rnams su yang yi ge gsum bkod nas de 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis bzlas pa ste /
translated: Having also arranged the three letters in the head and so forth, he recites them by the process of entering and so forth.

original: cha shas dang cha shas kyi dbye bas de bsdus nas der bcug ste /
analyzed: cha shas dang cha shas kyi dbye bas de bsdus nas der bcug ste /

original: de yang 'od gsal ba'i rang gi ngo bor shes par bya ste //
analyzed: de yang 'od gsal ba'i rang gi ngo bor shes par bya ste //

original: gnas pa zhes bya ba 'di ni sngags kyi rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: gnas pa zhes bya ba 'di ni sngags kyi rdzogs pa ste /

original: shin tu mthar thug pa yin pas de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni ma ning gi bzlas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu mthar thug pa yin pas de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni ma ning gi bzlas pa zhes bya'o //

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi rnal 'byor pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa la legs par bslabs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi rnal 'byor pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa la legs par bslabs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to /

original: dgongs pas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pas ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not a case of indirect intention.

original: da ni rim pa bzhi'i go rims //
analyzed: da ni rim pa bzhi'i go rims //

original: rdo rje bzlas nas rnal 'byor pa //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas nas rnal 'byor pa //
translated: The yogin, having practiced vajra recitation,

original: sems la dmigs pa thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: sems la dmigs pa thob par 'gyur //

original: sems la dmigs pa rtogs nas ni //üîΩye shes @60a * //
analyzed: sems la dmigs pa rtogs nas ni // ye shes @60a * //

analyzed: sku ni thob par 'gyur //
translated: body.

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i ting 'dzin gnas //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i ting 'dzin gnas //

original: gnyis med ye shes thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: gnyis med ye shes thob par 'gyur //

original: zung 'jug ting 'dzin la gnas nas //
analyzed: zung 'jug ting 'dzin la gnas nas //

analyzed: slar zhing ga la'ang mi slob po //

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'i don ni 'di yin te /

original: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pas dag rnam par byang ba byas pa na rnal 'byor pas sems shes pa gsum gyi bdag nyid can la dmigs pa ste rnam par dag pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pas dag rnam par byang ba byas pa na rnal 'byor pas sems shes pa gsum gyi bdag nyid can la dmigs pa ste rnam par dag pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the yogi has purified the three consciousnesses by means of the stage of vajra repetition, he attains the pure state of the three consciousnesses.

original: kun gzhi dang nyon mongs pa can dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin brgya drug cu'i tshogs dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa gsum gyi ni 'gro ba rnams la nyin dang mtshan du zo chun gyi 'khrul 'khor bzhin du 'khor bar byed do //
analyzed: kun gzhi dang nyon mongs pa can dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin brgya drug cu'i tshogs dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa gsum gyi ni 'gro ba rnams la nyin dang mtshan du zo chun gyi 'khrul 'khor bzhin du 'khor bar byed do //
translated: The three consciousnesses, along with the collection of one hundred and sixty natures, the consciousnesses of the ground of all, the afflicted mind, and the operative consciousnesses, revolve in beings like a waterwheel, day and night.

original: rtsa ba med cing gnas pa med pa kha dog med cing rtags med la dbyibs med par gyur pa gang yin pa'i rnam par shes pa gsum po ni glo bur ba'i nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyi ral gri rnon po thogs nas 'khor ba'i 'brog dgon pa'i gnas
analyzed: rtsa ba med cing gnas pa med pa kha dog med cing rtags med la dbyibs med par gyur pa gang yin pa'i rnam par shes pa gsum po ni glo bur ba'i nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyi ral gri rnon po thogs nas 'khor ba'i 'brog dgon pa'i gnas
translated: The three consciousnesses, which are rootless, groundless, colorless, signless, and shapeless, are like a sharp sword of the latent tendencies of the adventitious afflictions. They are the cause of the wilderness of sa·πÉsƒÅra, the placeüîΩwhere beings are born.

original: su 'gro ba'i 'gron po rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i nor phrogs nas bsad cing skye gnas gzhan du 'phen par byed do //üîΩji skad du /
analyzed: su 'gro ba'i 'gron po rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i nor phrogs nas bsad cing skye gnas gzhan du 'phen par byed do // ji skad du /
translated: It robs the wealth of the roots of virtue of all travelers who go there, and kills them and propels them to another birth.

original: thal tshan gyi chu bo'i mdo las /
analyzed: thal tshan gyi chu bo'i mdo las /
translated: As it is said in the River of Burning Ashes Sutra:

original: 'brog dgon pa na gnas pa'i dge slong lag pa gyen du brkyang //
analyzed: 'brog dgon pa na gnas pa'i dge slong lag pa gyen du brkyang //
translated: The monk who lives in the wilderness raises his hands in the air.

original: nyin par bdag ni nor 'phrog chom rkun rnams la 'jigs pa med //
analyzed: nyin par bdag ni nor 'phrog chom rkun rnams la 'jigs pa med //
translated: In the day, I am not afraid of the thieves who rob wealth.

original: de rnams nor tsam 'ba' zhig 'phrog par byed de de yang med //üîΩyid la yang dang yang du bsags pa'i bdag gi dge ba'i nor //
analyzed: de rnams nor tsam 'ba' zhig 'phrog par byed de de yang med // yid la yang dang yang du bsags pa'i bdag gi dge ba'i nor //
translated: They only steal wealth, and that is not mine.üîΩBut the thieves of conceptualization,

original: tha ma rnam rtog dag gis dbang med par ni 'phrog par byed //
analyzed: tha ma rnam rtog dag gis dbang med par ni 'phrog par byed //

original: ces 'bod do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ces 'bod do zhes gsungs so //

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa gsum po yongs su mi shes pa kho nas 'khor ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa gsum po yongs su mi shes pa kho nas 'khor ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, only by not understanding the three consciousnesses is there cyclic existence.

original: 'phags pa byams pas /üîΩyang dag ma yin kun rtog ni //
analyzed: 'phags pa byams pas / yang dag ma yin kun rtog ni //
translated: As the noble Maitreya says:üîΩFalse imagination

original: sems dang sems byung khams gsum pa //
analyzed: sems dang sems byung khams gsum pa //
translated: is mind and mental factors of the three realms.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is what is being said.

original: rnam par shes pa gsum gyi rang bzhin gyi sems de la 'chad par gyur pa'i sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas dmigs shing rnam par spyod bar byed pa de'i tshe sems rnam par dag par 'gyur te sbas pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gsum gyi rang bzhin gyi sems de la 'chad par gyur pa'i sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas dmigs shing rnam par spyod bar byed pa de'i tshe sems rnam par dag par 'gyur te sbas pa'o //
translated: When one meditates on and engages in that mind which is the nature of the three consciousnesses through the process of mantra and seal explained above, then the mind becomes pure, hidden.

original: de nas sems rnam par dag pa ste thob nas don dam pa'i bden pa las cig car langs te /
analyzed: de nas sems rnam par dag pa ste thob nas don dam pa'i bden pa las cig car langs te /
translated: Then, having attained the pure mind, one suddenly arises from the ultimate truth.

original: sngon gyi smon lam 'bras bu dang bcas @60b par bya ba'i don dang / dbang phyug chen po'i lta ba dang mtshungs pa'i chad pa'i lam spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam 'bras bu dang bcas @60b par bya ba'i don dang / dbang phyug chen po'i lta ba dang mtshungs pa'i chad pa'i lam spang ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to make the former aspiration fruitful, and in order to abandon the path of annihilation which is similar to the view of Mahe≈õvara,

original: rnal 'byor pa dbang po'i gzhu lta bu'i dkyil 'khor pas yongs su bskor zhing rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa nyi ma dang zla ba dang me'i 'od las lhag pa'i gzhi brjid dang ldan pa'i dpal rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku rnam grangs gzhan yang
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa dbang po'i gzhu lta bu'i dkyil 'khor pas yongs su bskor zhing rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa nyi ma dang zla ba dang me'i 'od las lhag pa'i gzhi brjid dang ldan pa'i dpal rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku rnam grangs gzhan yang
translated: The yogi, surrounded by the mandala like the bow of Cupid, endowed with the best of all aspects, with a splendor surpassing the light of the sun, moon, and fire, attains the body of glorious Great Vajradhara.

original: ye shes kyi sku zhes bya ba 'gro ba ma lus pa skad cig tsam gyis rang gi sku dang mtshungs par sgrub par byed pa /
analyzed: ye shes kyi sku zhes bya ba 'gro ba ma lus pa skad cig tsam gyis rang gi sku dang mtshungs par sgrub par byed pa /
translated: The other name is the ‚Äúwisdom body,‚Äù which in an instant establishes all beings without exception as equal to one‚Äôs own body.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo gzhan dang gzhan spros pas khams gsum pa rnam par spyod bar byed pa 'thob par 'gyur ba'am ;
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo gzhan dang gzhan spros pas khams gsum pa rnam par spyod bar byed pa 'thob par 'gyur ba'am ;
translated: By emanating one mandala wheel after another, one attains the ability to enjoy the three realms.

original: snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa rim pas phyag rgya bzhis rgyas btab pa'i ye shes kyi sku 'thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sbas pa yin no //
analyzed: snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa rim pas phyag rgya bzhis rgyas btab pa'i ye shes kyi sku 'thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sbas pa yin no //
translated: Or, by the stages of attaining the light, and so on, one attains the wisdom body sealed by the four seals. This is the hidden meaning.

original: de'i rjes la sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas te /
analyzed: de'i rjes la sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas te /
translated: After that, one abides in the illusion-like concentration.

original: rnam grangs gzhan dag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa zhes bya ba thob nas gnyis med ye shes 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan dag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa zhes bya ba thob nas gnyis med ye shes 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Another enumeration: having attained the stage called ‚Äúblessing,‚Äù one attains the reality of nondual pristine awareness, clear light.

original: de bzhin du 'dod chags dang 'dod chags bar ma gcig 'dod chags dang bral ba gcig ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod chags dang 'dod chags bar ma gcig 'dod chags dang bral ba gcig ste /
translated: Similarly, one is free of attachment to one of the two, attachment and indifference, and free of attachment to the other.

original: gnyis po de dag spangs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gnyis med do //
analyzed: gnyis po de dag spangs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gnyis med do //
translated: Because of the abandonment of those two, there is nonduality.üîΩOne is free of attachment to one night and one day, and free of attachment to the other.

original: mtshan mo dang mtshams gcig nyin mo gcig ste de dag spangs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gnyis med do //
analyzed: mtshan mo dang mtshams gcig nyin mo gcig ste de dag spangs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gnyis med do //
translated: Because of the abandonment of those two, there is nonduality.

original: dga' ba dang mchog dga' gcig / dga' bral gcig ste /
analyzed: dga' ba dang mchog dga' gcig / dga' bral gcig ste /
translated: One is free of attachment to one joy and one supreme joy, and free of attachment to the other.

original: de dag spangs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gnyis med do //
analyzed: de dag spangs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gnyis med do //
translated: Because of the abandonment of those two, there is nonduality.

original: ye shes ni man ngag bzhi pa yin no //
analyzed: ye shes ni man ngag bzhi pa yin no //
translated: Knowledge is the fourth intimate instruction.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba chen po yang ye shes yin te /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba chen po yang ye shes yin te /
translated: The connate great bliss is also knowledge,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos nyid rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos nyid rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it realizes the supramundane reality.

original: dzny'a ni ye shes te rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: dzny'a ni ye shes te rtogs pa'o //
translated: J√±ƒÅ means knowledge, realization.

original: na ni dgag pa te des na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams med pa ni ye shes so //
analyzed: na ni dgag pa te des na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams med pa ni ye shes so //
translated: Na is a negation, and that is the gnosis that is the nonexistence of the consciousnesses of attachment and so on.üîΩTherefore, since it is nondual and it is gnosis, it is the nondual gnosis.

original: de bas na gnyis su med pa yang yin la ye shes kyang yin pas gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so zhes las 'dzin pa'i bsdu ba bya zhing mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don te mthar thug pa yin noüîΩ// de nas gnyid sad pa bzhin du rnal 'byor pa langs te thog ma med pa'i smon lam gyi sems nyid bag chags kyi stobs dang / de'i ro kho nas kun rdzob dang don dam pa tha mi dad @61a * //
analyzed: de bas na gnyis su med pa yang yin la ye shes kyang yin pas gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so zhes las 'dzin pa'i bsdu ba bya zhing mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don te mthar thug pa yin no // de nas gnyid sad pa bzhin du rnal 'byor pa langs te thog ma med pa'i smon lam gyi sems nyid bag chags kyi stobs dang / de'i ro kho nas kun rdzob dang don dam pa tha mi dad @61a * //
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚Äúone will attain the stage of manifest enlightenment‚Äù is that one will attain the ultimate.

original: pa'i zung 'jug ting nge 'dzin la ste /
analyzed: pa'i zung 'jug ting nge 'dzin la ste /
translated: Then, like one who has awakened from sleep, the yogi arises, and through the power of the habitual tendencies of the mind of aspiration that has no beginning, and through the power of the mere taste of that, he enters into the samƒÅdhi of union, in which the conventional and the ultimate are not different.

original: rnam pa dang bcas pa dang rnam pa med pa la sogs pa'i zung du 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas pa dang rnam pa med pa la sogs pa'i zung du 'jug pa ste /
translated: The union of the aspect and the nonaspected and so on is the union.

original: bcings shing 'dres par gyur pa ni zung du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: bcings shing 'dres par gyur pa ni zung du 'jug pa'o //
translated: The bound and the mixed is the union.

original: ting nge 'dzin de las langs kyang de la rtse gcig pa'i rang bzhin can de la gnas nas 'khor ba ji srid kyi bar du cho 'phrul ston pa dang / chos rnam pa sna tshogs ston pa'i rim pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par rnams kyis sems can gyi don byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni bya ba byas pa dang /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de las langs kyang de la rtse gcig pa'i rang bzhin can de la gnas nas 'khor ba ji srid kyi bar du cho 'phrul ston pa dang / chos rnam pa sna tshogs ston pa'i rim pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par rnams kyis sems can gyi don byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni bya ba byas pa dang /
translated: Although rising from that meditative concentration, the yogi who abides in the nature of one-pointedness of mind, displays miracles and teaches various aspects of Dharma for as long as cyclic existence exists, and who benefits sentient beings through the stages of the special meditative concentrations, has completed the task,

original: byed pa byas pa dang / bya ba med pa dang / spros pa med cing 'bras bur gyur pa'i nges par 'byed par byed pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes thob pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gang la yang mi slob po zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa byas pa dang / bya ba med pa dang / spros pa med cing 'bras bur gyur pa'i nges par 'byed par byed pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes thob pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gang la yang mi slob po zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'o //
translated: has completed the action, is without action, is free from elaborations, and has attained the wisdom of the dharmadhatu, the definite separation from cyclic existence that is the result. Therefore, he is not trained in anything. This is the culmination.

original: da ni de nyid kyi phan yon ni /
analyzed: da ni de nyid kyi phan yon ni /
translated: Now, the benefits of that are:

original: de ni rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor brjod //
analyzed: de ni rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor brjod //
translated: That is called the perfect yoga.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'ang de //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'ang de //
translated: The great vajra holder

original: rnam pa kun gyi mchog ldan pa'i //
analyzed: rnam pa kun gyi mchog ldan pa'i //
translated: is endowed with the most sublime of all aspects.

original: thams cad mkhyen par de nas 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen par de nas 'gyur //
translated: Then he becomes omniscient.

original: zhes bya bar gsungs te de zhes bya ba'i thams cad kyi ming gis ni rim pa lnga'i 'bras bur gyur pa rim pa lnga pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya bar gsungs te de zhes bya ba'i thams cad kyi ming gis ni rim pa lnga'i 'bras bur gyur pa rim pa lnga pa gzung ngo //
translated: Thus it is said. The word that refers to the five stages, which are the result of the five stages.

original: de ni rdzogs pa yin te rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i chos nyid kyi rang bzhin nyid yin pa dang / mi slob pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rdzogs pa yin te rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i chos nyid kyi rang bzhin nyid yin pa dang / mi slob pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is perfect, because it is the nature of the reality that is accomplished by nature, and because it is the state of no-more-learning.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pas gong nas gong du thob par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir rnal 'byor yang yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pas gong nas gong du thob par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir rnal 'byor yang yin no //
translated: It is yoga, because it is to be attained by the stages of samadhi, higher and higher.

original: de nyid rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po ste rdo rje sems dpa'i rang gi ngo bo sku gsum gyi bdag nyid can gyi lha'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po ste rdo rje sems dpa'i rang gi ngo bo sku gsum gyi bdag nyid can gyi lha'i rnam pa'o //
translated: It is the great vajra-holder, the form of the deity whose nature is the three bodies, the essence of Vajrasattva.

original: de yang rnam pa kun gyi mchog ni mtshan dang dpe byad do //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa kun gyi mchog ni mtshan dang dpe byad do //
translated: And that is the best of all aspects, the major and minor marks.

original: de dag dang ldan pa ste brgyan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa mngon par shes pa drug thob cing stobs bcu dang mi 'jig pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa rnal 'byor par 'gyur zhing yang dag par 'grub po zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin pa'o
analyzed: de dag dang ldan pa ste brgyan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa mngon par shes pa drug thob cing stobs bcu dang mi 'jig pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa rnal 'byor par 'gyur zhing yang dag par 'grub po zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin pa'o
translated: The yogi/nƒ´ who has these, who is adorned with the six higher perceptions and the ten powers, and so on, who is endowed with the qualities of fearlessness, becomes a yogi/nƒ´ and is perfectly accomplished.

original: // zhar la byung ba'i 'bras bu ni //
analyzed: // zhar la byung ba'i 'bras bu ni //
translated: The result that is a digressionüîΩis stated in the lines:üîΩThe three existences of the past,

original: 'das pa dang ni ma 'ongs dang // da ltar byung ba'i srid gsum gnas //üîΩ'od gsal ba ni rnam dag pas //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ni ma 'ongs dang // da ltar byung ba'i srid gsum gnas // 'od gsal ba ni rnam dag pas //
translated: the future, and the presentüîΩare seen in an instant,üîΩwithout exception,

original: skad cig de la ma lus mthong //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: skad cig de la ma lus mthong // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: by the clear light that is pure.üîΩThe three existences of the past, and so on, the mental behaviors of the realms of sentient beings in the past, and so on, and the deaths, transitions, and rebirths, and so on, of those who are far away, the things that are separated by place, time, and nature,

original: 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus dang yul gyi sems can gyi khams kyi sems kyi spyod pa rnams dang 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba la sogs pa rnams @61b dang thag ring po na gnas pa yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal pa'i dngos po rnams mthong
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus dang yul gyi sems can gyi khams kyi sems kyi spyod pa rnams dang 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba la sogs pa rnams @61b dang thag ring po na gnas pa yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal pa'i dngos po rnams mthong
translated: are seenüîΩin an instant, without exception, by the clear light that is pure.

original: ba dang thos pa la sogs pa'i srid gsum gnas te khams gsum na gnas pa 'od gsal ba ni rnam par dag pa ste zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas skad cig de la zhes bya ba skad cig gcig la ma lus pa ste
analyzed: ba dang thos pa la sogs pa'i srid gsum gnas te khams gsum na gnas pa 'od gsal ba ni rnam par dag pa ste zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas skad cig de la zhes bya ba skad cig gcig la ma lus pa ste
translated: The three realms are the three worlds. The clear light is the pure state. By attaining the samadhi of the stage of union, in that very instant, in one moment, he sees and knows the entire realm of sentient beings, which is of four kinds.

original: sems can gyi khams rnam pa bzhi'i bye brag mthong zhing shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste drang ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams rnam pa bzhi'i bye brag mthong zhing shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste drang ba'i don to //

original: 'di ltar de kho na nyid rtogs pa las 'bad pa med pa kho nar rnal 'byor pa'i dngos grub rnams 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de kho na nyid rtogs pa las 'bad pa med pa kho nar rnal 'byor pa'i dngos grub rnams 'byung bar 'gyur te /

original: don gcig dam pa'i don du mthong 'gyur na //
analyzed: don gcig dam pa'i don du mthong 'gyur na //
translated: When one sees the one meaning in the ultimate sense,

original: 'gro kun don gcig tu ni mthong ba yin //
analyzed: 'gro kun don gcig tu ni mthong ba yin //
translated: one sees the one meaning of all beings.

original: 'gram gyi phyogs gcig tu ni chu 'thungs na //
analyzed: 'gram gyi phyogs gcig tu ni chu 'thungs na //

analyzed: rgya mtsho ma lus par ni shes par 'gyur //
translated: one knows the water of the entire ocean.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang bshad do //
translated: And so on.

original: 'das pa ni 'dod chags kyi skad cig go //
analyzed: 'das pa ni 'dod chags kyi skad cig go //
translated: The past is the moment of passion.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i skad cig go //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i skad cig go //

original: ni zhes bya ba ni rgyu mtshan gyi bdun pa yin no //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba ni rgyu mtshan gyi bdun pa yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is the seventh case, the ablative.

original: des na don ni 'di yin te //üîΩde rnams shes nas 'od gsal ba ni rnam par dag pas zhes bya ba 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i mtshan nyid bzhi pa skad cig de la ste /

translated: Therefore, the meaning is this:üîΩHaving known those, one sees, or realizes, the reality of clear light, which is the nature of the fourth moment, the reality of clear light, which is characterized by the connate joy.

original: skad cig tsam gyi rang gi ngo bor mthong zhing mngon du byed do zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig tsam gyi rang gi ngo bor mthong zhing mngon du byed do zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúin a single moment‚Äù is that one sees, or realizes, the reality of clear light, which is characterized by the connate joy, in a single moment.

original: yang na 'das pa ni 'byung ba'i rlung gi rang bzhin yi ge h'um ngo //
analyzed: yang na 'das pa ni 'byung ba'i rlung gi rang bzhin yi ge h'um ngo //
translated: Alternatively, the past is the nature of the arising wind, the letter h≈´·πÉ.üîΩThe future is the nature of the abiding wind, the letter a.

analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni 'jug pa'i rlung gi rang bzhin yi ge aom mo //

analyzed: da ltar byung ba ni gnas pa'i rlung gi rang bzhin a'a:'o //

original: yi ge gsum po de rnams srid pa ste /
analyzed: yi ge gsum po de rnams srid pa ste /
translated: These three letters are the three existences.

original: dkyil 'khor bzhi ru gsum gnas te //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bzhi ru gsum gnas te //
translated: The three existences are the three times.

original: de bzhin du 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis 'od zer dmar po la sogs pa rnams g-yas la sogs pa'i dbye bas sna'i rtse mor 'dzin pa na /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis 'od zer dmar po la sogs pa rnams g-yas la sogs pa'i dbye bas sna'i rtse mor 'dzin pa na /

analyzed: 'od gsal ba rnam par dag pa'i de kho na nyid skad cig de nyid la mthong zhing thob par 'gyur te spyi'i don to //
translated: one sees and attains the reality of pure clear light in that very moment. This is the general meaning.

original: yang na 'das pa ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: yang na 'das pa ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, the past is the fundamental consciousness.

analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The future is the afflicted mental consciousness.

original: da ltar byung ba ni @62a * //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba ni @62a * //
translated: The present is the

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: engaging consciousness.

original: srid pa gsum ni thabs dang shes rab dang ma rig pa'i rang bzhin can gyi rang bzhin rnams so //
analyzed: srid pa gsum ni thabs dang shes rab dang ma rig pa'i rang bzhin can gyi rang bzhin rnams so //

original: de thams cad skad cig de la ste skad cig dang thang cig dang yud tsam dang mig btsums dang lag brdabs kyis 'jug pa dang sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas gal te 'od gsal ba rnam par dag par byas pa de'i tshe rnal 'byor pa ma lus pa
analyzed: de thams cad skad cig de la ste skad cig dang thang cig dang yud tsam dang mig btsums dang lag brdabs kyis 'jug pa dang sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas gal te 'od gsal ba rnam par dag par byas pa de'i tshe rnal 'byor pa ma lus pa
translated: All of them, in that very moment, in that very instant, in that very second, in the twinkling of an eye, in the time it takes to snap one‚Äôs fingers, by the process of mantra and mudrƒÅ, if luminosity is purified, then the yogi/nƒ´ sees and experiences the nature of all beings,

original: ste 'gro ba ma lus pa'i rang gi ngo bo 'od gsal bar mthong zhing nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sbas pa'o //
analyzed: ste 'gro ba ma lus pa'i rang gi ngo bo 'od gsal bar mthong zhing nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sbas pa'o //

original: yang na 'das pa ni chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: yang na 'das pa ni chos kyi sku'o //
translated: Alternatively, the past is the dharmakƒÅya,

original: ma 'ongs pa ni sprul pa'i sku'o //

translated: the future is the nirmƒÅ·πáakƒÅya,

analyzed: da ltar byung ba ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: and the present is the sa·πÉbhogakƒÅya.

original: srid pa gsum na ste khams gsum na rnal 'byor pas 'od gsal ba rnam par dag pa ste sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis mthong ba ste /
analyzed: srid pa gsum na ste khams gsum na rnal 'byor pas 'od gsal ba rnam par dag pa ste sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis mthong ba ste /
translated: In the three worlds, i.e., in the three realms, the yogi sees, i.e., cultivates, the clear light, the pure, i.e., the illusion-like concentration, in its entirety, i.e., in another state.

original: goms par byed cing ma lus pa ste gzhan nyid du gnas par gyur pa gang yin pa de dag kyang de skad cig de la de dang 'dra ba nyid du mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni sbas pa'o //
analyzed: goms par byed cing ma lus pa ste gzhan nyid du gnas par gyur pa gang yin pa de dag kyang de skad cig de la de dang 'dra ba nyid du mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni sbas pa'o //

original: da ni lung tshad ma yin pa dang bla ma'i zhal la bstod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni lung tshad ma yin pa dang bla ma'i zhal la bstod pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to praise the authority of the scriptures and the teacher's mouth,

original: dpal ldan 'dus pa'i rgyud ni //
analyzed: dpal ldan 'dus pa'i rgyud ni //
translated: the glorious Guhyasamaja Tantra

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te ;

original: de nyid 'di dag ces bya ba snga ma dang phyi ma'i bye brag gi mtshan nyid can rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang thob par byed pa'i rgyu'i rim pa lngar bshad pa gang yin pa ni dpal ldan 'dus pa'i rgyud du shin tu legs par rgyas btab gnas
analyzed: de nyid 'di dag ces bya ba snga ma dang phyi ma'i bye brag gi mtshan nyid can rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang thob par byed pa'i rgyu'i rim pa lngar bshad pa gang yin pa ni dpal ldan 'dus pa'i rgyud du shin tu legs par rgyas btab gnas
translated: That which is explained as the five stages is very well sealed in the glorious Guhyasamaja Tantra.

original: te rgyal pos rang gi mdzod bzhin du bcings nas gnas so //
analyzed: te rgyal pos rang gi mdzod bzhin du bcings nas gnas so //
translated: The king binds it and keeps it to himself.

original: de'i phyir shin tu gsang ba nyid yin pas khong du chud par mi nus te /
analyzed: de'i phyir shin tu gsang ba nyid yin pas khong du chud par mi nus te /
translated: Therefore, because it is very secret, it cannot be understood.

original: bshad pa'i rgyud rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi 'brel pa lta bu de rnams kyi rjes su 'brangs nas te /
analyzed: bshad pa'i rgyud rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi 'brel pa lta bu de rnams kyi rjes su 'brangs nas te /
translated: One should understand and know it by following those, which are like the root tantra‚Äôs connection with the explanatory tantra.

analyzed: de dag shes par byas nas rtogs par bya zhing shes par bya'o //
translated: Having understood those, one should realize and know it.

analyzed: gal te de lta na 'brel pa la 'bad pas ci dgos she na /

analyzed: bla ma'i zhal las zhes bya ba gsungs te /
