original: zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don to //üîΩyi ge aom ni 'dod chags dang 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don to // yi ge aom ni 'dod chags dang 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: This is the general meaning.üîΩThe syllable om is passion and the absence of passion.

original: yi ge a'a: ni 'dod chags par ma'o //
analyzed: yi ge a'a: ni 'dod chags par ma'o //
translated: The syllable ah is the passionless.

original: de rnams sdud par byed pa'i rnam pa can gyi man ngag bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams sdud par byed pa'i rnam pa can gyi man ngag bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth esoteric instruction is the one that combines those.

original: mtshan nyid ni yi ge h'um ngo zhes bya ba ni sbas pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni yi ge h'um ngo zhes bya ba ni sbas pa'o //
translated: The characteristic is the syllable h≈´·πÉ.

original: aom ni kun rdzob bo //
analyzed: aom ni kun rdzob bo //
translated: Om is the relative.

original: h'um ni don dam pa'o //
analyzed: h'um ni don dam pa'o //
translated: H≈´·πÉ is the ultimate.

original: de dag tha mi dad par byed pa ni yi ge aa ste mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: de dag tha mi dad par byed pa ni yi ge aa ste mthar thug pa'o //
translated: The syllable a is the one that makes those non-different, the final one.

original: da ni sngags kyi rdo rje bzlas pa /
analyzed: da ni sngags kyi rdo rje bzlas pa /
translated: Now, the mantra vajra repetition.

original: don rtogs pa yi bzlas pa na //
analyzed: don rtogs pa yi bzlas pa na //
translated: The repetition that realizes the meaning

original: ngo bo nyid med bzang po ru //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med bzang po ru //
translated: is the good one that is without intrinsic reality.

original: dus gsum sangs rgyas kyis brtags pa //
analyzed: dus gsum sangs rgyas kyis brtags pa //
translated: It is investigated by the buddhas of the three times.

original: rdo rje bzlas par de bshad do //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas par de bshad do //
translated: That is explained as the vajra repetition.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs pa 'di'i don ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs pa 'di'i don ni 'di yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of that statement.

original: re zhig dang por rnal @68b 'byor pas mgo la sogs pa rnams su yi ge gsum bkod de /
analyzed: re zhig dang por rnal @68b 'byor pas mgo la sogs pa rnams su yi ge gsum bkod de /
translated: First, the yogƒ´ places the three syllables on the head and so forth.

original: spro bar byed pa dang / gang bar byed pa dang bum pa lta bu'i bya bas 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis sems rtse gcig pa nyid du byas nas don rtogs pa ste de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ye shes kyi mtshan nyid khong du chud pa'i bzlas pa ni yang dang yang
analyzed: spro bar byed pa dang / gang bar byed pa dang bum pa lta bu'i bya bas 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis sems rtse gcig pa nyid du byas nas don rtogs pa ste de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ye shes kyi mtshan nyid khong du chud pa'i bzlas pa ni yang dang yang
translated: The recitation that is the nature of the transcendent state of all tathƒÅgatas is the recitation of the wisdom of the tathƒÅgatas, which is the recitation of the wisdom of the tathƒÅgatas.üîΩ

original: du goms par byas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: du goms par byas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The recitation of the Tathagatas is the recitation of the nature of the exalted wisdom of the Tathagatas, which is the repeated practice of the one-pointed mind that has been made to enter the stages of the processes of expansion, filling, and the action of the vase, and so forth, and the realization of the meaning, that is, the comprehension of the nature of the exalted wisdom of the Tathagatas.

original: de ni ngo bo nyid med de //
analyzed: de ni ngo bo nyid med de //
translated: It is not intrinsically real,

original: 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo yin zhing bzang bo ru ste rtog pa'i dra ba ma lus pa rab tu zhi ba'i phyir yid du 'ong bar dus gsum sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin du lhag par mos par brtag pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa ste mi shigs pa'i bzlasüîΩpar bshad do //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo yin zhing bzang bo ru ste rtog pa'i dra ba ma lus pa rab tu zhi ba'i phyir yid du 'ong bar dus gsum sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin du lhag par mos par brtag pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa ste mi shigs pa'i bzlas par bshad do //
translated: but is the nature of clear light, and is excellent, that is, attractive, because it is the pacification of the entire net of conceptual thought. The imagination of the three times as the nature of the Buddhas is the vajra recitation, the indestructible recitation.

original: dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not the intended meaning.

original: yang na don 'jig rten gyi lus kyi tshogs rnams rtogs pa ste rang gi lus dang bcas par lus zhes bya ba gcig kyang ma yin du ma yang ma yin zhes bya ba'i bzlas pa ni brtags pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang na don 'jig rten gyi lus kyi tshogs rnams rtogs pa ste rang gi lus dang bcas par lus zhes bya ba gcig kyang ma yin du ma yang ma yin zhes bya ba'i bzlas pa ni brtags pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Or else, the body is the collection of the worldly body, and the realization is the realization of one‚Äôs own body. The repetition of ‚Äúneither one nor many‚Äù is the investigation.

original: ngo bo nyid med de lus rjes su dran pa'i bdag nyid yin zhing bzang po ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med de lus rjes su dran pa'i bdag nyid yin zhing bzang po ste /
translated: The body is without intrinsic reality, and it is the nature of the recollection of the body.

original: 'jig rten las bzlas pa'i shes rab kyis yang dag par rtogs par bya ba dus gsum sangs rgyas te dus gsum sems can rnams dang 'brel pa'i lus brtags pa gang yin pa de ni rdo rje ste du'i  bzlas par bshad do zhes bya ba ni sku'i bzlas
analyzed: 'jig rten las bzlas pa'i shes rab kyis yang dag par rtogs par bya ba dus gsum sangs rgyas te dus gsum sems can rnams dang 'brel pa'i lus brtags pa gang yin pa de ni rdo rje ste du'i  bzlas par bshad do zhes bya ba ni sku'i bzlas
translated: The repetition of ‚Äúvajra‚Äù is explained as the investigation of the body connected with the buddhas of the three times and sentient beings of the three times, which is to be realized by the wisdom that transcends the world.

original: pa ste dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: pa ste dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the repetition of the body, which is an explanation by way of the intention.

original: de bzhin du gang gi don rtogs shing shes pa de rnams ni don rtogs pa ste tshig go //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang gi don rtogs shing shes pa de rnams ni don rtogs pa ste tshig go //
translated: Similarly, those who realize and know the meaning are the meaning-realizers, which is the word.

original: 'jig rten gyi tshig de rnams rang gi tshig dang bcas pas sgra dang sgra ma yin par spyod pa ni bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tshig de rnams rang gi tshig dang bcas pas sgra dang sgra ma yin par spyod pa ni bzlas pa'o //
translated: The recitation is the practice of sound and non-sound with one's own words together with those worldly words.

original: de ni ngo bo nyid med de rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin zhing bzang po ru ste /
analyzed: de ni ngo bo nyid med de rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin zhing bzang po ru ste /
translated: That is essenceless, empty of intrinsic nature, and good,

original: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin can gyi 'od dpag tu med pa'i ngo bor dus gsum sangs rgyas te yi ge gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi sngags thams cad brtag pa ni 'od gsal ba rtogs pa gang yin pa'o //üîΩde ni rdo rje ste gsung rnams kyi bzlas par bshad do zhes bya ba ni gsung gi bzlas pa ste /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin can gyi 'od dpag tu med pa'i ngo bor dus gsum sangs rgyas te yi ge gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi sngags thams cad brtag pa ni 'od gsal ba rtogs pa gang yin pa'o // de ni rdo rje ste gsung rnams kyi bzlas par bshad do zhes bya ba ni gsung gi bzlas pa ste /
translated: the realization of clear light, which is the contemplation of all the mantras, which are the three syllables, the essence of the Buddhas of the three times, in the nature of Amitabha, the wisdom of discernment.üîΩThat is the vajra, explained as the recitation of the speech.

original: dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the recitation of speech, which is the intentional explanation.

original: de bzhin du don rtogs shing shes pas na don rtogs pa ste sems so //
analyzed: de bzhin du don rtogs shing shes pas na don rtogs pa ste sems so //
translated: Likewise, the realization of the meaning is the mind, because it realizes and knows the meaning.

original: khams gsum pa'i sems can gyi rgyud la gnas pa de rang gi sems dang lhan cig yod pa dang med pa spangs pa nyid du rtog pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa ni bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i sems can gyi rgyud la gnas pa de rang gi sems dang lhan cig yod pa dang med pa spangs pa nyid du rtog pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa ni bzlas pa'o //
translated: The repetition is that which is conceived as the abandonment of the existence and non-existence of that which is present in the mind-streams of the sentient beings of the three realms together with one's own mind.

original: de ni ngo bo nyid med de //üîΩsems dran pa nye bar @69a * //
analyzed: de ni ngo bo nyid med de // sems dran pa nye bar @69a * //
translated: That is devoid of intrinsic reality.üîΩThe mindfulness of mind is the nature of the close placement of mindfulness.

original: gzhag pa'i rang bzhin dang bzang po ru ste /üîΩ'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes las thob pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid du dus gsum ste 'dod chags la sogs pa brgya drug cu'i dbye bas gnas pas sangs rgyas te rang bzhin rnams brtag pa ni 'od gsal ba'i rang gi ngo bor gyur par bya ba nyid
analyzed: gzhag pa'i rang bzhin dang bzang po ru ste / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes las thob pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid du dus gsum ste 'dod chags la sogs pa brgya drug cu'i dbye bas gnas pas sangs rgyas te rang bzhin rnams brtag pa ni 'od gsal ba'i rang gi ngo bor gyur par bya ba nyid
translated: It is good,üîΩpresent in the three times, and is the nature of the supramundane subsequent gnosis.

original: gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang yin pa'o //
translated: The examination of the buddhas, i.e., the natures, is the very transformation into the nature of clear light.üîΩThat is the vajra, explained as the repetition of mind.

original: de ni rdo rje ste thugs kyi bzlas par bshad do zhes bya ba ni thugs kyi bzlas pa ste dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rdo rje ste thugs kyi bzlas par bshad do zhes bya ba ni thugs kyi bzlas pa ste dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
translated: That is the repetition of mind, the explanation of the intention.

original: de bzhin du don te 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnam rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du don te 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnam rtogs pa ste /
translated: Similarly, the meaning is the conceptualization of desire, hatred, and ignorance.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams 'dod chags dang 'dod chags ma yin pa la sogs pa nyid du dpyad pa byas nas bzlas pa ni sems can rnams 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnam par dag pa la dgod par bya'o snyam du dpyod pa gang yin
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams 'dod chags dang 'dod chags ma yin pa la sogs pa nyid du dpyad pa byas nas bzlas pa ni sems can rnams 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnam par dag pa la dgod par bya'o snyam du dpyod pa gang yin
translated: The repetition of the analysis of desire, etc., as desire and non-desire, etc., is the analysis which thinks, ‚ÄúI will establish all beings in the purification of desire, hatred, and delusion.‚Äù

original: pa'o // de nyid ni 'dod chags la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: pa'o // de nyid ni 'dod chags la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: It is essenceless because it is the very essence of the purification of desire, etc.

original: rtag tu dri ma dang bral zhing zag pa med pa'i bde ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir bzang po'o //
analyzed: rtag tu dri ma dang bral zhing zag pa med pa'i bde ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir bzang po'o //
translated: It is good because it is the very essence of the constant, undefiled bliss.

original: dus gsum sangs rgyas te khams gsum na gnas pa'i sems can rnams so //
analyzed: dus gsum sangs rgyas te khams gsum na gnas pa'i sems can rnams so //
translated: The Buddhas of the three times are the beings who dwell in the three realms.

original: brtags pa ni de rnams rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid du dpyad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: brtags pa ni de rnams rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid du dpyad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The analysis is the analysis of their essence as pure.

original: de ni rdo rje ste 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams kyis bzlas par bshad do zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyi bzlas pa dang zhe sdang gi bzlas pa dang gti mug gi bzlas pa ste dgongs pa bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rdo rje ste 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams kyis bzlas par bshad do zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyi bzlas pa dang zhe sdang gi bzlas pa dang gti mug gi bzlas pa ste dgongs pa bshad pa'o //
translated: The repetition of passion, the repetition of aggression, and the repetition of stupidity are the explanations of the intention.

original: don rtogs pa ni lha dang sngags dag gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: don rtogs pa ni lha dang sngags dag gcig pa nyid do //
translated: The realization of the meaning is the identity of the deity and the mantra.

original: des bzlas pa ni yang dang yang du goms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: des bzlas pa ni yang dang yang du goms par byed pa'o //
translated: The repetition by that is the repeated practice.

original: des ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: des ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: By that, there is no intrinsic reality.

original: mngon par zhen pa spangs pa dang bzang po ste /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa spangs pa dang bzang po ste /
translated: The abandonment of clinging is the good.

original: spro ba'i rim gyis sems can gyi don byed pas dus gsum sangs rgyas te 'gro ba rnams brtags pa ni bsam pa thams cad yongs su skong ba'o //
analyzed: spro ba'i rim gyis sems can gyi don byed pas dus gsum sangs rgyas te 'gro ba rnams brtags pa ni bsam pa thams cad yongs su skong ba'o //
translated: The activity for the welfare of sentient beings by the process of emanation is the buddhas of the three times. The examination of migrating beings is the fulfillment of all wishes.üîΩThat is said to be the repetition of Ratnasa·πÉbhava, the nature of the indivisible vajra space treasury.

original: de ni rdo rje ltar mi phyed pa'i nam mkha' mdzod kyi rang bzhin gyi rin chen 'byung ldan gyi bzlas par brjod do zhes bya ba ni rin chen bzlas pa ste dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rdo rje ltar mi phyed pa'i nam mkha' mdzod kyi rang bzhin gyi rin chen 'byung ldan gyi bzlas par brjod do zhes bya ba ni rin chen bzlas pa ste dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
translated: The repetition of the jewel is the explanation of the intention.

original: don rtogs pa ni 'gro ba ma lus pa rjes su 'dzin par byed pa'i bya ba nan tan sgrub pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: don rtogs pa ni 'gro ba ma lus pa rjes su 'dzin par byed pa'i bya ba nan tan sgrub pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The realization of the meaning is the gnosis of accomplishing the practice, which takes care of all living beings without exception.

original: de bzlas pa ste /
analyzed: de bzlas pa ste /
translated: That is the recitation.

original: de la brten nas smin pa dang grol ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la brten nas smin pa dang grol ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba ste /
translated: Based on that, the activity characterized by ripening and liberation, etc.,

original: de ni ngo bo nyid med de //
analyzed: de ni ngo bo nyid med de //
translated: is not an entity.

original: 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo dang @69b bzang po'i ste yongs su 'dzin pa med par dus gsum sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo dang @69b bzang po'i ste yongs su 'dzin pa med par dus gsum sangs rgyas te /
translated: The nature of the three spheres being pure, the recitation is excellent, i.e., without grasping, of the buddhas of the three times.

original: lus dang ngag dang sems rnams brtags pa ni de'i rang bzhin nyid du brtags pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang sems rnams brtags pa ni de'i rang bzhin nyid du brtags pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The investigation of body, speech, and mind is the investigation of their nature.

original: de ni bzlas pa ste don yod pa'i bzlas pa zhes bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: de ni bzlas pa ste don yod pa'i bzlas pa zhes bya bar brjod do //
translated: That is the recitation, which is called the recitation of the Amogha.

original: don yod pa'i bzlas pa ste dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: don yod pa'i bzlas pa ste dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
translated: The recitation of the Amogha is the explanation by way of the intention.

original: don rtogs pa ni dngos po thams cad mkhyen pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams te /
analyzed: don rtogs pa ni dngos po thams cad mkhyen pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams te /
translated: The realization of the meaning is the buddhas and bodhisattvas, who know all things.

original: de rnams kyis ci nas kyang thos par bya'o snyam pa'i dad pas sngags kyi tshig rnams shin tu gsal bar 'dod pas bzlas pa gang yin pa ni don rtogs pa'i bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyis ci nas kyang thos par bya'o snyam pa'i dad pas sngags kyi tshig rnams shin tu gsal bar 'dod pas bzlas pa gang yin pa ni don rtogs pa'i bzlas pa'o //
translated: The recitation which is done by one who desires to make the mantra words very clear with faith that thinks, ‚ÄúI will listen to them in any way,‚Äù is the recitation of the realization of the meaning.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa ste rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i bzang po'i sa ste sems kyis dus gsum sangs rgyas brtags pa ste de rnams la dmigs nas bzlas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa ste rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i bzang po'i sa ste sems kyis dus gsum sangs rgyas brtags pa ste de rnams la dmigs nas bzlas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The recitation which is done by one who, having imagined the Buddhas of the three times with a good mind, that is, with a mind free of conceptualization, that is, with a mind free of intrinsic reality, focuses on them, is the recitation of the realization of the meaning.

original: de ni rdo rje ltar brtan pa'i khro bo rnams kyi bzlas ba ste /
analyzed: de ni rdo rje ltar brtan pa'i khro bo rnams kyi bzlas ba ste /
translated: That is the recitation of the vajra-like wrathful ones.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa yin zhing khro bo'i bzlas pa zhes brjod do zhes bya ba ni khro bo'i bzlas pa ste dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa yin zhing khro bo'i bzlas pa zhes brjod do zhes bya ba ni khro bo'i bzlas pa ste dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
translated: It is the vajra recitation, and is called the recitation of the wrathful ones.

original: don rtogs pa ni srog dang brtsol  ba dag ste de dag phyogs dang yul dang dus dang kha dog dang dbyibs spangs nas bzlas pa ni don rtogs pa'i bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: don rtogs pa ni srog dang brtsol  ba dag ste de dag phyogs dang yul dang dus dang kha dog dang dbyibs spangs nas bzlas pa ni don rtogs pa'i bzlas pa'o //
translated: The realization of the meaning is the prƒÅ·πáa and ƒÅyƒÅma, and the recitation of the realization of the meaning is the recitation that abandons direction, place, time, color, and shape.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam pa thams cad dang bral ba nyid yin pas ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam pa thams cad dang bral ba nyid yin pas ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: Therefore, it is devoid of intrinsic reality, since it is free from all aspects.

original: zhi ba nyid yin pa'i phyir bzang po'o //
analyzed: zhi ba nyid yin pa'i phyir bzang po'o //
translated: It is good, since it is peace.

original: dus gsum ni 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: dus gsum ni 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang 'byung ba'o //
translated: The three times are the past, future, and present.

original: sangs rgyas ni rlung rnams so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni rlung rnams so //
translated: The buddhas are the winds.üîΩThe vajra repetition is the realization of the reality of the emptiness of all of them.

original: de rnams brtags pa ste thams cad stong pa'i de kho na nyid du khong du chud pa gang yin pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa ste ma ning gi bzlas pa zhes bya bar bshad do zhes bya ba ni ma ning gi bzlas pa ste dgongs pas bshad pa'o
analyzed: de rnams brtags pa ste thams cad stong pa'i de kho na nyid du khong du chud pa gang yin pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa ste ma ning gi bzlas pa zhes bya bar bshad do zhes bya ba ni ma ning gi bzlas pa ste dgongs pas bshad pa'o
translated: This is explained as the neuter repetition.

original: // de ltar na rdo rje bzlas pa rnam pa bcu gcig yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: // de ltar na rdo rje bzlas pa rnam pa bcu gcig yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: Thus, vajra repetition is explained as being of eleven types.

original: da ni de nyid kyi dbye ba gzhan /üîΩslong mo za zhing mi bzla ste //
analyzed: da ni de nyid kyi dbye ba gzhan / slong mo za zhing mi bzla ste //
translated: Now, another classification of it is stated:üîΩOne should not recite while eating alms,

original: slong la dga' bar mi bya'o//
analyzed: slong la dga' bar mi bya'o//
translated: nor should one delight in begging.

original: 'dod pa kun la longs spyod cing //
analyzed: 'dod pa kun la longs spyod cing //
translated: One should enjoy all desires

original: sngags kyi yan lag ma nyams bzlas //
analyzed: sngags kyi yan lag ma nyams bzlas //
translated: and recite without impairing the mantra limbs.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te don ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te don ni 'di yin no //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: slong mo za zhing ste dman pa'i sems su bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: slong mo za zhing ste dman pa'i sems su bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: One should not eat alms, i.e., one should not have a lowly attitude.

original: slong la dga' bar mi bya ba ni zas gang yang rung ba zhig rnyed pas chog shes par bya'i zas la mngon par chags par bya ba ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: slong la dga' bar mi bya ba ni zas gang yang rung ba zhig rnyed pas chog shes par bya'i zas la mngon par chags par bya ba ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: One should not delight in begging, i.e., one should be satisfied with whatever food one finds, and one should not be attached to food.

original: sngags kyi yan lag ma nyams bzlas te /
analyzed: sngags kyi yan lag ma nyams bzlas te /
translated: One should repeat the mantra without loss of limbs,

original: lha'i rnal 'byor tha dad pa med pa'o //üîΩde'i @70a * //
analyzed: lha'i rnal 'byor tha dad pa med pa'o // de'i @70a * //
translated: i.e., without loss of the divine yoga.

original: tshe rnal 'byor pa 'dod pa kun la longs spyod par 'gyur te drang ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshe rnal 'byor pa 'dod pa kun la longs spyod par 'gyur te drang ba'i don to //
translated: At that time, the yogi will enjoy all desires. This is the interpretable meaning.

original: yang na slong mo ni tha dad pa'i rnam pa can gyi yi ge rnams so //
analyzed: yang na slong mo ni tha dad pa'i rnam pa can gyi yi ge rnams so //
translated: Or else, alms are the different kinds of syllables.

original: de za ba ste de rjod par byed pas bzlas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de za ba ste de rjod par byed pas bzlas par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not eat them, i.e., one should not utter them.

original: slong la ste phyi rol gyi zas la dga' bar mi bya'i 'on kyang bsam gtan gyi zas kyis gnas par bya'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: slong la ste phyi rol gyi zas la dga' bar mi bya'i 'on kyang bsam gtan gyi zas kyis gnas par bya'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: One should not delight in begging, i.e., in external food, but one should abide in the food of concentration. This is the definitive meaning.

original: sngags kyi yan lag ma nyams pa ste yi ge gsum tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i sngags so //
analyzed: sngags kyi yan lag ma nyams pa ste yi ge gsum tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i sngags so //
translated: The mantra is without loss of mantra limbs, that is, the mantra is without the conception of the three syllables as separate.

original: 'dod pa kun la longs spyod cing ste 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la nye bar longs spyod pa bzhin du bzlas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod pa kun la longs spyod cing ste 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la nye bar longs spyod pa bzhin du bzlas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i don to //
translated: One should recite while enjoying all desires, that is, while enjoying the five sense objects. This is the definitive meaning.

original: mdor bstan pa'i tshig yin no zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i rgyud las sngags kyi de kho na nyid gleng slong ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: mdor bstan pa'i tshig yin no zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i rgyud las sngags kyi de kho na nyid gleng slong ba'i tshig go //
translated: The words of the brief teaching are the words of the root tantra that introduce the reality of mantra.

original: de ltar mdor bstan pa byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar mdor bstan pa byas nas /
translated: Having thus given the brief teaching,

original: dgongs pa lung bstan pa'i rgyud las bshad pa /
analyzed: dgongs pa lung bstan pa'i rgyud las bshad pa /
translated: the explanation from the Tantra of the Revelation of the Intention follows:

original: de nas dpal ldan snang mdzad che //
analyzed: de nas dpal ldan snang mdzad che //
translated: Then the glorious great Illuminator

original: khyab bdag la ni slar gsol ba //
analyzed: khyab bdag la ni slar gsol ba //
translated: again asked the all-pervading lord:

original: sems can thams cad skyed pa po //
analyzed: sems can thams cad skyed pa po //
translated: ‚ÄúThe creator of all sentient beings,

original: sna tshogs gzugs can sems 'di ni //
analyzed: sna tshogs gzugs can sems 'di ni //
translated: this mind with various forms,

original: rang bzhin med kyang skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rang bzhin med kyang skye bar 'gyur //
translated: arises without intrinsic nature,

original: dngos po zhes byar rab tu grags //
analyzed: dngos po zhes byar rab tu grags //
translated: and is well known as ‚Äòentity.‚Äô

original: byang chub sems ni mkha' mnyam pa //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni mkha' mnyam pa //
translated: Awakening mind is equal to space,

original: nyams su myong bar bgyi ba'i phyir //
analyzed: nyams su myong bar bgyi ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to experience it,

original: 'gro ba'i don ni mdzad slad du //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don ni mdzad slad du //
translated: For the sake of accomplishing the welfare of the world,

original: skye bo mchog la de bstan gsol //
analyzed: skye bo mchog la de bstan gsol //
translated: Please teach it to the supreme beings.üîΩHaving understood merely the means of practice,

original: bsgrub pa yi ni thabs tsam zhig / shes nas rgyud la mi mkhas pa //üîΩ'di ltar bdag ni slob dpon zhes //
analyzed: bsgrub pa yi ni thabs tsam zhig / shes nas rgyud la mi mkhas pa // 'di ltar bdag ni slob dpon zhes //
translated: Not skilled in the tantra,üîΩOne should say to those skilled in the scriptures:

original: lung la mkhas pa rnams la smra //
analyzed: lung la mkhas pa rnams la smra //
translated: I am a teacher,

original: bdag gi tshig ni bdag nyid shes //üîΩde skad smras nas byis pa 'jig / des ni dgongs pa'i byang chub sems //
analyzed: bdag gi tshig ni bdag nyid shes // de skad smras nas byis pa 'jig / des ni dgongs pa'i byang chub sems //
translated: Know my words myself.üîΩHaving said this, a certain childüîΩDoes not understand the intended bodhicitta

original: ji bzhin don du mi shes so //
analyzed: ji bzhin don du mi shes so //
translated: As it truly is.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs pa 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs pa 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: sngags kyi de kho na nyid gsal bar bya ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i sems can rnams kyi snod ma yin pa nyid la gsang bar bya ba dang / yang dag pa'i bstan pa la bskul bar bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang la gsol ba 'debs te /
analyzed: sngags kyi de kho na nyid gsal bar bya ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i sems can rnams kyi snod ma yin pa nyid la gsang bar bya ba dang / yang dag pa'i bstan pa la bskul bar bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang la gsol ba 'debs te /
translated: In order to clarify the reality of mantra, to keep it secret from unsuitable future beings, and to encourage the correct teaching, [the BhagavƒÅn] requests Vajradhara.

original: de nas te le'u'i rjes thogs su'o //
analyzed: de nas te le'u'i rjes thogs su'o //
translated: Then, means after the chapter.

original: dpal ldan ni phyag na rdo rje'o //
analyzed: dpal ldan ni phyag na rdo rje'o //
translated: Glorious is Vajrapani.

original: snang mdzad che ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
analyzed: snang mdzad che ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
translated: Great Illuminator is Great Vajradhara.

original: khyab bdag ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag po'o //
analyzed: khyab bdag ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag po'o //
translated: Sovereign is the lord of all Tathagatas.üîΩThe reply is the question in return.

original: slar gsol ni lan du dri ba zhus pa'o zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: slar gsol ni lan du dri ba zhus pa'o zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: Thus, this is the literal meaning.

original: kye bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po sems rnam par shes pa 'di ni re zhig sna tshogs gzugs can te dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: kye bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po sems rnam par shes pa 'di ni re zhig sna tshogs gzugs can te dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin du gnas pa'o //
translated: O Bhagavat, Great Vajradhara, this mind, consciousness, is indeed of various forms, abiding as the nature of all things.

original: sems can thams @70b cad kyi brtan pa dang g-yo ba la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams so //
analyzed: sems can thams @70b cad kyi brtan pa dang g-yo ba la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams so //
translated: It is the things of all sentient beings, the stable, the moving, and so forth.

original: skyed pa po zhes bya ba ni skyed par byed pa po'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: skyed pa po zhes bya ba ni skyed par byed pa po'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The producer is the nature of the producer.

original: 'on kyang rnam par dpyad na rang bzhin med pa ste chos thams cad bdag med par skye zhing de'i rang bzhin kho na yin yang /
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam par dpyad na rang bzhin med pa ste chos thams cad bdag med par skye zhing de'i rang bzhin kho na yin yang /
translated: However, when analyzed, it is essenceless, and all phenomena arise as selfless, and that is its nature.

original: 'on kyang mi shes pa'i bag chags kyi dbang gis dngos po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang mi shes pa'i bag chags kyi dbang gis dngos po zhes bya ste /
translated: Nevertheless, by the power of the latent impressions of nescience, it is called a thing.

original: yul dang dbang po dang brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po'i ngo bor rab tu grags zhes bya ba ni so sor rtog pa'o //üîΩde lta bu sems kyi rang bzhin rnal 'byor gyi mngon sum mam //
analyzed: yul dang dbang po dang brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po'i ngo bor rab tu grags zhes bya ba ni so sor rtog pa'o // de lta bu sems kyi rang bzhin rnal 'byor gyi mngon sum mam //
translated: The nature of the entities of the animate and inanimate world is well known as the objects and the sense faculties. This is the discernment.üîΩThus, in order to experience and realize the nature of mind by the valid knowledge of the direct perception of yoga

original: rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad mas nyams su myong bar bgyi zhing mngon du bgyi ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad mas nyams su myong bar bgyi zhing mngon du bgyi ba'i phyir te /
translated: or the direct perception of self-awareness,

original: bdag cag gi sems kyi rgyud brtan par bgyi ba'i slad du bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang gis bstan du gsol zhing bshad du gsol /
analyzed: bdag cag gi sems kyi rgyud brtan par bgyi ba'i slad du bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang gis bstan du gsol zhing bshad du gsol /
translated: in order to stabilize our mindstreams, BhagavƒÅn Vajradhara, please teach and explain.

original: su la zhen skye bo mchog la ste dad pa la sogs pa'i yon tan sngon du song ba'i nyan pa po snod du bsdu ba la'o //
analyzed: su la zhen skye bo mchog la ste dad pa la sogs pa'i yon tan sngon du song ba'i nyan pa po snod du bsdu ba la'o //
translated: To whom? To the supreme person, the listener who is a vessel due to having previously cultivated qualities such as faith.

original: sems kyi rang gi ngo bo de yang byang chub kyi sems te don dam pa'i de kho na nyid kyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: sems kyi rang gi ngo bo de yang byang chub kyi sems te don dam pa'i de kho na nyid kyi ngo bo'o //
translated: And that nature of mind is the bodhicitta, the nature of ultimate reality.

original: mkha' mnyam pa ni nam mkha' bzhin du gos pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mkha' mnyam pa ni nam mkha' bzhin du gos pa med pa'o //
translated: Space-like means unstained like space.

original: ci'i phyir bstan par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bstan par bya zhe na /
translated: Why should it be taught?

original: 'gro ba'i don te sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don te sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i slad du'o //
translated: For the sake of the world, for the sake of sentient beings.

original: 'di ltar da ltar gyi dus kyi nyan pa po 'di dag ni nga rgyal can yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar da ltar gyi dus kyi nyan pa po 'di dag ni nga rgyal can yin te /
translated: Thus, the listeners of the present time are proud,

original: 'di lta ste gang du sa bon la sogs pa 'ba' zhig dang bzlas pa tsam gtso bor gyur pa'i lha'i bskyed pa tsam thabs gang gis bsgrub pa ni sgrub pa'i thabs tsam mo //
analyzed: 'di lta ste gang du sa bon la sogs pa 'ba' zhig dang bzlas pa tsam gtso bor gyur pa'i lha'i bskyed pa tsam thabs gang gis bsgrub pa ni sgrub pa'i thabs tsam mo //
translated: thinking, By merely generating the deity, by merely reciting the mantra, by merely the method of the mere generation of the deity, where the mere seed syllable and so on are primary, the purpose of sentient beings is accomplished.

original: de shes shing thos nas rgyud la ste rtsa ba'i rgyud la yang mi mkhas shing mi shes na re zhig rgyud gzhan rnams lta zhog snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de shes shing thos nas rgyud la ste rtsa ba'i rgyud la yang mi mkhas shing mi shes na re zhig rgyud gzhan rnams lta zhog snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Having understood and heard that, thinking that if one is not skilled and does not understand even the root tantra, then what need is there to mention the other tantras,

original: de'i phyir de tsam kho nas don byas pa nyid yin par sems so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de tsam kho nas don byas pa nyid yin par sems so //
translated: they think that the purpose is accomplished by that alone.

original: gal te de lta yin yang de'i tshe nyes pa med na bdag ni slob dpon te rdo rje slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas yin zhes bya ba'i bar du smra zhing rang gi kha nas sam /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin yang de'i tshe nyes pa med na bdag ni slob dpon te rdo rje slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas yin zhes bya ba'i bar du smra zhing rang gi kha nas sam /
translated: If, despite this, there is no fault, then you should say, ‚ÄúI am a master, a vajra master.‚ÄùüîΩ

original: gzhan gyi kha nas grags pa sgrogs par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi kha nas grags pa sgrogs par byed do //
translated: If, even though this is so, there is no fault, then one speaks, saying, ‚ÄúI am a master, a vajra master,‚Äù and so on, and one proclaims one‚Äôs own words or the words of others.

original: gal te byis pa rnams kyi nang du smra ba de'i tshe 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te byis pa rnams kyi nang du smra ba de'i tshe 'thad pa yin no //
translated: If one speaks among the childish, then that is appropriate.

original: ji srid du lung la mkhas pa rnams la ste bstan bcos mang po shes pa de rnams la yang smra bar byed do //
analyzed: ji srid du lung la mkhas pa rnams la ste bstan bcos mang po shes pa de rnams la yang smra bar byed do //
translated: As long as one speaks to those who are learned in the scriptures, those who know many treatises, one speaks to them.

original: bstan bcos la mkhas pa de rnams ni de dag la 'di skad du smras pa de ni rigs so zhe 'am mi rigs so zhes smra bar mi byed do //
analyzed: bstan bcos la mkhas pa de rnams ni de dag la 'di skad du smras pa de ni rigs so zhe 'am mi rigs so zhes smra bar mi byed do //
translated: Those who are learned in the treatises do not say, ‚ÄúThat is correct‚Äù or ‚ÄúThat is incorrect.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir cung zad tsam shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mgu bar dka' bdag yin te /üîΩbde bas mgu bar bya bar @71a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir cung zad tsam shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mgu bar dka' bdag yin te / bde bas mgu bar bya bar @71a * //
translated: Because they are difficult to please, since they know just a little.

original: mi shes pa //
analyzed: mi shes pa //
translated: They do not know how to be pleased by happiness.

original: shin tu bde bas mgu ba mkhas pa ste //
analyzed: shin tu bde bas mgu ba mkhas pa ste //
translated: The wise are pleased by great happiness.

original: shes pa'i cha yi blo ngan gyur pa'i mi //
analyzed: shes pa'i cha yi blo ngan gyur pa'i mi //
translated: The person whose mind is corrupted by the part of knowledge

original: tshangs pas kyang ni mgu bar nus pa min //
analyzed: tshangs pas kyang ni mgu bar nus pa min //
translated: cannot be satisfied even by Brahma.

original: zhes gang bshad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes gang bshad pa'o //
translated: This is what is explained.

original: de bzhin du de skad smras nas byis pa rnams te byis pa'i blo can rnams 'jig cing lam ngan pa la skul bar byed do ;
analyzed: de bzhin du de skad smras nas byis pa rnams te byis pa'i blo can rnams 'jig cing lam ngan pa la skul bar byed do ;
translated: Thus, having spoken in this way, the childish ones, those with childish minds, are destroyed and are urged on to the bad path.

original: / ji skad du zhe na /
analyzed: / ji skad du zhe na /
translated: How is it said?

original: bdag gi tshig de kho na nyid gtso bor gyur pa gang yin pa 'di ni gzhan gang gis kyang shes pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang man ngag mang po yod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyis shes pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag gi tshig de kho na nyid gtso bor gyur pa gang yin pa 'di ni gzhan gang gis kyang shes pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang man ngag mang po yod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyis shes pa yin te /
translated: This statement of mine, which is foremost in reality, is not known by anyone else, but rather it is known by myself because of the mere existence of many instructions.

original: ji srid du bdag gnas pa de srid du bcom ldan 'das dpal rdo rje 'chang gi bstan pa 'dzam bu'i gling du rgyas shing sdod la gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji srid du bdag gnas pa de srid du bcom ldan 'das dpal rdo rje 'chang gi bstan pa 'dzam bu'i gling du rgyas shing sdod la gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: For as long as I remain, for that long the teaching of the glorious Vajradhara, the Blessed One, will spread, endure, and remain in the world. This is the meaning.

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi nyan pa po bstan pa 'jig par byed pa'i bdag nyid ngan pa'i bdud nyid 'byung ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi nyan pa po bstan pa 'jig par byed pa'i bdag nyid ngan pa'i bdud nyid 'byung ste /
translated: Such a listener, who is of the nature of a bad demon, who destroys the teaching, will appear.

original: des ni dgongs pa'i byang chub sems te don zab mo ston par byed pa'i sgras bstan par bya ba ji bzhin du ste de kho na nyid du mi shes shing mi rtogs so //
analyzed: des ni dgongs pa'i byang chub sems te don zab mo ston par byed pa'i sgras bstan par bya ba ji bzhin du ste de kho na nyid du mi shes shing mi rtogs so //
translated: He does not know, does not understand, just as it is, in reality, the intended thought of the bodhisattva, the meaning that is taught by the words that teach the profound meaning.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das la rin po che lta bu'i gang zag gi ched du mdzad nas tsandan lta bu la sogs pa'i gang zag rnams rjes su gzung ba'i phyir de kho na nyid bstan du gsol zhes gsol ba 'debs te yi ge'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das la rin po che lta bu'i gang zag gi ched du mdzad nas tsandan lta bu la sogs pa'i gang zag rnams rjes su gzung ba'i phyir de kho na nyid bstan du gsol zhes gsol ba 'debs te yi ge'i don to //
translated: Therefore, having taught for the sake of the jewel-like person, the BhagavƒÅn is entreated to teach reality in order to take care of the persons who are like sandalwood, etc. This is the meaning of the words.

original: gsol ba btab pa'i rjes thogs la bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: gsol ba btab pa'i rjes thogs la bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: Immediately after the entreaty, the BhagavƒÅn

original: de nas bdag po bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: de nas bdag po bcom ldan 'das //
translated: then, the BhagavƒÅn, the lord,

original: rnam par snang mdzad thub chen gyis //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad thub chen gyis //
translated: Vairocana, the great sage,

original: legs zhes lan gsum gsungs mdzad nas //
analyzed: legs zhes lan gsum gsungs mdzad nas //
translated: having spoken ‚ÄúExcellent‚Äù three times,

original: lag na rdo rje la 'di gsungs //
analyzed: lag na rdo rje la 'di gsungs //
translated: said this to VajrapƒÅ·πái:

original: mi rtog don gyi de nyid ni //
analyzed: mi rtog don gyi de nyid ni //
translated: The reality of the meaning of nonconceptuality

original: rab tu phye nas bshad par bya //
analyzed: rab tu phye nas bshad par bya //
translated: I will explain it in detail.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: bdag po ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: bdag po ni drug pa'o //
translated: The sixth is the Lord.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa 'joms par byed pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das te yi ge'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa 'joms par byed pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das te yi ge'i don to //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn is so called because he conquers the afflictions such as desire, etc. This is the verbal meaning.

original: bha ga dang 'brel pas 'gro ba skyed par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das te phyi'i don to //
analyzed: bha ga dang 'brel pas 'gro ba skyed par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das te phyi'i don to //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn is so called because he is the creator of the world through his connection with the bhaga. This is the external meaning.

original: bha gar byang chub kyi sems kyi gzugs su gnas par byed pas na bcom ldan 'das te sbas pa'o //
analyzed: bha gar byang chub kyi sems kyi gzugs su gnas par byed pas na bcom ldan 'das te sbas pa'o //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn is so called because he abides in the form of the bodhicitta in the bhaga. This is the hidden meaning.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes ni bcom pa ste de dang ldan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das so zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes ni bcom pa ste de dang ldan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das so zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'o //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn is so called because he possesses the conquest, which is nondual wisdom. This is the ultimate meaning.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po rjes su zhugs pas rnam par snang mdzad ni rnam par snang mdzad chen po'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po rjes su zhugs pas rnam par snang mdzad ni rnam par snang mdzad chen po'o //
translated: MahƒÅvairocana is the Great Vairocana because he is engaged in the Great Vajradhara.

original: ye shes gsum shes shing rtogs pa'i phyir thub pa ste sbas pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes gsum shes shing rtogs pa'i phyir thub pa ste sbas pa'o //
translated: The Muni is so called because he knows and realizes the three wisdoms. This is the hidden meaning.

original: lag na rdo rje la legs so zhes @71b bya ba byin nas 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: lag na rdo rje la legs so zhes @71b bya ba byin nas 'di gsungs so //
translated: To VajrapƒÅ·πái he gave the word Excellent! and spoke this:

original: dri ba mchog nyid yin pa'i phyir lan gsum mdzad do //
analyzed: dri ba mchog nyid yin pa'i phyir lan gsum mdzad do //
translated: He gave the answer three times because the question was supreme.

original: mi rtog don gyi ste sngags rnams kyi de nyid don dam pa sngags kyi de kho na nyid bshad par bya zhing brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: mi rtog don gyi ste sngags rnams kyi de nyid don dam pa sngags kyi de kho na nyid bshad par bya zhing brjod par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the mantra, which is non-conceptual, is the ultimate truth of the mantra, the reality of the mantra, which should be explained and spoken.

original: rab tu phye nas zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi de kho na nyid 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rab tu phye nas zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi de kho na nyid 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
translated: Having distinguished it, means that not only the reality of the mantra,

original: 'on kyang sngags btu ba dang sngags kyi don dang sngags kyi brda rnams kyang bshad par bya'o zhes pa'i don te //
analyzed: 'on kyang sngags btu ba dang sngags kyi don dang sngags kyi brda rnams kyang bshad par bya'o zhes pa'i don te //
translated: but also the selection of the mantra, the meaning of the mantra, and the symbols of the mantra should be explained.

original: yi ge'i don to //
analyzed: yi ge'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the syllables.

original: de la dang po mdor bstan te //
analyzed: de la dang po mdor bstan te //
translated: Among them, first it is taught in brief:

original: brjod dang dmigs pa zhes bya ba //
analyzed: brjod dang dmigs pa zhes bya ba //
translated: Expression and reference

original: brdar brtags dang ni don dam mo //
analyzed: brdar brtags dang ni don dam mo //
translated: are the conventional and the ultimate.

original: brjod cing yi ge phyi mo las bcu bar bya ba yin pas brjod pa ste sngags btu ba'o //
analyzed: brjod cing yi ge phyi mo las bcu bar bya ba yin pas brjod pa ste sngags btu ba'o //
translated: Since it is expressed and selected from the alphabet, it is expression, which is the selection of the mantra.

original: brjod par byed pa'i sngags brjod pa'i sgo nas brjod par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs par bya zhing dmigs par bya ba yin pas na dmigs pa ni sngags kyi don to //
analyzed: brjod par byed pa'i sngags brjod pa'i sgo nas brjod par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs par bya zhing dmigs par bya ba yin pas na dmigs pa ni sngags kyi don to //
translated: The object of observation is the meaning of the mantra, because it is to be realized and observed as the nature of the object of expression through the expression of the mantra that expresses it.

original: brdar btags pa ni ming ngo //
analyzed: brdar btags pa ni ming ngo //
translated: The conventional is the name.

original: don dam pa ni de kho na nyid de sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa ni de kho na nyid de sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: The ultimate is reality, which is just as it is.

original: bshad pa ni tshig gi brjod pa thun mong ste /
analyzed: bshad pa ni tshig gi brjod pa thun mong ste /
translated: The explanation is the common verbal expression.

original: dmigs pa sangs rgyas nyid de yin //
analyzed: dmigs pa sangs rgyas nyid de yin //
translated: The object of observation is buddhahood itself.

original: brda zhes bya ba sngags yin te //
analyzed: brda zhes bya ba sngags yin te //
translated: The conventional is said to be the mantra.

original: don dam de bzhin nyid yin no //
analyzed: don dam de bzhin nyid yin no //
translated: The ultimate is reality.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said.

original: thun mong zhes pa snying po dang nye ba'i snying po la sogs pa rnams dang / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa la sogs pa'i bstan bcos thams cad la nor bu'i phreng ba'i nang gi skud pa bzhin khyab par byed pa'i yi ge phyi mo ste /
analyzed: thun mong zhes pa snying po dang nye ba'i snying po la sogs pa rnams dang / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa la sogs pa'i bstan bcos thams cad la nor bu'i phreng ba'i nang gi skud pa bzhin khyab par byed pa'i yi ge phyi mo ste /
translated: The common is the basic syllable that pervades all treatises, mundane and supramundane, such as the essence, the close essence, and so on, like a thread in a string of jewels.

original: de las sngags btu par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de las sngags btu par bya ba'o //
translated: The mantra is to be extracted from that.

original: de ni tshig tu brjod pa ste sngags btu ba sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: de ni tshig tu brjod pa ste sngags btu ba sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: That is the verbal expression, the mantra formation, as it is heard.

original: dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi de nyid de rang gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi de nyid de rang gi ngo bo'o //
translated: The objective support is the reality of Vairochana, etc., the Buddhas, their very nature.

original: aom la sogs pa rnams kyi don ni go rims bzhin du sku rdo rje la sogs pa rnams yin te /
analyzed: aom la sogs pa rnams kyi don ni go rims bzhin du sku rdo rje la sogs pa rnams yin te /
translated: The meanings of the syllables Om, etc., are the Vajra Body, etc., in order.

original: de kho na bzhin du yi ge phyi mo'i don yang dbyangs dang gsal bya'i dbye bas thabs dang shes rab dag yin no //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du yi ge phyi mo'i don yang dbyangs dang gsal bya'i dbye bas thabs dang shes rab dag yin no //
translated: Just so, the meanings of the subsequent syllables are method and insight, by the division into vowels and consonants.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang shes bar bya ste spyi'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang shes bar bya ste spyi'i don to //
translated: The general meaning is to be understood in the same way in other cases as well.

original: brda zhes bya ba sngags yin te //
analyzed: brda zhes bya ba sngags yin te //
translated: The sign is the mantra.

original: zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi ming ste /üîΩsprul dang mgo med pa dang mtha' med pa dang btus pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi ming ste / sprul dang mgo med pa dang mtha' med pa dang btus pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: This is the name of the mantra.

original: 'di rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba ni las kyi bye brag las shes par bya ste sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba ni las kyi bye brag las shes par bya ste sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: The mantra is the collection of syllables, such as Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri, Nri,

original: don dam zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid de spros pa thams cad bral ba'i 'od gsal ba yin @72a * //
analyzed: don dam zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid de spros pa thams cad bral ba'i 'od gsal ba yin @72a * //
translated: The so-called ultimate is thatness, which is the clear light free from all elaborations.

original: par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'o //
translated: This is to be understood as the final [stage].

original: da ni so sor bshad pa /
analyzed: da ni so sor bshad pa /
translated: Now, the individual explanations:

original: dang po gcig ni dgu dbus na //
analyzed: dang po gcig ni dgu dbus na //
translated: The first one is in the middle of the nine,

original: gang zhig bcu yis ma bcings pa //
analyzed: gang zhig bcu yis ma bcings pa //
translated: Not bound by the ten,

original: de ni bcings med zhes bya ste //
analyzed: de ni bcings med zhes bya ste //
translated: That is called unbound.

original: da ni mchog gi gnas shes pa //
analyzed: da ni mchog gi gnas shes pa //
translated: Now, knowing the supreme place,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te gcig ni re zhig yi ge a'a'o//
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te gcig ni re zhig yi ge a'a'o//
translated: The first one is the letter A, which is the first of all the letters.

original: de nyid ni dang po ste yi ge phyi mo thams cad 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni dang po ste yi ge phyi mo thams cad 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
translated: That itself is the first, which is the cause for the arising of all the later letters.

original: mtshan yang dag par brjod pa las //
analyzed: mtshan yang dag par brjod pa las //
translated: As it is said in the Litany of the Names of Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´:

original: aa ni yig 'bru kun gyi mchog / ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: aa ni yig 'bru kun gyi mchog / ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: A is the supreme of all the letters.

original: dgu ste yi ge phyi mo'i sde tshan rnams kyi dbus na khyab par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: dgu ste yi ge phyi mo'i sde tshan rnams kyi dbus na khyab par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid du gnas pa'o //
translated: In the middle of the nine, it abides as the pervading nature in the middle of the groups of later letters.

original: de med na brjod par mi nus te dbyangs med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de med na brjod par mi nus te dbyangs med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: If it does not exist, it cannot be expressed, like a sound without a melody.

original: de la dbyangs kyi sde tshan ni rnam pa gnyis te //
analyzed: de la dbyangs kyi sde tshan ni rnam pa gnyis te //
translated: There are two kinds of groups of vowels:

analyzed: rnal 'byor pa de ni mchog gi gnas te /

analyzed: de las byung ba'i yi ge gsum gyi de kho na nyid shes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don te /

analyzed: yi ge'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the letters.

original: re zhig gcig ni thams cad stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: re zhig gcig ni thams cad stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi chos kyi sku'o //
translated: The one is the dharmakƒÅya, the nature of the emptiness of everything.

original: dgu ste phung po lnga dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i dbus na gnas kyang bcu yis te dbang po dang yul gyi rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis ma bcings shing ma bsgribs pa ste chos kyi sku ni rang bzhin dag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgu ste phung po lnga dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i dbus na gnas kyang bcu yis te dbang po dang yul gyi rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis ma bcings shing ma bsgribs pa ste chos kyi sku ni rang bzhin dag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the middle of the nine, the five aggregates and the four great elements, it is not bound or obscured by the ten, the concepts of the sense faculties and objects. The dharmakƒÅya is naturally pure.

original: de ni bcings med de nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis zil gyis mi non pa shes pa gang yin pa'i rnal 'byor pa de ni mchog gi gnas te /
analyzed: de ni bcings med de nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis zil gyis mi non pa shes pa gang yin pa'i rnal 'byor pa de ni mchog gi gnas te /
translated: That is not bound, not overcome by the concepts of the afflictive and knowledge obscurations. The yogin who knows that is the supreme abode.

original: chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin gyi sangs rgyas nyid do //
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin gyi sangs rgyas nyid do //
translated: The nature of the Dharma Body is Buddhahood itself.

original: shes pa ni rtogs shing thob pa'o zhes bya ba'i don te spyi'i don to //
analyzed: shes pa ni rtogs shing thob pa'o zhes bya ba'i don te spyi'i don to //
translated: Knowledge is the realization and attainment of that, is the general meaning.

original: yang na re zhig gcig ni bcom ldan 'das 'brug gi sgra @72b ste thugs rdo rje 'dzin gyi sa bon no //
analyzed: yang na re zhig gcig ni bcom ldan 'das 'brug gi sgra @72b ste thugs rdo rje 'dzin gyi sa bon no //
translated: Or, one is the Blessed One, the sound of thunder, the seed of the mind-vajra-holder.

original: de ni dgu ste sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi rang bzhin can gyi dkyil 'khor bzhi dang / de bzhin du gru bzhi dang zlum po dang gru gsum dang gzhu lta bu'i lkog ma dang snying ga dang lte ba dang gsang ba'i gnas te brgyad na dgu pa ni mgo bo la sogs par gnas pa'i h'um gang yin pa'o ;
analyzed: de ni dgu ste sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi rang bzhin can gyi dkyil 'khor bzhi dang / de bzhin du gru bzhi dang zlum po dang gru gsum dang gzhu lta bu'i lkog ma dang snying ga dang lte ba dang gsang ba'i gnas te brgyad na dgu pa ni mgo bo la sogs par gnas pa'i h'um gang yin pa'o ;
translated: That is nine, the four mandalas of the nature of earth, water, fire, and wind, and likewise the four corners, the circle, the triangle, and the bow-like shape of the throat, heart, navel, and secret place, and the ninth is the hum that abides in the head and so forth.

original: / bcu yis te de rnams dang bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: / bcu yis te de rnams dang bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: Ten is those and the self.

original: ma bcings pa ni rlung gi rim gyis rnam par rtog pa'i lam la mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: ma bcings pa ni rlung gi rim gyis rnam par rtog pa'i lam la mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: Unbound is not entering the path of conceptuality by the process of the winds.

original: de lta bu 'di ni bcings med de rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i bzlas pa gang gis shes pa de ni mchog gi gnas te /
analyzed: de lta bu 'di ni bcings med de rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i bzlas pa gang gis shes pa de ni mchog gi gnas te /
translated: This is not bound, because it is the recitation that is pure by nature. He who knows that is the supreme state,

original: 'jug pa la sogs pa spangs pa'i de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: 'jug pa la sogs pa spangs pa'i de kho na nyid do //
translated: the reality that is free from the process of exhalation and so forth.

original: shes pa ni mngon du byed do zhes bya ba'i don te spyi'i don to //
analyzed: shes pa ni mngon du byed do zhes bya ba'i don te spyi'i don to //
translated: Knowledge means to actualize, this is the general meaning.

original: chos kyi dbyings zhus pa las kyang /üîΩmgo med snying gi padmor gnas //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings zhus pa las kyang / mgo med snying gi padmor gnas //
translated: And in the Tantra Requested by the Dakini of Timeless Awareness:üîΩWithout a head, it abides in the heart lotus.

original: kha yi padmar mgo bo gnas //üîΩsgra ni gsang ba'i padmar gnas //üîΩsgra mtha' lte ba'i padmar gnas //
analyzed: kha yi padmar mgo bo gnas // sgra ni gsang ba'i padmar gnas // sgra mtha' lte ba'i padmar gnas //

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: The end of sound abides in the navel lotus.

original: yang na / gcig ni re zhig 'dod pa'i gdugs //
analyzed: yang na / gcig ni re zhig 'dod pa'i gdugs //

original: zhes bya ba'i rtsa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i rtsa'o //

original: de nyid dang po ste tshangs pa'i sgo nas brtsams te gsang ba'i gnas kyi bar du khyab par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid dang po ste tshangs pa'i sgo nas brtsams te gsang ba'i gnas kyi bar du khyab par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the first, because it extends from the aperture of Brahma to the secret place.

original: dgu ste padma 'dab ma brgyad pa lte ba dang bcas pa'i dbus na khyab par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dgu ste padma 'dab ma brgyad pa lte ba dang bcas pa'i dbus na khyab par byed pa'o //
translated: It is nine, because it pervades the center of the eight-petaled lotus.

original: bcu yis te rtsa dgu po de rnams dang rang nyid kyis ma bcings pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa rnams kyis dri ma can du bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bcu yis te rtsa dgu po de rnams dang rang nyid kyis ma bcings pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa rnams kyis dri ma can du bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: The nine channels, together with the one that is not bound by them, are the innate nature itself, and therefore are not sullied by faults such as attachment.

original: de'i phyir de ni bcings med de 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams dang ma 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni bcings med de 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams dang ma 'dres pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not bound, not mixed with attachment, etc.

original: shes pa ni thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pas de la rjes su 'jug pa na bde ba chen po nyams su myong ba'i rnal 'byor pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa ni thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pas de la rjes su 'jug pa na bde ba chen po nyams su myong ba'i rnal 'byor pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Knowledge is the yogi who experiences great bliss when entering into that union of method and wisdom.

original: de ni mchog gi gnas te rdo rje sems dpa'i go 'phang shes shing thob pa zhes bya ba ni sbas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni mchog gi gnas te rdo rje sems dpa'i go 'phang shes shing thob pa zhes bya ba ni sbas pa'o //
translated: That is the supreme state, the state of Vajrasattva, which is called ‚Äúknown and attained.‚Äù

original: gcig ni re zhig 'od gsal ba ste /
analyzed: gcig ni re zhig 'od gsal ba ste /
translated: One is, first of all, clear light.

original: de nyid mchog yin pa'i phyir dang po'o ;
analyzed: de nyid mchog yin pa'i phyir dang po'o ;
translated: Since that is supreme, it is the first.

original: /'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan bzhi dang gzugs med pa bzhi zhes pas dgu pa'i 'khor ba de'i dbus na chos nyid kyis gnas kyang de kho na nyid de la brten nas skad cig gis de las langs par gyur ba na bcu yis te phung po dang /
analyzed: /'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan bzhi dang gzugs med pa bzhi zhes pas dgu pa'i 'khor ba de'i dbus na chos nyid kyis gnas kyang de kho na nyid de la brten nas skad cig gis de las langs par gyur ba na bcu yis te phung po dang /
translated: The nine abodes of samsara are the desire realm, the four concentrations, and the four formless [absorptions].üîΩ
