analyzed: 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis ma @73a * //
translated: The nine [realms] of samsara, which are the desire realm, the four concentrations, and the four formless [absorptions], are the center of that. Although abiding by nature in that reality, in an instant, based on that, when one arises from that, one is not bound by the ten, that is, by the concepts of the aggregates and the elements.

original: bcings pa ni sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis su mthong ba'i phyir kun rdzob kyi phyogs sum lhung ba'o //
analyzed: bcings pa ni sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis su mthong ba'i phyir kun rdzob kyi phyogs sum lhung ba'o //
translated: Since one sees the twelve examples of illusion, one does not fall into the side of the relative.

original: de ni bcings med de thogs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i rim pa gang yin pa de ni mchog gi gnas te /
analyzed: de ni bcings med de thogs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i rim pa gang yin pa de ni mchog gi gnas te /
translated: That is the supreme state, which is the stage of being endowed with the samƒÅdhi of being unimpeded.

original: ye shes kyi sku shes shing thob pa po zhes bya ba ni sbas pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi sku shes shing thob pa po zhes bya ba ni sbas pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe one who knows and obtains the j√±ƒÅnakƒÅya‚Äù is hidden.

original: gcig ni re zhig srog ces bya ba'i rlung ngo //
analyzed: gcig ni re zhig srog ces bya ba'i rlung ngo //
translated: One is the so-called prƒÅ·πáa vƒÅyu.

original: dgu ste rlung dang nye ba'i rlung rnams kyi dbus na gtso bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dang po'o //
analyzed: dgu ste rlung dang nye ba'i rlung rnams kyi dbus na gtso bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dang po'o //
translated: Since it is the principal one among the nine vƒÅyus and the subsidiary vƒÅyus, it is the first.

original: bcu po 'di rnams kyis 'od gsal ba gang zhig ma bcings pa ni rnam par shes pa dang rang bzhin rnams kyis dri ma can du ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: bcu po 'di rnams kyis 'od gsal ba gang zhig ma bcings pa ni rnam par shes pa dang rang bzhin rnams kyis dri ma can du ma byas pa'o //
translated: These ten are not bound by the luminous, which is not made impure by consciousness and the natures.

original: de ni bcings med de thams cad stong pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bcings med de thams cad stong pa'o //
translated: That is unbound, all empty.

original: shes pa ni 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa ni 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Knowledge is what engages.

original: de ni mchog gi gnas te sa bcu pa shes shing thob pa'o zhes bya ba ni sbas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni mchog gi gnas te sa bcu pa shes shing thob pa'o zhes bya ba ni sbas pa'o //
translated: That is the supreme abode, the tenth stage, known and attained.

original: gcig ni padma'o //
analyzed: gcig ni padma'o //
translated: One is the lotus.

original: dang po ni rdo rje'o //
analyzed: dang po ni rdo rje'o //
translated: The first is the vajra.

original: gnyis po de dag dgu dbus na ste /
analyzed: gnyis po de dag dgu dbus na ste /
translated: Those two are in the middle of the nine.

original: sgo dgu'i bdag nyid can gyi lus kyi dbus na gnas par gyur ba na /
analyzed: sgo dgu'i bdag nyid can gyi lus kyi dbus na gnas par gyur ba na /
translated: In the middle of the body, which is of the nature of the nine doors,üîΩfrom the gathering of those, the fourth intimate instruction is attained by the inner stages of service and so on.

original: de dag 'dus pa las nang gi bdag nyid kyi bsnyen pa la sogs pa'i rim pas man ngag bzhi pa thob par gyur par sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang stobs dang shes pa dang de kho na la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bcu yis ma
analyzed: de dag 'dus pa las nang gi bdag nyid kyi bsnyen pa la sogs pa'i rim pas man ngag bzhi pa thob par gyur par sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang stobs dang shes pa dang de kho na la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bcu yis ma
translated: Not bound by the ten concepts of stage, perfection, power, knowledge, reality, and so on,

original: bcings pa ni ma bsgribs pa'o //
analyzed: bcings pa ni ma bsgribs pa'o //
translated: it is unobscured.

original: de ni bcings med de rnam par mi rtog pa'i de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: de ni bcings med de rnam par mi rtog pa'i de kho na nyid do //
translated: That is unfettered, which is the reality free from conceptualization.

original: gang gis shes pa de ni mchog gnas te //
analyzed: gang gis shes pa de ni mchog gnas te //
translated: He who knows that is the supreme abode,

original: snang ba bzhi pa shes shing mthong ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba bzhi pa shes shing mthong ba'o //
translated: which is the knowledge and seeing of the fourth illumination.

original: zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'o //
translated: This is the culmination.

original: gcig ni re zhig sangs rgyas kyi sa ste bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: gcig ni re zhig sangs rgyas kyi sa ste bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: One is the stage of the Buddha, which is the twelfth.

original: de ni khams gsum pa dang srid pa gsum dang dri ma gsum dag par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dgu'i dbus na gtso po nyid yin pas dang po'o //
analyzed: de ni khams gsum pa dang srid pa gsum dang dri ma gsum dag par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dgu'i dbus na gtso po nyid yin pas dang po'o //
translated: That is the first, since it is the principal one among the nine, because it purifies the three realms, the three existences, and the three defilements.

original: de ni bcu yis te 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad dang kun rdzob dang don dam pa dag gis so //
analyzed: de ni bcu yis te 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad dang kun rdzob dang don dam pa dag gis so //
translated: That is not fettered by the ten, which are the eight worldly dharmas and the conventional and the ultimate.

original: ma bcings pa ni tha dad par shes par bya ba yin pa'o //
analyzed: ma bcings pa ni tha dad par shes par bya ba yin pa'o //
translated: Unfettered is to be understood as distinct.

original: de ni bcings med de mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bcings med de mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings la gnas pa'o //
translated: That is unfettered, which is the abode in the realm of nonabiding nirvana.

original: shes pa ni rtogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa ni rtogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Knowledge is realization.

original: de ni mchog gi gnas te zung du 'jug pa'i bdag nyid kyi mi slob pa'i lam gyi ngo bo shes shing rtogs pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ni mchog gi gnas te zung du 'jug pa'i bdag nyid kyi mi slob pa'i lam gyi ngo bo shes shing rtogs pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That is the supreme state, the meaning of which is: the nature of the path of no-more-learning, which is the identity of union, is known and realized.

original: mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: mthar thug pa'o //
translated: It is the ultimate.

original: de nyid rgyas par /
analyzed: de nyid rgyas par /
translated: That itself is elaborated:

original: dbyangs dang gsal bya'i yi ge de //
analyzed: dbyangs dang gsal bya'i yi ge de //
translated: The vowels and consonants,

original: grangs dgu yi ni rjes 'jug pa //
analyzed: grangs dgu yi ni rjes 'jug pa //
translated: are followed by the nine numbers,

original: aas bcings phan tshun yang dag sbyor //
analyzed: aas bcings phan tshun yang dag sbyor //
translated: bound by the letter A, and mutually conjoined.

original: gang gis shes te 'gro ba'i @73b bla ;üîΩ/ zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gis shes te 'gro ba'i @73b bla ; / zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: By whom is it known? The guru of migrators.

original: dbyangs ni re zhig thung ngu dang ring po'i dbye bas rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: dbyangs ni re zhig thung ngu dang ring po'i dbye bas rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The vowels are, for the time being, of two kinds, by the division of short and long.

original: gsal bya ni sde tshan lnga'o //
analyzed: gsal bya ni sde tshan lnga'o //
translated: The consonants are the five classes.

original: yi ge ni mthar gnas dang drod kyi dbye bas rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yi ge ni mthar gnas dang drod kyi dbye bas rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The letters are of two kinds, by the division of finals and finals-of-finals.

original: de ltar na sgo dgu'i bdag nyid kyi lus dang sa dgu pa'i 'khor pa dang phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi rang bzhin gyi khams gsum pa'i rnam par dag pa yin pa'i phyir grangs dgu'i rjes su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na sgo dgu'i bdag nyid kyi lus dang sa dgu pa'i 'khor pa dang phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi rang bzhin gyi khams gsum pa'i rnam par dag pa yin pa'i phyir grangs dgu'i rjes su 'jug pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is the purification of the three realms, which has the nature of the nine bodily constituents, the nine stages, the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, and so it is in accord with the number nine.

original: de thams cad aas bcings te yi ge aas bcings pa'o //
analyzed: de thams cad aas bcings te yi ge aas bcings pa'o //
translated: All of that is bound by the vowel, bound by the letter a.

original: phan tshun yang dag sbyor ba ste //üîΩphan tshun brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i dngos po'am /
analyzed: phan tshun yang dag sbyor ba ste // phan tshun brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i dngos po'am /
translated: The union of the two isüîΩthe mutual expression of the expressed and the expresser,

original: rang gi do bo nyid du gang gis shes pa de ni rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi do bo nyid du gang gis shes pa de ni rtogs pa'o //
translated: or the mutual knowledge of the nature of each.

original: de ni 'gro ba ste khams gsum pa'i bla ma'i ston pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'gro ba ste khams gsum pa'i bla ma'i ston pa'o //
translated: That is the migrator, the teacher of the three realms.

original: chos kyi yi ge rang gi ngo bo dag gi rang bzhin thams cad yongs su shes pa'i phyir grol ba yin zhing gzhan dag kyang grol bar byed do zhes bya ba'i don te dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi yi ge rang gi ngo bo dag gi rang bzhin thams cad yongs su shes pa'i phyir grol ba yin zhing gzhan dag kyang grol bar byed do zhes bya ba'i don te dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The letter of the Dharma is liberated by the knowledge of the nature of all things, and it liberates others as well. This is the meaning, which is not intended.

original: spro ba'i rim gyi sngags bsdu ba gsungs te /
analyzed: spro ba'i rim gyi sngags bsdu ba gsungs te /
translated: The mantra collection of the stage of emanation is stated:

original: bsdu ba'i rim gyis /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i rim gyis /
translated: By the process of contraction,

original: 'byung ba'i mtha' dang yang dag ldan /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i mtha' dang yang dag ldan /
translated: end of the elements, and endowed with the

original: bcu drug cha yi dang po gnas //
analyzed: bcu drug cha yi dang po gnas //
translated: first part of the sixteenth,

original: lnga pa lnga dang yang dag ldan //
analyzed: lnga pa lnga dang yang dag ldan //
translated: endowed with the fifth of the fives,

original: bzhi ni gsum du nges par sbyar //
analyzed: bzhi ni gsum du nges par sbyar //
translated: the four are definitely applied to the three.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is stated.

original: 'byung ba'i mtha' ste 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i sa bon ya la sogs pa rnams kyi mtha' ni yi ge sha'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i mtha' ste 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i sa bon ya la sogs pa rnams kyi mtha' ni yi ge sha'o //
translated: The end of the elements, the seeds of the four great elements, ya and so forth, is the letter sha.

original: yang dag ldan ni de rnams kyi dang po yi ge ya'o //
analyzed: yang dag ldan ni de rnams kyi dang po yi ge ya'o //
translated: Endowed with that, the first of them is the letter ya.

original: bcu drug cha ni dbyangs te de rnams kyi dang po ni yi ge aa'o //
analyzed: bcu drug cha ni dbyangs te de rnams kyi dang po ni yi ge aa'o //
translated: The part of the sixteenth is a vowel, and the first of them is the letter a.

original: lnga pa lnga ni ka la sogs pa'i gsal bya rnams te /
analyzed: lnga pa lnga ni ka la sogs pa'i gsal bya rnams te /
translated: The fifth of the fives is the group of the consonants ka and so forth.

original: de rnams kyi dang po ni gtso bo nyid yin pa'i phyir yi ge ka'o //üîΩde ltar aa ka ya sha ste 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang lha mo bzhi dang zhi ba la sogs pa'i las bzhi dang dga' ba bzhi'i rang bzhin can ni gsum du ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi dang po ni gtso bo nyid yin pa'i phyir yi ge ka'o // de ltar aa ka ya sha ste 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang lha mo bzhi dang zhi ba la sogs pa'i las bzhi dang dga' ba bzhi'i rang bzhin can ni gsum du ste /
translated: The first of them is the letter ka, because it is the principal one.

original: yi ge gsum du nges par sbyar ro //
analyzed: yi ge gsum du nges par sbyar ro //
translated: Thus, a ka ya sha, which has the nature of the four great elements, the four goddesses, the four actions such as pacifying, and the four joys, is definitely applied to the three, the three syllables.

original: shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyi yi ge aa'i sde tshan ni yi ge a'a'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyi yi ge aa'i sde tshan ni yi ge a'a'o //
translated: The class of the letter A is the nature of wisdom.

original: thabs kyi rang bzhin ni ka la sogs pa'i sde tshan ni yi ge h'um ngo //
analyzed: thabs kyi rang bzhin ni ka la sogs pa'i sde tshan ni yi ge h'um ngo //
translated: The class of the letter Ha is the nature of means.üîΩThe letters Ya and Sha, which are the nature of both, are the letter Om.

original: gnyi ga'i rang bzhin gyi ya dang sha dag ni yi ge aom ste de ltar aom a'a:h'um ngo //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i rang bzhin gyi ya dang sha dag ni yi ge aom ste de ltar aom a'a:h'um ngo //
translated: Thus, Om, A, and Hum.

original: rdo rje phreng ba las kyang /
analyzed: rdo rje phreng ba las kyang /
translated: The Vajra Garland also says:

original: cha gnyis pa dang dgu pa nyid du bshad //
analyzed: cha gnyis pa dang dgu pa nyid du bshad //
translated: The thirty-first and thirty-ninth are explained as the two parts.

original: sum cu bcu pa lnga pa'i sa bon nyid //
analyzed: sum cu bcu pa lnga pa'i sa bon nyid //
translated: The thirty-first and the thirty-fifth are the seed syllables.

original: cha gnyis pa dang lnga pa drug par ldan //
analyzed: cha gnyis pa dang lnga pa drug par ldan //
translated: The two parts are endowed with the thirty-fifth and the thirty-sixth.

original: rnam byung de ni thig le yin par brjod //üîΩces gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam byung de ni thig le yin par brjod // ces gsungs te /
translated: That which arises is said to be the drop.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: This is the literal meaning.

original: da ni yi ge gsum gyi yang bsdu @74a * //
analyzed: da ni yi ge gsum gyi yang bsdu @74a * //
translated: Now, the summary of the three syllables is stated:

original: ba ; / yi ge aom bcas ring por bcas //
analyzed: ba ; / yi ge aom bcas ring por bcas //
translated: With the letter Om, long,

original: yon tan sbyor sogs phyis dang ldan //
analyzed: yon tan sbyor sogs phyis dang ldan //
translated: endowed with the last of the group of qualities,

original: thung ngu ma lus dag tu 'gyur //
analyzed: thung ngu ma lus dag tu 'gyur //
translated: all short vowels become

original: gcig min du ma ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig min du ma ma yin no //
translated: not one, not many.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te don 'di yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te don 'di yin no //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: aa dang au zhes bya ba 'dus pa las aom mo //
analyzed: aa dang au zhes bya ba 'dus pa las aom mo //
translated: The union of a and o is om.

original: aa dang aa zhes bya ba 'dus pa las a'a:'o //
analyzed: aa dang aa zhes bya ba 'dus pa las a'a:'o //
translated: The union of a and a is ah.

original: yi ge ha dang a'u 'dus pa las h'um ngo //
analyzed: yi ge ha dang a'u 'dus pa las h'um ngo //
translated: The union of the letter ha and u is hum.

original: de rnams kyi phyis pa zhes bya ba ni gcig gi cha la thim pa ste mi snang ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi phyis pa zhes bya ba ni gcig gi cha la thim pa ste mi snang ba'o //
translated: The dissolution of those is their disappearance, their disappearance into one part.

original: phyis pa ni mi snang ba'o zhes gang bshad pa'o //
analyzed: phyis pa ni mi snang ba'o zhes gang bshad pa'o //
translated: Dissolution is disappearance, as was explained.

original: sbyor ba la yon tan byas nas ring por 'gyur ba rnams ni gcig la gcig 'dus pa las thig le tsam du 'dus par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: sbyor ba la yon tan byas nas ring por 'gyur ba rnams ni gcig la gcig 'dus pa las thig le tsam du 'dus par 'gyur zhing /
translated: The qualities of the letters having been produced, the long ones dissolve into one another, and they are collected into mere drops.

original: thig le de yang yi ge aa la zhugs nas yi ge aa thung du 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thig le de yang yi ge aa la zhugs nas yi ge aa thung du 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: And that drop enters the letter a, and the letter a becomes a mere short a.

original: 'dir bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The idea here is as follows.

original: re zhig aom gyi yi ge aa ni yi ge au la de yang thig le la thig le ni tsheg drag la tsheg drag ni ring po la ring po ni yi ge h'um gyi thig le la zhugs nas cha bzhi pa'i yi ge h'um gi yi ge ha
analyzed: re zhig aom gyi yi ge aa ni yi ge au la de yang thig le la thig le ni tsheg drag la tsheg drag ni ring po la ring po ni yi ge h'um gyi thig le la zhugs nas cha bzhi pa'i yi ge h'um gi yi ge ha
translated: The letter a of the letter om dissolves into the letter u, and that into the drop. The drop dissolves into the visarga, the visarga into the long vowel, and the long vowel enters the drop of the letter hum. The letter hum becomes a mere short hum.üîΩThe short hum dissolves into the letter ha, and the letter ha into the head of the letter ha. The head of the letter ha dissolves into the crescent moon, and the crescent moon into the bindu. The bindu dissolves into the nada, and the nada into the pure self.

original: ni yi ge a'u la yi ge a'u ni yi ge a'u'i nang na gnas pa'i yi ge aa la /
analyzed: ni yi ge a'u la yi ge a'u ni yi ge a'u'i nang na gnas pa'i yi ge aa la /
translated: The letter a is in the letter au.üîΩThe letter au dissolves into the letter a.

original: yi ge aa de thig le la zhugs nas yi ge aa thung ngu 'ba' zhig 'dus par 'gyur /
analyzed: yi ge aa de thig le la zhugs nas yi ge aa thung ngu 'ba' zhig 'dus par 'gyur /
translated: The letter a dissolves into the bindu, and the short letter a alone remains.

original: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: ma lus dag ste ngag ma lus pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ngag gi rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir gcig min pa'o //
analyzed: ma lus dag ste ngag ma lus pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ngag gi rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir gcig min pa'o //
translated: It is not one, because it is the nature of all speech, being the cause of all speech.

original: gsal ba tsam 'ba' zhig nyid yin pa'i phyir du ma yin te /
analyzed: gsal ba tsam 'ba' zhig nyid yin pa'i phyir du ma yin te /
translated: It is not many, because it is mere clarity.

original: dpal rdo rje dkyil 'khor rgyan las /
analyzed: dpal rdo rje dkyil 'khor rgyan las /
translated: The ≈örƒ´vajramandala Ornament Tantra says:

original: mar me lta bu 'bar ba ste //
analyzed: mar me lta bu 'bar ba ste //
translated: Blazing like a butter lamp,

original: snying ga'i dbus na mi shig pa //
analyzed: snying ga'i dbus na mi shig pa //
translated: in the center of the heart indestructible,

original: mi 'gyur mchog tu phra ba yi //üîΩaa ni gtso bo dam pa yin //
analyzed: mi 'gyur mchog tu phra ba yi // aa ni gtso bo dam pa yin //
translated: unchanging, supremely subtle,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: the a is the supreme essence.

original: de ni sgra ji bzhin pa dang / dgongs pa ma yin pa dang mthar thugs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de ni sgra ji bzhin pa dang / dgongs pa ma yin pa dang mthar thugs pa rnams so //
translated: This is literal, non-intentional, and definitive.

original: da ni yi ge phyi mo'i rang bzhin /
analyzed: da ni yi ge phyi mo'i rang bzhin /
translated: Now, the nature of the final letter.

original: yi ge gang zhig sngar bshad dang // gang yang mngon par phyogs pa rnams //
analyzed: yi ge gang zhig sngar bshad dang // gang yang mngon par phyogs pa rnams //
translated: The letters that have been explained previously and those that are directed toward

original: bud med skyes pa ma ning ste //
analyzed: bud med skyes pa ma ning ste //
translated: are feminine, masculine, and neuter.

original: khams la sogs par yongs su brtag / ces bya bas gsungs te /
analyzed: khams la sogs par yongs su brtag / ces bya bas gsungs te /
translated: They are to be imagined in the elements, etc.

original: yi ge ni dbyangs dang gsal bya rnams te sngar gong du bshad pa rnams so //
analyzed: yi ge ni dbyangs dang gsal bya rnams te sngar gong du bshad pa rnams so //
translated: The letters are the vowels and consonants that have been explained previously.

original: de bzhin du mngon par phyogs pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi tshogs rnams la nus pa dang ldan pa'i mthar gnas dang drod kyi yi ger bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mngon par phyogs pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi tshogs rnams la nus pa dang ldan pa'i mthar gnas dang drod kyi yi ger bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Similarly, those that are directed toward are the letters of the final abode and heat, which are endowed with the power for the collections of karma that are the causes of pacification, etc.

original: de rnams ni bud med dang skyes pa dang / ma ning gi ngo bo yin par shes par bya ste /üîΩdbyangs kyi sde tshan ni bud med kyi ngo @74b bo'o ;
analyzed: de rnams ni bud med dang skyes pa dang / ma ning gi ngo bo yin par shes par bya ste / dbyangs kyi sde tshan ni bud med kyi ngo @74b bo'o ;
translated: They are to be known as having the natures of feminine, masculine, and neuter.üîΩThe class of vowels is feminine in nature.

original: / gsal bya'i sde tshan ni skyes pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: / gsal bya'i sde tshan ni skyes pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The class of consonants is masculine in nature.

original: mthar gnas dang drod kyi sde tshan ni ma ning gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: mthar gnas dang drod kyi sde tshan ni ma ning gi ngo bo'o //
translated: The classes of final abode and heat are neuter in nature.

original: de ltar yang rgyas par sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: de ltar yang rgyas par sngar bshad zin to //
translated: Thus it is explained in detail previously.

original: de rnams kyang khams la sogs par de skad kyi byings dang rkyen dang rtags dang rnam par dbye ba'i tshig dang byed pa dang de la phan pa dang bsdu ba dang byed pa dang / skyes bu dang bdag gi tshig can dang gzhan gyi tshig can dang bya ba dang dus dang 'brel ba dang yi ge dang tshig dang ngag dang ngag chen po la sogs pa'i bye brag tu yongs su brtags te tha snyad du byas so zhes bya ba'i don to
analyzed: de rnams kyang khams la sogs par de skad kyi byings dang rkyen dang rtags dang rnam par dbye ba'i tshig dang byed pa dang de la phan pa dang bsdu ba dang byed pa dang / skyes bu dang bdag gi tshig can dang gzhan gyi tshig can dang bya ba dang dus dang 'brel ba dang yi ge dang tshig dang ngag dang ngag chen po la sogs pa'i bye brag tu yongs su brtags te tha snyad du byas so zhes bya ba'i don to
translated: They are also made conventionally by thoroughly investigating the distinctions of the roots, affixes, particles, and words that divide the cases, and the words of the agent, the object, the benefactive, the allative, the ablative, the vocative, the nominative, the genitive, the locative, the imperative, the verbal, the sentence, the speech, the great speech, and so on.

original: // 'og dang steng dang ldan par ni //
analyzed: // 'og dang steng dang ldan par ni //
translated: Having understood the lower and upper,

original: shes nas blo yis nges par sbyor//
analyzed: shes nas blo yis nges par sbyor//
translated: one should apply the mind with certainty.

original: 'di ni sngags kyi brjod pa ste //
analyzed: 'di ni sngags kyi brjod pa ste //
translated: This is the expression of mantra,

original: dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin can /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin can /
translated: which has the nature of non-entity.

original: 'og ni 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'og ni 'jug pa'o //
translated: The lower is the entering,

original: steng ni 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: steng ni 'byung ba'o //
translated: the upper is the arising,

original: ldan pa ni gnas pa'o //
analyzed: ldan pa ni gnas pa'o //
translated: and the connected is the abiding.

original: rim pa de lta bur shes nas te bzlas nas so //
analyzed: rim pa de lta bur shes nas te bzlas nas so //
translated: Having understood in that order, and having repeated,

original: blo yis te shes rab kyis nges par sbyar zhing 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis goms par byas pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub thob par byed do zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don to //
analyzed: blo yis te shes rab kyis nges par sbyar zhing 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis goms par byas pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub thob par byed do zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don to //
translated: The meaning of the words is this: by the mind, i.e., by wisdom, one is definitely joined to the process of engagement, etc., and by the process of familiarization one attains the supramundane perfections.

original: 'di ni sngags rnams kyi brjod pa ste btu ba'i ming can du brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ni sngags rnams kyi brjod pa ste btu ba'i ming can du brjod do //
translated: This is the expression of the mantras, called the extraction of the names.

original: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: And what is that?

original: dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin can te rnam par rtog pa med pa'i rang bzhin can no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin can te rnam par rtog pa med pa'i rang bzhin can no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is the nature of non-entity, i.e., the nature of non-conceptuality.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa dang dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa dang dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: This is the literal meaning and the non-intentional.

original: sngags btu ba bshad nas sngags kyi don ni /
analyzed: sngags btu ba bshad nas sngags kyi don ni /
translated: Having explained the extraction of the mantras, the meaning of the mantras is now explained.

original: de las yongs su 'gyur ba'i gzugs //
analyzed: de las yongs su 'gyur ba'i gzugs //
translated: The form that is transformed from that

original: lha ru nye bar shes pa gang //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: lha ru nye bar shes pa gang // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: is the deity that is to be known.

original: sngags de las yongs su gyur pa'i lha gang yin pa ni gang gi lha ci 'dra ba yin pa'o //
analyzed: sngags de las yongs su gyur pa'i lha gang yin pa ni gang gi lha ci 'dra ba yin pa'o //
translated: The deity that is transformed from that mantra is the deity that is to be known, i.e., what kind of deity it is.

original: de'i rang bzhin ni de'i don can gyi rang bzhin du shes par bya ba ni yi ge aom la sogs pa rnams kyi don ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste spyi'i don to //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni de'i don can gyi rang bzhin du shes par bya ba ni yi ge aom la sogs pa rnams kyi don ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste spyi'i don to //
translated: The nature of that is to be known as the nature of its meaning. The meaning of the syllables om and so forth is Vairochana and so forth. This is the general meaning.

original: dag 'di nyid kyis sngags kyi brda gsungs te /
analyzed: dag 'di nyid kyis sngags kyi brda gsungs te /
translated: This very [verse] teaches the symbolic meaning of mantra.

original: de las te sngags de rnams las yongs su gyur pa'i aom la sogs pa dang sv'a h'a la sogs pa phyis pa dang / sbyar ba las gzugs te sprul la sogs pa'i gzugs su 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'di nyid rang rang gi lha la brten nas las kyi tshogs la nus pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: de las te sngags de rnams las yongs su gyur pa'i aom la sogs pa dang sv'a h'a la sogs pa phyis pa dang / sbyar ba las gzugs te sprul la sogs pa'i gzugs su 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'di nyid rang rang gi lha la brten nas las kyi tshogs la nus pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: From that, from those mantras, the transformation of om and so forth, and the addition of svaha and so forth, the form that arises, the form of emanation and so forth, is itself endowed with the ability to perform the collection of activities in dependence on one's own deity. This is the meaning.

original: dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the implied meaning.

original: da ni sngags kyi de kho na nyid bstan par @75a * //
analyzed: da ni sngags kyi de kho na nyid bstan par @75a * //
translated: Now, the reality of mantra should be taught.

original: bya ste / aa la brten nas ye shes ni //
analyzed: bya ste / aa la brten nas ye shes ni //
translated: The wisdom based on a is

original: sangs rgyas kyi ni snying por 'gyur //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ni snying por 'gyur //
translated: the essence of the Buddha.

original: don ni 'di yin te sngags btu ba'i gnas skabs su cha shas dang cha shas kyi dbye bas yi ge gsum btus nas chos kyi dbyings kyi 'khor lo'i gnas su gsal ba tsam gyi yi ge aa 'ba' zhig la brten nas te de la dmigs nas so //
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te sngags btu ba'i gnas skabs su cha shas dang cha shas kyi dbye bas yi ge gsum btus nas chos kyi dbyings kyi 'khor lo'i gnas su gsal ba tsam gyi yi ge aa 'ba' zhig la brten nas te de la dmigs nas so //
translated: The meaning is as follows: At the time of extracting the mantra, having extracted the three syllables by means of the division of parts and parts, one should rely on, that is, focus on, just the syllable A, which is merely the manifestation in the place of the wheel of the realm of phenomena.

original: ye shes ni rnal 'byor bas bsgom par bya ba'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes ni rnal 'byor bas bsgom par bya ba'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes gang yin pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is that which is to be cultivated by the yogi, the wisdom of the realm of phenomena.

original: de nyid sangs rgyas dpal rdo rje 'chang chen po'i snying po ste de kho na nyid du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid sangs rgyas dpal rdo rje 'chang chen po'i snying po ste de kho na nyid du brjod par bya'o //
translated: That itself is the essence, the reality, of the glorious Buddha Great Vajradhara.

original: de ni sngags kyi de kho na nyid du brjod do zhes bya ba'i don te dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sngags kyi de kho na nyid du brjod do zhes bya ba'i don te dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: That is to be expressed as the reality of the mantra. This is the meaning of the statement, and it is not a case of implied meaning.

original: da ni yi ge gsum gyi bya ba /
analyzed: da ni yi ge gsum gyi bya ba /
translated: Now, the function of the three syllables is stated:

original: h'um gis sems can yang dag spro //
analyzed: h'um gis sems can yang dag spro //
translated: HUM emanates sentient beingsüîΩand imagines them in the form of the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas skur ni rab tu brtag / aom gyis sems can yang dag sdud //
analyzed: sangs rgyas skur ni rab tu brtag / aom gyis sems can yang dag sdud //
translated: OM gathers sentient beings

original: a'a:sa ni gnas par byed pa'o //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: a'a:sa ni gnas par byed pa'o //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: and A: causes them to abide.

original: bcom ldan 'das thugs rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin du 'gyur pa'i yi ge h'um srog gi rang bzhin gyis sems can sangs rgyas kyi sku nyid du brtag pa ste de'i rnam pa can du spro zhing skyed par byed de spro par byed do zhes bya ba'i don
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das thugs rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin du 'gyur pa'i yi ge h'um srog gi rang bzhin gyis sems can sangs rgyas kyi sku nyid du brtag pa ste de'i rnam pa can du spro zhing skyed par byed de spro par byed do zhes bya ba'i don
translated: The syllable H≈™·πÄ, which is the nature of the BhagavƒÅn VajradhƒÅtu, is the life of sentient beings, and is the nature of the Buddha‚Äôs body. It is imagined, i.e., generated, in the form of that, and is emitted, i.e., emanated.

original: to // de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das sku rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i yi ge aom ni 'jug pa'i rang bzhin gyis sems can rnams snga ma bzhin du yang dag par sdud cing 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: to // de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das sku rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i yi ge aom ni 'jug pa'i rang bzhin gyis sems can rnams snga ma bzhin du yang dag par sdud cing 'jug par byed do //
translated: Similarly, the syllable O·πÄ, which is the nature of the BhagavƒÅn Vajrar≈´pa, is the nature of entry, and it truly gathers, i.e., causes to enter, sentient beings, as before.

original: gsungs rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin yi ge a'a: ni mnyam pa'i rang bzhin gyis gnas par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin yi ge a'a: ni mnyam pa'i rang bzhin gyis gnas par byed pa ste /
translated: The syllable A·∏§, which is the nature of the BhagavƒÅn Vajrava·πáa, is the nature of equality, and it causes to abide.

original: bum pa lta bu'i gnas skabs su sems gnas par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bum pa lta bu'i gnas skabs su sems gnas par byed pa'o //
translated: It causes the mind to abide in the state of the vase.

original: spro bar byed pa dang gang bar byed pa dang bum pa lta bu'i rang bzhin can gyi gsum po kho nas sems rtse gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: spro bar byed pa dang gang bar byed pa dang bum pa lta bu'i rang bzhin can gyi gsum po kho nas sems rtse gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //

original: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'i go rims /
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'i go rims /
translated: The sequence of the stage of vajra repetitionüîΩis taught in the following:üîΩBy the sequence of entering, abiding,

analyzed: 'jug pa dang ni gnas pa dang // ldang ba nyid kyi rim gyis kyang //

analyzed: shes rab thabs kyi gzhir gnas te // sngags kyi yan lag ma nyams bzlas //

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /

original: rnal 'byor pa 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis ldog pa na rnal 'byor pa shes rab thabs kyi gzhir te kun rdzob dang don dam pas tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo nyid la gnas nas sngags yi ge gsum yan lag ma nyams pa ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis ldog pa na rnal 'byor pa shes rab thabs kyi gzhir te kun rdzob dang don dam pas tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo nyid la gnas nas sngags yi ge gsum yan lag ma nyams pa ste /
translated: Abiding in the basis of wisdom and method, that is, in the nature that is not different from the conventional and the ultimate, he recites the mantra, the three syllables, without degeneration of the branches.

analyzed: sngags dang lha dag tha mi dad pa'i phyir rang bzhin gcig pa bzlas par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don te drang ba'i @75b don to //

original: yang na shes rab thabs kyi gzhir te ye shes kyi phyag rgya dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i rdo rje padma sbyor ba la gnas nas 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis te /
analyzed: yang na shes rab thabs kyi gzhir te ye shes kyi phyag rgya dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i rdo rje padma sbyor ba la gnas nas 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis te /

original: 'dod chags dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'dod chags par ma'i rim gyis sngags te 'od gsal ba yan lag ma nyams pa ste ;
analyzed: 'dod chags dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'dod chags par ma'i rim gyis sngags te 'od gsal ba yan lag ma nyams pa ste ;
translated: One should recite the mantra, i.e., the clear light, without defecting from the stages of passion, passionlessness, and neutrality, i.e., the stages of the moon, sun, and RƒÅhu.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa tha mi dad par bzlas shing nyams su myong bar bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa tha mi dad par bzlas shing nyams su myong bar bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'i don to //
translated: One should experience the recitation of the conventional and ultimate truths without differentiation. This is the definitive meaning explanation.

original: da ni rlung gi grangs kyi sgo nas bzlas pa'i grangs /
analyzed: da ni rlung gi grangs kyi sgo nas bzlas pa'i grangs /
translated: Now, the number of recitations by way of the number of winds is explained.

original: gos dkar la sogs bzlas bshad pa //
analyzed: gos dkar la sogs bzlas bshad pa //
translated: The recitation of PƒÅ·πá·∏çaravƒÅsinƒ´ and so on

original: brgya phrag gnyis dang nyi shu lnga //
analyzed: brgya phrag gnyis dang nyi shu lnga //
translated: is explained as two hundred and twenty-five.

original: bzhi po legs par bsgres nas ni //
analyzed: bzhi po legs par bsgres nas ni //

original: de ni so sor 'byung ba la //
analyzed: de ni so sor 'byung ba la //

analyzed: nyi khri chig stong drug brgya'o //

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /

translated: Here, the yogi should meditate on the four mandalas of fire, etc., in the four places of the throat, etc., which have the nature of the four goddesses, PƒÅ·πá·∏çaravƒÅsinƒ´, etc.

analyzed: dkyil 'khor de dag kyang re re zhing 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rang bzhin can yin te /

analyzed: 'byung ba chen po gcig kyang bzhi'i rang gi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //

translated: Therefore, each mandala has nine hundred parts, by the number of two hundred twenty-five parts.

original: de rnams 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis dkyil 'khor bzhi la nyin mo la bcu gnyis mtshan mo la bcu gnyis su 'gyur te rim pa des nyi khri chig stong drug brgyar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis dkyil 'khor bzhi la nyin mo la bcu gnyis mtshan mo la bcu gnyis su 'gyur te rim pa des nyi khri chig stong drug brgyar 'gyur ro //
translated: By the process of their entry, etc., there are twelve in the four mandalas during the day and twelve during the night. By that process, there are twenty-one thousand six hundred.

analyzed: nyin mo la bsdus nas khri brgyad brgya yod cing mtshan mo khri brgyad brgya yod do //

analyzed: de ltar rdo rje bzlas pa ni nyi khri chig stong drug brgyar 'gyur te sgra ji bzhin pa'o //

analyzed: da ni don 'di nyid tshad ma yin par bya ba'i phyir bshad pa'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas lung gi tshad ma nang gi dus 'di nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir 'dus pa'i rgyud phyi ma las zhes bya ba gsungs te nang gi dus ni dkyil 'khor
translated: Now, in order to make this meaning valid, following the explanatory tantra, in order to clarify this very internal time, he says, ‚Äúin the Later GuhyasamƒÅja Tantra.‚Äù The internal time is the mandala of the body.

original: gyi rim pa @76a * //
analyzed: gyi rim pa @76a * //

original: bzlas pa'i grangs so //

analyzed: rig pa ni sangs rgyas spyan la sogs pa rnams te de rnams kyi tshul ni de dag gis byin gyis brlabs pa'i dkyil 'khor bzhi po rnams so //
translated: The knowledge is BuddhalocanƒÅ and so forth, and their manner is the four mandalas consecrated by them.

analyzed: de rnams kyi chog ni 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis dkyil 'khor re rer dgu brgya la sogs pa'i dbye bas bzlas pa'o //
translated: The rite of those is the recitation in each mandala by the division of nine hundred and so forth by the process of entry and so forth.

original: thun mtshams bzhi ru rab sbyor la //
analyzed: thun mtshams bzhi ru rab sbyor la //
translated: One should apply oneself to the four periods.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //

original: nyin mo dang mtshan mo la'o //
analyzed: nyin mo dang mtshan mo la'o //

analyzed: sngags ni yi ge gsum mo //

analyzed: da ni rdo rje bzlas pa blang bar bya ba nyid yin par /
translated: Now, in order to take up vajra repetition itself,üîΩ[the BhagavƒÅn] declares,

analyzed: bsgom pa yi ni bar chad can//
translated: ‚ÄúThe obstacle for meditation

translated: is the yogi‚Äôs external repetition.

analyzed: rdo rje bdag nyid ji ltar bzlas //
translated: How does the meaning of the mantra, the Blessed One with the vajra,üîΩrepetition with the nature of the vajra, occur?‚Äù

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: This is the literal reading.

original: phyi rol bzlas pa ni zhes bya ba ni phreng ba'i bye brag la bstan nas re zhig dbye bas 'bum la sogs pa'i grangs kyis lus dang ngag dang sems sdug bsngal bar byed ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol bzlas pa ni zhes bya ba ni phreng ba'i bye brag la bstan nas re zhig dbye bas 'bum la sogs pa'i grangs kyis lus dang ngag dang sems sdug bsngal bar byed ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúExternal repetition‚Äù is taught as a particular rosary. By counting with a rosary, one‚Äôs body, speech, and mind are made miserable by the number of hundreds of thousands, etc.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa goms par byed pa'am /
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa goms par byed pa'am /

analyzed: de dag gi de ni blang par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro//
translated: because that is what is to be taken up by them.

analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas pa dang rtog pa med pa ni 'gal ba'i phyir ma nyam par gzhag ba dang langs pa bzhin no //
translated: Because the conceptual and nonconceptual are mutually exclusive, like sitting and rising.

original: gtan tshigs gsungs te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gsungs te /

translated: When one becomes Vajradhara, the vajra holder, by means of the stage of perfect yoga, vajra repetition, at that time, since that is the meaning of mantra, what other goal is there?

original: de nyid kyi phyir rdo rje'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rdo rje'i bdag nyid de /
translated: For that very reason, one is the nature of vajra.

analyzed: @76b rdo rje 'chad dngos yin na ji ltar zlos shing zlos par mi rung ngo //
translated: If one is Vajradhara, how can one repeat mantra? It is not suitable.

original: 'bras bu thob pa na thabs dgos pa med phyir te /
analyzed: 'bras bu thob pa na thabs dgos pa med phyir te /

original: 'bras bu thob nas dor bya ba //
analyzed: 'bras bu thob nas dor bya ba //

original: gang de thabs su rab tu brjod //üîΩces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang de thabs su rab tu brjod // ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That is well known as the method.üîΩThe example is stated:

original: gzhan dag ci zhig tshol bar byed //üîΩces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ci zhig tshol bar byed //üîΩces bya ba gsungs te /

original: glang po don du gnyer bar gyur pa'i skyes bu 'ga' zhig lam du zhugs par gyur pa na glang po rnyed pa de sdug bsngal pa'i don du lo ma dang rtsva dang rdo bas g-yogs pa'i nags su glang po'i rjes te rkang rjes ci'i phyir tshol bar byed
analyzed: glang po don du gnyer bar gyur pa'i skyes bu 'ga' zhig lam du zhugs par gyur pa na glang po rnyed pa de sdug bsngal pa'i don du lo ma dang rtsva dang rdo bas g-yogs pa'i nags su glang po'i rjes te rkang rjes ci'i phyir tshol bar byed
translated: Why would a person who has set out on the path in order to obtain an elephant seek the elephant‚Äôs foot-print in the forest covered with leaves, grass, and stones, for the sake of the elephant that he has obtained?

analyzed: / tshol bar byed pa ni ma yin te de rnyed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: He would not seek it, because he has already obtained it.

original: de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa gang dag gis sngags lus te de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rnam par gyur pa na rang nyid de dag gis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa gang dag gis sngags lus te de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rnam par gyur pa na rang nyid de dag gis so //

translated: having become manifest, having become manifest in this very life,üîΩwhy would they seek, why would they desire, others, the net of verbal repetition, etc.?

analyzed: gzhan dag ste tshig gi bzlas pa la sogs pa'i dra ba'i ci ste tshol bar byed cing 'dod par byed ces bya ba'i dam tshig go //

original: sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa'o //

original: 'dir bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa dam tshig dang ye shes dang ting nge 'dzin sems dpa'i bdag nyid can gyi skur byin gyis brlabs nas spyan 'dren pa la sogs pa'i sngags kyi mchod pa'am rab gnas sam las kyi tshogs la sogs pa gzhan gang yang rung
analyzed: 'dir bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa dam tshig dang ye shes dang ting nge 'dzin sems dpa'i bdag nyid can gyi skur byin gyis brlabs nas spyan 'dren pa la sogs pa'i sngags kyi mchod pa'am rab gnas sam las kyi tshogs la sogs pa gzhan gang yang rung
translated: Here, having empowered the yoga of the creation stage with the nature of the commitment, gnosis, and concentration beings, one should invite the deity, and so on, with the mantra offering, or any other suitable activity, such as consecration or the ga·πáap≈´ja.üîΩ

original: ba byed pa ma yin nam //
analyzed: ba byed pa ma yin nam //

translated: When the life-force wind, whose nature is the syllable a·∏•, is inhaled, then the wheel of deities connected to the AmitƒÅbha family is invited.

analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te bsam pa ni 'di yin no //

original: rdo rje bzlas pa 'di ni sngags 'ba' zhig tha dad kyi dkyil 'khor dang rlung dang thun mtshams kyi rim pa rnams kyi ni mtshungs pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa 'di ni sngags 'ba' zhig tha dad kyi dkyil 'khor dang rlung dang thun mtshams kyi rim pa rnams kyi ni mtshungs pa kho na yin te /
translated: This vajra repetition is the same as the other repetitions in terms of the ma·πá·∏çala, the wind, and the stages of the sessions, but it is different in that

original: rlung gi rgyu ba rang bzhin gyis grub pa rnams kyi grangs ni nyung ba 'am mang du bya bar su zhig gis nus par 'gyur /
analyzed: rlung gi rgyu ba rang bzhin gyis grub pa rnams kyi grangs ni nyung ba 'am mang du bya bar su zhig gis nus par 'gyur /

original: gzhan du na bcom ldan 'das kyis ci'i phyir grangs nyi khri chig stong drug brgya gsungs par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan du na bcom ldan 'das kyis ci'i phyir grangs nyi khri chig stong drug brgya gsungs par 'gyur /

original: sgra ji bzhin @78b pa'o ;
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin @78b pa'o ;

original: / da ni lung gi tshad ma nyid bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩde 'dod gsang ba dgongs pa las //
analyzed: / da ni lung gi tshad ma nyid bstan pa'i phyir / de 'dod gsang ba dgongs pa las //
translated: Now, in order to teach the validity of the scriptures, it is said:üîΩThe desire for that is explained in the secret intention

original: phra mo'i rnal 'byor rab tu bshad //
analyzed: phra mo'i rnal 'byor rab tu bshad //
translated: as subtle yoga.

original: klog dang bsam gtan med mod kyi //
analyzed: klog dang bsam gtan med mod kyi //
translated: Although there is no recitation or meditative concentration,

original: 'on kyang bzlas par bshad pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'on kyang bzlas par bshad pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /

original: gsang ba dgongs pa las zhes bya ba ni 'dus pa'i bshad pa'i rgyud dgongs pa lung bstan pa las so //
analyzed: gsang ba dgongs pa las zhes bya ba ni 'dus pa'i bshad pa'i rgyud dgongs pa lung bstan pa las so //
translated: The secret intention is the explanatory tantra of the Guhyasamaja, the Sandhivyakarana.

original: de 'dod de mngon par 'dod pa rnams la bcom ldan 'das kyis phra mo'i rnal 'byor te /
analyzed: de 'dod de mngon par 'dod pa rnams la bcom ldan 'das kyis phra mo'i rnal 'byor te /
translated: For those who desire, who long for that, the Bhagavat taught this subtle yoga,

original: sngags kyi de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi rdo rje bzlas pa 'di bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: sngags kyi de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi rdo rje bzlas pa 'di bshad pa yin no //
translated: this vajra repetition, which is the nature of the mantra truth.

original: 'di ni klog dang ste sngags kyi bzlas pa 'bum la sogs pa nyams su blang ba dang / bsam gtan te de zhal dang phyag la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i lha'i sku bsgom pa med mod kyi ste spangs mod kyi 'on kyang rnal 'byor pa'i bzlas par bshad pa yin te bzlas pa 'di ni rang bzhin gyis grub pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya
analyzed: 'di ni klog dang ste sngags kyi bzlas pa 'bum la sogs pa nyams su blang ba dang / bsam gtan te de zhal dang phyag la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i lha'i sku bsgom pa med mod kyi ste spangs mod kyi 'on kyang rnal 'byor pa'i bzlas par bshad pa yin te bzlas pa 'di ni rang bzhin gyis grub pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya
translated: This is the explanation of the vajra repetition: It is not recitation, that is, the performance of mantra repetition a hundred thousand times, etc., nor meditation, that is, the cultivation of the deity's body endowed with face, arms, and so forth, but it is explained as the yogi's repetition, because this repetition is naturally accomplished.

original: ba ni ngag gi don to //
analyzed: ba ni ngag gi don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the words.

original: klog dang bsam gtan med par yang //
analyzed: klog dang bsam gtan med par yang //
translated: Even without recitation and meditation,

original: mi mkhas rdo rje bzlas pas zlos //
analyzed: mi mkhas rdo rje bzlas pas zlos //
translated: the unskillful one should repeat with vajra repetition.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir te dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir te dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: This is the non-intentional [reading].

original: da ni rdo rje bzlas pa las thams cad bsgrub pa'i mthu dang ldan ba yin par /
analyzed: da ni rdo rje bzlas pa las thams cad bsgrub pa'i mthu dang ldan ba yin par /
translated: Now, in order to show that vajra repetition is endowed with the power to accomplish all activities, [the BhagavƒÅn] declares,

original: rdo rje bzlas pa 'di yis ni /
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa 'di yis ni /
translated: By this vajra repetition,

original: cho ga bzhin du bsnyen byas na //üîΩsgyu ma lta bu'i tir 'dzin gyis //
analyzed: cho ga bzhin du bsnyen byas na // sgyu ma lta bu'i tir 'dzin gyis //
translated: having performed the rite of approach,

original: las rnams thams cad bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: las rnams thams cad bsgrub par bya //
translated: one should accomplish all activities

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: with the apprehension of illusion-like [mind].

original: 'di yis ni zhes bya ba sngar bshad pa'i rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pas cho ga ji bzhin du zhes bya ba dkyil 'khor bzhi'i rim pas bsnyen pa ste sna'i bu ga g-yas pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis thun phyed phyed kyi dus su gnas par byas nas
analyzed: 'di yis ni zhes bya ba sngar bshad pa'i rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pas cho ga ji bzhin du zhes bya ba dkyil 'khor bzhi'i rim pas bsnyen pa ste sna'i bu ga g-yas pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis thun phyed phyed kyi dus su gnas par byas nas
translated: By this, by the process of vajra repetition explained above, having performed the rite of approach by the process of the four mandalas, abiding for half a period in the right nostril, etc.,

original: zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang dbang dang dgug pa'i las rnams thams cad bsgrub par bya ste 'bad pa med par bya'o //
analyzed: zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang dbang dang dgug pa'i las rnams thams cad bsgrub par bya ste 'bad pa med par bya'o //
translated: one should accomplish all activities of pacification, increase, power, and summoning, without effort.

original: gal te de lta na'o na bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa dang 'di la khyad par ci yod ce na /üîΩsgyu ma lta bu'i ting 'dzin gyis //
analyzed: gal te de lta na'o na bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa dang 'di la khyad par ci yod ce na / sgyu ma lta bu'i ting 'dzin gyis //
translated: If that is so, then what is the difference between this and the yoga of the creation stage?

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /üîΩbdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa dbang po'i gzhu lta bu'i rdo rje 'chang gi sku 'dzin pa dang phyi rol gyi dngos po thams cad kyang sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis kyi tshul du mthong bas las thams cad bya ba yin pa'i phyir rim pa 'di ni bskyed
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te / bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa dbang po'i gzhu lta bu'i rdo rje 'chang gi sku 'dzin pa dang phyi rol gyi dngos po thams cad kyang sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis kyi tshul du mthong bas las thams cad bya ba yin pa'i phyir rim pa 'di ni bskyed
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúBy the samƒÅdhi of illusion-like‚Ä¶‚ÄùüîΩThe meaning is that, by the stage of self-consecration, one holds the body of Vajradhara, which is like the bow of Indra, and sees all external things in the manner of the twelve examples of illusion.

original: pa'i rnal 'byor pa la med ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pa'i rnal 'byor pa la med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because one performs all activities, this stage is not found in the creation stage yogƒ´.

original: spyi'i don dang sbas pa'i bshad pa dag yin no //
analyzed: spyi'i don dang sbas pa'i bshad pa dag yin no //
translated: This is the general meaning and the hidden explanation.

original: @79a * // da ni dus kyi rnam par dbye bas 'grub pa de bas na gnyis su med pa rnam par rgyal ba zhes bya ba'i rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud las gsungs pa /
analyzed: @79a * // da ni dus kyi rnam par dbye bas 'grub pa de bas na gnyis su med pa rnam par rgyal ba zhes bya ba'i rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud las gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in terms of the divisions of time, there is accomplishment. Therefore, it is said in the Tantra of the Great Yoga of Nondual Victory:

original: mnyam med sngags ni bzlas nas su //
analyzed: mnyam med sngags ni bzlas nas su //
translated: Reciting the unsurpassed mantra,

original: sgrub pa'i bdag nyid can gyis bsgrub //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i bdag nyid can gyis bsgrub //
translated: The one who is devoted to practice should practice.

original: de yis zla ba gcig gis ni //
analyzed: de yis zla ba gcig gis ni //
translated: By him, in one month,

original: khams gsum 'grub par gdon mi za //
analyzed: khams gsum 'grub par gdon mi za //
translated: there is no doubt of the accomplishment of the three worlds.

original: rnam shes las ni 'byung ba'i sngags //
analyzed: rnam shes las ni 'byung ba'i sngags //
translated: The mantra that arises from consciousness

original: 'bum phrag drug ni bzlas byas te //
analyzed: 'bum phrag drug ni bzlas byas te //
translated: is repeated six hundred thousand times,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' phyag byas nas //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' phyag byas nas //
translated: and having paid homage to Vajrasattva,

original: zla ba nya la de 'grub 'gyur //
analyzed: zla ba nya la de 'grub 'gyur //
translated: he will accomplish it on the full moon.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: mnyam med ni 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam med ni 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: The unequalled should be repeated by the process of entering and so forth.

original: sngags ni yi ge gsum mo //
analyzed: sngags ni yi ge gsum mo //
translated: The mantra is the three syllables.

original: sgrub pa'i bdag nyid can ni sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa'i sgrub pa po'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i bdag nyid can ni sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa'i sgrub pa po'o //
translated: The one who is devoted to practice is the practitioner who has entered into the meditative concentration of the illusion-like.

original: bsgrub pa ni re zhig bdag nyid rnam par mi rtog pa'i gnas skabs la 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgrub pa ni re zhig bdag nyid rnam par mi rtog pa'i gnas skabs la 'jug par bya'o //
translated: The practice is to enter into the state of non-conceptuality.

original: zla ba gcig gis khams gsum ste khams gsum na gnas pa'i sems can gyi khams 'grub cing zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rnams 'grub pa'i bar du 'gyur ba 'dir the tshom mi bya ste dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: zla ba gcig gis khams gsum ste khams gsum na gnas pa'i sems can gyi khams 'grub cing zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rnams 'grub pa'i bar du 'gyur ba 'dir the tshom mi bya ste dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: One should not doubt that in one month the three realms are accomplished, and that the activities of pacifying and so forth are accomplished in the realms of sentient beings abiding in the three realms. This is not the intended meaning.

original: zla ba gcig gis ji ltar 'grub ce na zla ba gcig gis /
analyzed: zla ba gcig gis ji ltar 'grub ce na zla ba gcig gis /
translated: How is it accomplished in one month?

original: 'bum phrag drug ni bzlas bya ste //
analyzed: 'bum phrag drug ni bzlas bya ste //
translated: One should repeat six hundred thousand times.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is stated.

original: 'di ltar nyin zhag gcig la grangs nyi khri chig stong drug brgya yod pas zhag lnga la bzlas pa 'bum rtsa brgyad du 'gyur zhing 'bum rtsa brgyad ni 'bum zhes bgrang bar bya'o //

analyzed: de ltar na zla ba gcig la bzlas pa 'bum phrag drug yod do //

analyzed: de gsungs pa sngags yi ge gsum rnam shes las byung ba ste /

original: rlung gi bzhon pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dbang gis zlos pa na de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dang drug pa rdo rje sems dpa'i bzlas pa byas par 'gyur ro //

translated: one will be accomplished on the full moon, on the last day of the month. The yogi/nƒ´ will attain the siddhi of the great seal in one‚Äôs own position and the accomplishment of pacifying and so on in the position of others.

original: don te dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: don te dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: This is the meaning of the non-intentional [teaching].

original: da ni rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor ba ni rdor je bzlas pa tsam 'ba' zhig las 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: da ni rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor ba ni rdor je bzlas pa tsam 'ba' zhig las 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: Now, the perfect yogi/nƒ´ will be accomplished merely through vajra recitation alone.

analyzed: brtul zhugs la sogs pa ni dgos pa @79b med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the observances and so on are unnecessary,

original: de la brtul zhugs bshad pa med //
analyzed: de la brtul zhugs bshad pa med //
translated: the observances are not explained.

original: phreng ba mi dgos bgrang mi dgos //
analyzed: phreng ba mi dgos bgrang mi dgos //

analyzed: gzung dang sbyin sreg las rnams dag / gzhan dang gzhan yang dgos pa med //

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is stated.

original: de la brtul zhugs zhes bya ba ni nges par sngon du song ba can gyi rtags 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: de la brtul zhugs zhes bya ba ni nges par sngon du song ba can gyi rtags 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Therein, the so-called observances are the holding of signs that are preceded by a vow.

original: de ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rnal 'byor pa la bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa med de bstan pa med do //
analyzed: de ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rnal 'byor pa la bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa med de bstan pa med do //
translated: The Blessed One has not explained that to the yogi of vajra repetition, nor has he taught it.

original: de bzhin du yang de ni rigs pa dang lung dag gis dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang de ni rigs pa dang lung dag gis dpyad par bya ste /
translated: And so, it should be analyzed by reasoning and scripture.

original: zla ba'i rjes su 'brang ba la sogs pa dang / mgo thegs pa nyid dang / rus pa'i phreng ba thogs pa dang / slong mo byed pa dang / sa la nyal ba nyid dang / yul nas yul gzhan du 'gro ba la sogs pa lta ba'i bye brag gis rab tu grags pa'i nyams su blang bar bya ba'i brtul zhugs kyi bye brag mang po mthong ngo zhes zer na mthong ba ni bden te /üîΩ'on kyang gzhan yang kham pa'i snod zhabs med pa dang rtsva'i chun po dang g-yo mo la sogs pa rke dang lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa la gdags par byas nas lus kyi khur dang sems skyo ba dang 'jig rten gyi bzhad gad kyi rgyu nyid
analyzed: zla ba'i rjes su 'brang ba la sogs pa dang / mgo thegs pa nyid dang / rus pa'i phreng ba thogs pa dang / slong mo byed pa dang / sa la nyal ba nyid dang / yul nas yul gzhan du 'gro ba la sogs pa lta ba'i bye brag gis rab tu grags pa'i nyams su blang bar bya ba'i brtul zhugs kyi bye brag mang po mthong ngo zhes zer na mthong ba ni bden te / 'on kyang gzhan yang kham pa'i snod zhabs med pa dang rtsva'i chun po dang g-yo mo la sogs pa rke dang lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa la gdags par byas nas lus kyi khur dang sems skyo ba dang 'jig rten gyi bzhad gad kyi rgyu nyid
translated: and the various practices of following the moon, shaving the head, wearing a garland of bones, begging, sleeping on the ground, wandering from place to place, and so on, are well known due to the differences in views.

original: du 'gyur ba de rnams ci'i phyir mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: du 'gyur ba de rnams ci'i phyir mi bya zhe na /
translated: But why not also use a clay pot without a base, a bundle of straw, a stick, and so on, attaching them to the neck, arms, legs, and so on, and make the body a burden, the mind weary, and the cause of the world's laughter?

original: ci ste lus la sogs pa sdug bsngal ba dang 'jig rten gyi bzhad gad kyi 'bras bu can ni mi bya ba kho na'o //
analyzed: ci ste lus la sogs pa sdug bsngal ba dang 'jig rten gyi bzhad gad kyi 'bras bu can ni mi bya ba kho na'o //
translated: But if the body, etc. are painful and the result of the world‚Äôs ridicule, then they should not be done at all.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?üîΩThe result of enjoyment and liberation is the ritual of the nature of certainty explained in the treatise.

original: longs spyod dang thar pa'i 'bras bu can bstan bcos las bshad pa'i nges pa'i bdag nyid can gyi cho ga kho na'o zhes zer na bstan bcos zhes bya ba ni ci zhig ji ltar na /
analyzed: longs spyod dang thar pa'i 'bras bu can bstan bcos las bshad pa'i nges pa'i bdag nyid can gyi cho ga kho na'o zhes zer na bstan bcos zhes bya ba ni ci zhig ji ltar na /
translated: What is called a treatise? How is it valid?

original: de tshad ma nyid yin zhing de nges pa'i ngo bo nyid ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de tshad ma nyid yin zhing de nges pa'i ngo bo nyid ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: And how is it the nature of certainty?

original: gal te 'dis nges par byed pa na nges pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'dis nges par byed pa na nges pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is certainty because it makes certain,

original: des ci zhig nges par byed de /
analyzed: des ci zhig nges par byed de /
translated: what does it make certain?

original: ci brtul zhugs can gyi lus sam 'on te sems yin grang na re zhig sems ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ci brtul zhugs can gyi lus sam 'on te sems yin grang na re zhig sems ni ma yin te /
translated: Is it the body of the ascetic or is it the mind? First, it is not the mind.

original: khyab par byed cing lus med pa'i sems la ni re zhig nges par 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyab par byed cing lus med pa'i sems la ni re zhig nges par 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not tenable that the mind, which is pervasive and bodiless, is certain.

original: chos 'di ni lus can dang khyab pa ma yin pa dag go //
analyzed: chos 'di ni lus can dang khyab pa ma yin pa dag go //
translated: These dharmas are not embodied and pervasive.

original: gal te ji skad bshad pa'i chos dang 'brel pa'i phyir lus kyi yin no zhe na 'o na rtsva chun la sogs pa tshegs chung ngus 'grub par bya ba bzhag nas tshegs chen @80a * //
analyzed: gal te ji skad bshad pa'i chos dang 'brel pa'i phyir lus kyi yin no zhe na 'o na rtsva chun la sogs pa tshegs chung ngus 'grub par bya ba bzhag nas tshegs chen @80a * //
translated: If you say that it is the body because it is related to the phenomena explained above, then why do you take up bones, hair, staffs, khatvanga staffs, and so on, which are established with great difficulty, and set aside grass, cloth, and so on, which are established with little difficulty?

original: pos bsgrub par bya ba'i rus gong dang ral pa dang dbyu gu dang khatv'am la sogs pa blangs pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: pos bsgrub par bya ba'i rus gong dang ral pa dang dbyu gu dang khatv'am la sogs pa blangs pas ci zhig bya /
translated: What do you do with what you take up?

original: blangs pa de rnams kyis gzhan rang dbang can dag bzhin du brtul zhugs can de rnams rang dbang med par byed pa yang ma mthang bas ji ltar rang dbang can de rnams rang dbang yod par lus kyi bya ba bstan pa dang / bde bar nyal ba dang bde bar gnas pa ltar brtul zhugs can rnams kyang de kho na bzhin du byed do //
analyzed: blangs pa de rnams kyis gzhan rang dbang can dag bzhin du brtul zhugs can de rnams rang dbang med par byed pa yang ma mthang bas ji ltar rang dbang can de rnams rang dbang yod par lus kyi bya ba bstan pa dang / bde bar nyal ba dang bde bar gnas pa ltar brtul zhugs can rnams kyang de kho na bzhin du byed do //
translated: You do not see that those who take them up are not independent, like those who are independent. Therefore, just as those who are independent demonstrate physical actions, sleep well, and live well, so too do those who take up vows.

original: yan lag bshad ma thag pa tsam gyis 'grub pa'i longs spyod kyang brtul zhugs can ma yin pa rnams kyis ji ltar 'bad pa gzhan gyis 'grub par mi nus sam /
analyzed: yan lag bshad ma thag pa tsam gyis 'grub pa'i longs spyod kyang brtul zhugs can ma yin pa rnams kyis ji ltar 'bad pa gzhan gyis 'grub par mi nus sam /
translated: How can those who are not disciplined achieve the enjoyments that are accomplished by the mere explanation of the limbs?

original: ci ste gong na med pa'i rgyal po nyid thob pa la sogs pa'o zhe na /üîΩde yang brtul zhugs blangs pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: ci ste gong na med pa'i rgyal po nyid thob pa la sogs pa'o zhe na / de yang brtul zhugs blangs pa nas brtsams te /
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúIt is the attainment of the unsurpassed kingdom and so on,‚ÄùüîΩthat also is not seen for any disciplined person from the time of taking up the discipline

original: shi ba'i mthar thug par yang brtul zhugs can 'ga' la yang ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: shi ba'i mthar thug par yang brtul zhugs can 'ga' la yang ma mthong ngo //
translated: up to the time of death.üîΩIf one says, ‚ÄúIt is the attainment of the ground of the very stable and the various infinite vast enjoyments,‚Äù

original: ci ste ches shin tu brtan zhing rnam pa sna tshogs pa mtha' yas pa'i longs spyod rgya chen po'i sa thob par bya ba la byin gyis rlob par byed pa nyid kyi 'dod pa'i lha dang nye ba nyid du gyur nas bsgrub par bya ba rtag tu bde
analyzed: ci ste ches shin tu brtan zhing rnam pa sna tshogs pa mtha' yas pa'i longs spyod rgya chen po'i sa thob par bya ba la byin gyis rlob par byed pa nyid kyi 'dod pa'i lha dang nye ba nyid du gyur nas bsgrub par bya ba rtag tu bde
translated: then one should always practice in order to be blessed with the attainment of the ground of the very stable and the various infinite vast enjoyments.

original: ba phun sum tshogs pas kun du khyab pas rtag tu tshim pa'i bdag nyid can mtshan nyid gzhan dang mi mthun pa dus gzhan du lus gzhan gyis thob par bya pa'i longs spyod do zhes zer na /
analyzed: ba phun sum tshogs pas kun du khyab pas rtag tu tshim pa'i bdag nyid can mtshan nyid gzhan dang mi mthun pa dus gzhan du lus gzhan gyis thob par bya pa'i longs spyod do zhes zer na /
translated: The body is always satisfied by the abundance of the food and drink that is produced by the power of the mind. It is not subject to the characteristics of other bodies, and it is not subject to change at other times.

original: ae ma ho 'dod pa ngan pa'i zhags pa brgyas bcings pa'i bsam pa'i dbang gis lus gzhig par 'dod cing rmongs pas dbang du byas pa'i rnam pa ni mya ngan bya bar 'os pa yin no //
analyzed: ae ma ho 'dod pa ngan pa'i zhags pa brgyas bcings pa'i bsam pa'i dbang gis lus gzhig par 'dod cing rmongs pas dbang du byas pa'i rnam pa ni mya ngan bya bar 'os pa yin no //
translated: Alas! Those who are bound by the hundred fetters of bad desires, who desire to destroy the body, who are controlled by delusion, are worthy of compassion.

original: gang gi phyir sbyin las byung ba'i dri ma med pa'i chu don du gnyer ba'i rma bya rnams dud 'gro yin yang sems kyi bde ba la rnam par dpyad na lus de nyid kyi don byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir smad par 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sbyin las byung ba'i dri ma med pa'i chu don du gnyer ba'i rma bya rnams dud 'gro yin yang sems kyi bde ba la rnam par dpyad na lus de nyid kyi don byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir smad par 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: The peacocks, who are animals, seek the pure water that comes from the giving of the Bodhisattvas. When the happiness of the mind is considered, the body is useful. Therefore, it is not to be despised.

original: brtul zhugs can dag khanda dang // bu ram yid kyis longs spyad pas //
analyzed: brtul zhugs can dag khanda dang // bu ram yid kyis longs spyad pas //
translated: The ascetics, by mentally enjoying sugarcane and molasses,

original: bder 'gyur lus las gzhan du 'gyur //
analyzed: bder 'gyur lus las gzhan du 'gyur //
translated: become happy and their bodies are transformed.

original: de ni nam mkha'i me tog bzhin //
analyzed: de ni nam mkha'i me tog bzhin //
translated: It is like a sky flower.

original: gang phyir 'di dag dad pa tsam //
analyzed: gang phyir 'di dag dad pa tsam //
translated: Because these are mere faith,

original: yin pa de phyir kha rog sdod //
analyzed: yin pa de phyir kha rog sdod //
translated: Therefore, be silent.

original: rigs pa 'dis rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i brtul zhugs bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs pa 'dis rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i brtul zhugs bkag pa yin no //
translated: By this reasoning, the conduct of the perfect yogi is refuted.

original: lung gis ni ji skad du /
analyzed: lung gis ni ji skad du /
translated: By scripture, it is as said:

original: dka' thub kyis ni lus gdungs pa //
analyzed: dka' thub kyis ni lus gdungs pa //
translated: By austerities, the body is tormented,

original: 'ba' zhig las ni bsod nams min //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig las ni bsod nams min //
translated: But only merit is not produced.

original: pha rol gnod pa spong ba min //
analyzed: pha rol gnod pa spong ba min //
translated: The harm of others is not abandoned,

original: gzhan la phan pa byed mi @80b 'gyur //üîΩsbyin pa'i tshul khrims bzod gsal ba'i //
analyzed: gzhan la phan pa byed mi @80b 'gyur // sbyin pa'i tshul khrims bzod gsal ba'i //
translated: And benefit for others is not done.üîΩOn the great path of the holy Dharma

original: dam pa'i chos kyi lam chen la //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi lam chen la //
translated: Of giving, ethics, and patience,

original: ma gus byas nas dgon pa yi //üîΩlam log lus kyi sdug bsngal 'gro //
analyzed: ma gus byas nas dgon pa yi // lam log lus kyi sdug bsngal 'gro //
translated: Having been disrespectful,üîΩOne goes to the suffering of the body on the wrong path in the forest.

original: yan lag sdug bsngal sprul dkris nas //
analyzed: yan lag sdug bsngal sprul dkris nas //

original: 'khor ba'i dgon pa 'jigs rung zhing //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i dgon pa 'jigs rung zhing //
translated: In the terrifying forest of samsara,

original: skye bo mtha' yas nags ldan pa //
analyzed: skye bo mtha' yas nags ldan pa //
translated: Having the forest of infinite beings,

analyzed: shin tu ring ba 'thob par 'gyur //üîΩzhes gang bshad pa'o //
translated: One goes very far.

original: lha thams cad yang dag par 'dus pa zhes bya ba'i rgyud las rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi brtul zhugs ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: lha thams cad yang dag par 'dus pa zhes bya ba'i rgyud las rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi brtul zhugs ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: The Tantra of the Complete Assembly of All Deities says, ‚ÄúWhat is the discipline of yogins and yoginƒ´s?

analyzed: gang tshe las rnams thams cad ni // thabs bcas the tshom med pa ru //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen all actionsüîΩare performed with skillful means, without doubt,

original: rtog pa med pa'i sems kyis spyod //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa'i sems kyis spyod //
translated: and with a nonconceptual mind,üîΩthat is the supreme of all disciplines.‚Äù

original: brtul zhugs rnams las mchog gi mchog / dka' thub ces bya ci zhe na //üîΩrnam par rtog pa med pa yis //
analyzed: brtul zhugs rnams las mchog gi mchog / dka' thub ces bya ci zhe na // rnam par rtog pa med pa yis //
translated: What is called ‚Äúasceticism‚Äù?

original: rtog pa med pa'i rang bzhin du //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa'i rang bzhin du //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen, with a nonconceptual mind,

analyzed: rtag tu las rnams kun spyod pa //

analyzed: dka' thub rnams las dka' thub mchog / rtog pa med pa'i sems kyis ni //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen, with a nonconceptual mind,

original: yul rnams sten par byed pas na //
analyzed: yul rnams sten par byed pas na //
translated: one enjoys sense objects,

original: smad pas rdul tsam mi gnod pa //
analyzed: smad pas rdul tsam mi gnod pa //
translated: and not even a speck of contempt arises,

analyzed: rgal bar dka' ba'i dka' thub yin // gang zhig las rnams thams cad la //
translated: that is an austerity difficult to overcome.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúWhen, with wisdom,

original: shes rab kyis ni nges sbyor zhing //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni nges sbyor zhing //
translated: one is definitely engaged in all actions

original: de yang stong pa'i gnas sbyor ba //
analyzed: de yang stong pa'i gnas sbyor ba //
translated: and is also engaged in the abode of emptiness,

original: bdag nyid chen po dka' thub yin //
analyzed: bdag nyid chen po dka' thub yin //
translated: that is the austerity of a great being.‚Äù

original: shes rab tu zhugs gyur pa'i //
analyzed: shes rab tu zhugs gyur pa'i //
translated: And has entered into wisdom,

original: rtog pa med pa'i sems kyis ni //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa'i sems kyis ni //
translated: With a mind free from concepts,

original: the tshom med par spyad pa spyod //
analyzed: the tshom med par spyad pa spyod //
translated: Practices the conduct without doubt.

original: bdag nyid chen po'i dka' thub yin //üîΩgal te shes rab thabs med par //
analyzed: bdag nyid chen po'i dka' thub yin // gal te shes rab thabs med par //
translated: This is the austerity of the great being.üîΩIf the mind does not engage elsewhere,

analyzed: sems ni gzhan du mi spyod pa // byang chub chen por rab ster ba'i //
translated: Without wisdom and means,üîΩIt is explained to be certain

original: nges pa yin par yang dag bshad //
analyzed: nges pa yin par yang dag bshad //
translated: In bestowing the great enlightenment.üîΩThose yogis who are diligent

original: mi rtog pa la rjes zhugs shing //üîΩbrtson dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor ba //
analyzed: mi rtog pa la rjes zhugs shing // brtson dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor ba //
translated: And have entered into non-conceptuality,

original: de rnams kyis ni 'byung ba kun //
analyzed: de rnams kyis ni 'byung ba kun //
translated: For the sake of all the elements,

original: bya ba'i don du spros pa yin //
analyzed: bya ba'i don du spros pa yin //
translated: They proliferate for the purpose of action.

original: shes rab me long nang zhugs pa //
analyzed: shes rab me long nang zhugs pa //
translated: Wisdom enters into the mirror,

original: 'dus byas de yi rnam pa yin //
analyzed: 'dus byas de yi rnam pa yin //
translated: The compounded is its aspect.

original: mi rtog bdag nyid de rnams kyis //
analyzed: mi rtog bdag nyid de rnams kyis //
translated: By those who are non-conceptual,

original: dran pa shes rab rag lus shing //
analyzed: dran pa shes rab rag lus shing //
translated: Mindfulness and wisdom are dependent.üîΩOne who sees them as equal to

original: me long gi ni gzugs brnyan dang // rmi lam sgyu ma chu bur dang // mig 'phrul mtshungs par gang zhig gis //
analyzed: me long gi ni gzugs brnyan dang // rmi lam sgyu ma chu bur dang // mig 'phrul mtshungs par gang zhig gis //
translated: A reflection in a mirror, a dream, an illusion, a bubble,

original: mthong ba de ni gtso bor brjod //
analyzed: mthong ba de ni gtso bor brjod //
translated: An optical illusion, is called the foremost.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / de nyid kyi phyir dpal mkha' 'gro ma dra ba sdom pa'i rgyud las /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / de nyid kyi phyir dpal mkha' 'gro ma dra ba sdom pa'i rgyud las /
translated: And for that very reason, the glorious Tantra of the Web of Magical Display of Vajravarahi says:

original: bdag nyid sangs rgyas thams cad nyid //
analyzed: bdag nyid sangs rgyas thams cad nyid //
translated: You are the very nature of all buddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' kun nyid de //üîΩlhag @81a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' kun nyid de // lhag @81a * //
translated: the very nature of all bodhisattvas,

original: pa'i lha yi rnal 'byor yin //
analyzed: pa'i lha yi rnal 'byor yin //
translated: and the very nature of all deities.

original: de phyir bdag nyid mchod par bya //
analyzed: de phyir bdag nyid mchod par bya //
translated: Therefore, you should worship yourself.

original: bcos ma'i gzugs brnyan rnams la ni //
analyzed: bcos ma'i gzugs brnyan rnams la ni //
translated: The yoga of the fabricated image

original: rnal 'byor skye ba ma yin te //
analyzed: rnal 'byor skye ba ma yin te //
translated: does not give rise to the yoga.

original: byang chub sems la rab brtson na //
analyzed: byang chub sems la rab brtson na //
translated: If you strive in the spirit of enlightenment,

original: des na rnal 'byor pa nyid lha //üîΩrang gi bdag nyid spangs nas ni //
analyzed: des na rnal 'byor pa nyid lha // rang gi bdag nyid spangs nas ni //
translated: then you are a yogin or yogini.üîΩDo not abandon your own nature

original: dka' thub kyis ni gdung mi bya //
analyzed: dka' thub kyis ni gdung mi bya //
translated: and torment yourself with austerities.

original: ci bde bar ni bde bar gzung //
analyzed: ci bde bar ni bde bar gzung //
translated: Take up what is comfortable and pleasant.

original: 'di ni ma 'ongs rdzogs sangs rgyas //
analyzed: 'di ni ma 'ongs rdzogs sangs rgyas //
translated: This is the future perfect buddha.

original: 'dir ni gtsang sbra brtul zhugs med //üîΩdka' thub dka' spyad mi dgos te //
analyzed: 'dir ni gtsang sbra brtul zhugs med // dka' thub dka' spyad mi dgos te //
translated: Here there is no purity or austerity,üîΩno need for austerities or difficult practices.

original: sdom dang dka' spyad med pa ru //
analyzed: sdom dang dka' spyad med pa ru //
translated: Without vows or difficult practices,

original: dga' dang bde bas 'grub par 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dga' dang bde bas 'grub par 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
translated: you will succeed with joy and pleasure.

original: de ltar na lung tshad mar byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar na lung tshad mar byas nas /
translated: Thus, having taken scripture as authoritative,

original: rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i brtul zhugs bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i brtul zhugs bkag pa yin no //
translated: the conduct of the perfect yogi is prohibited.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis las dang po pa rnams dang bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la ni 'di thams cad bkag pa ma yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
