analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis las dang po pa rnams dang bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la ni 'di thams cad bkag pa ma yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: But it should be understood that the Blessed One did not prohibit all of this for beginners and yogis of the generation stage.

original: de bzhin du de la phreng ba'ang mi dgos te las kyi tshogs bsgrub pa'i don du shel la sogs pa'i bye brag de la dgos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du de la phreng ba'ang mi dgos te las kyi tshogs bsgrub pa'i don du shel la sogs pa'i bye brag de la dgos pa ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, there is no need for a rosary there, because the distinctions of crystal and so forth are not necessary for the accomplishment of the aggregate of karma.

original: 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim pas rdo rje bzlas pa goms par byed na rlung tsam 'ba' zhig phreng ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim pas rdo rje bzlas pa goms par byed na rlung tsam 'ba' zhig phreng ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one becomes familiar with vajra repetition through the stages of entry and so forth, the mere wind alone is the rosary.

original: de la bgrang ba'ang mi dgos shing tshes brgyad la sogs pa la rnam pa bcu'am bsnyen gnas yan lag brgyad blang bar bya mi dgos te /
analyzed: de la bgrang ba'ang mi dgos shing tshes brgyad la sogs pa la rnam pa bcu'am bsnyen gnas yan lag brgyad blang bar bya mi dgos te /
translated: There is no need for counting, and there is no need to take the ten aspects on the eighth day and so forth or the eight branches of the purificatory fast,

original: sems dbang du byed pa'i brtul zhugs rtag tu nye bar gnas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dbang du byed pa'i brtul zhugs rtag tu nye bar gnas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the conduct of controlling the mind is always present.

original: gzung ba zhes bya ba bslab pa kun las btus pa la sogs par gsungs pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyis bslab pa'i gzhi gzung ba 'di la mi dgos te /
analyzed: gzung ba zhes bya ba bslab pa kun las btus pa la sogs par gsungs pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyis bslab pa'i gzhi gzung ba 'di la mi dgos te /
translated: The grasping of the bases of training of body, speech, and mind, as taught in the Siksasamuccaya and so forth, is not necessary here.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba chen po de kho na nyid kyi rin po che gzung bas gzhan dogs pa med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba chen po de kho na nyid kyi rin po che gzung bas gzhan dogs pa med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no other doubt than the grasping of the jewel of reality, the innate great bliss.

original: sbyin sreg las rnams te zhi ba la sogs pa'i don du dkyil 'khor grub ni la sogs par mar dang til la sogs pa bsregs pa de lta bu yang rnal 'byor ba la mi dgos te /
analyzed: sbyin sreg las rnams te zhi ba la sogs pa'i don du dkyil 'khor grub ni la sogs par mar dang til la sogs pa bsregs pa de lta bu yang rnal 'byor ba la mi dgos te /
translated: The rites of burnt offerings for the sake of pacification and so forth, having accomplished the ma·πá·∏çala and so forth, the burning of clarified butter, sesame seeds, and so forth, is also not necessary for the yogƒ´.

original: ma ning gi bzlas pa'i dus su phung po dang khams dang skye mched ma lus par skad cig tsam la ye shes kyi mes bsreg pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma ning gi bzlas pa'i dus su phung po dang khams dang skye mched ma lus par skad cig tsam la ye shes kyi mes bsreg pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because at the time of the neuter recitation, the aggregates, elements, and sense bases are all burned in an instant by the fire of gnosis.

original: gzhan dang gzhan te dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga dang mchod pa'i bya ba la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag kyang des bya mi dgos so //
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan te dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga dang mchod pa'i bya ba la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag kyang des bya mi dgos so //
translated: The other and other rites, whatever they are, such as the ma·πá·∏çala ritual and the rites of worship, are also not necessary for him to do.

original: de rnams ni ye shes kyi @81b rim pa kho nas grub pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bya ba'i rim pa dgos pa ci zhig yod ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni ye shes kyi @81b rim pa kho nas grub pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bya ba'i rim pa dgos pa ci zhig yod ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement, which is not the intended meaning.üîΩNow, in order to teach how the perfect yogis, such as ≈öiva, should act,

original: de ni rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa zhi pa la sogs pa rnams ji ltar bya ba ste bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa zhi pa la sogs pa rnams ji ltar bya ba ste bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: it is said:

original: ya yi don gyis gang ci'ang rung //
analyzed: ya yi don gyis gang ci'ang rung //
translated: Whatever is the case by the meaning of ya,

original: dngos grub 'dod pas bya ba ni /
analyzed: dngos grub 'dod pas bya ba ni /
translated: is the action of one who desires power.

original: ra la sogs pa gsum nyid kyis //
analyzed: ra la sogs pa gsum nyid kyis //
translated: By the three of ra and so on,üîΩone engages in the benefit of beings.üîΩIn the individual ma·πá·∏çalas of fire, wind, great lord,

original: 'gro ba'i don la rab tu 'jug / me dang rlung dang dbang chen dang // chu ste dkyil 'khor so so ru //üîΩthun ni phyed phyed dus su ni //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don la rab tu 'jug / me dang rlung dang dbang chen dang // chu ste dkyil 'khor so so ru // thun ni phyed phyed dus su ni //
translated: and water,üîΩthe two actions remain

original: las ni gnyis gnyis gnas par 'gyur //
analyzed: las ni gnyis gnyis gnas par 'gyur //
translated: in the time of half a period.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this statement is as follows.

original: yi ge ya'i sa bon gyis nye bar mtshon pa'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor de'i don te 'od zer spro bas dgug pa la sogs pa gang ci yang rung ba dngos grub ste dngos grub de nyid 'dod cing mngon par 'dod pas bya ba ni bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge ya'i sa bon gyis nye bar mtshon pa'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor de'i don te 'od zer spro bas dgug pa la sogs pa gang ci yang rung ba dngos grub ste dngos grub de nyid 'dod cing mngon par 'dod pas bya ba ni bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of that is the wind ma·πá·∏çala illustrated by the seed syllable ya, and the accomplishment of any rite whatsoever, such as summoning by the emission of light rays, is to be accomplished by one who desires and longs for that very accomplishment.

original: de bzhin du ra la sogs pa gsum nyid kyis te //
analyzed: de bzhin du ra la sogs pa gsum nyid kyis te //
translated: Similarly, by the three, ra and so on,

original: ra dang la dang wa yis nye bar mtshon pa'i me dang sa dang chu'i dkyil 'khor sum dang / de las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi 'khor lo spro bas 'gro ba'i don la ste /
analyzed: ra dang la dang wa yis nye bar mtshon pa'i me dang sa dang chu'i dkyil 'khor sum dang / de las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi 'khor lo spro bas 'gro ba'i don la ste /
translated: the three ma·πá·∏çalas of fire, earth, and water, illustrated by ra, la, and va, and the wheel of light rays that arises from them, for the sake of migrating beings,

original: dbang dang rgyas pa dang zhi ba la rab tu 'jug pa ni sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dbang dang rgyas pa dang zhi ba la rab tu 'jug pa ni sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: engaging in power, increase, and pacification is the accomplishment.

original: dkyil 'khor rnams kyi ming gsungs pa //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor rnams kyi ming gsungs pa //
translated: The names of the ma·πá·∏çalas are stated:

original: me dang rlung dang dbang chen dang // chu ste dkyil 'khor so so ru ste dkyil 'khor re re las 'od zer spros nas sngar bshad pa'i rim pas thun phyed kyi dus su bzung ste /
analyzed: me dang rlung dang dbang chen dang // chu ste dkyil 'khor so so ru ste dkyil 'khor re re las 'od zer spros nas sngar bshad pa'i rim pas thun phyed kyi dus su bzung ste /
translated: Fire, wind, great power, and water, in each of the ma·πá·∏çalas, that is, having emanated light rays from each ma·πá·∏çala, one should hold the vƒÅyu for half a session, as explained previously.

original: las gnyis gnyis zhes bya ba ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i las bzhi po rnams 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: las gnyis gnyis zhes bya ba ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i las bzhi po rnams 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: The two actions are the two actions of each of the four actions, such as pacifying.

original: sgra ji bzhin ma yin pa'i bshad pa'o //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin ma yin pa'i bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the non-literal explanation.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas thar pa thob pa de'i sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas thar pa thob pa de'i sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The explanation of the attainment of liberation by the yoga of the completion stage is as follows.

original: mchod la brtson pas mchod par 'gyur //
analyzed: mchod la brtson pas mchod par 'gyur //
translated: One becomes a worshipper through striving in worship.

original: bzlas la brtson pas rnam dag 'gyur //
analyzed: bzlas la brtson pas rnam dag 'gyur //
translated: One becomes pure through striving in repetition.

original: me la sbyin sreg brtson pas 'byor //üîΩbsam gtan brtson pas thar pa thob //
analyzed: me la sbyin sreg brtson pas 'byor // bsam gtan brtson pas thar pa thob //
translated: One becomes wealthy through striving in fire offerings.

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: One attains liberation through striving in concentration.

original: ji ltar mchod pa la brtson pa ste mchod pa rnam pa lngas bcom ldan 'das la mchod par byed cing bdag dang gzhan rnams mnyes par byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa gang yin pa de ni ji ltar skye ba 'di dang skye ba gzhan dag tu las dge ba'i
analyzed: ji ltar mchod pa la brtson pa ste mchod pa rnam pa lngas bcom ldan 'das la mchod par byed cing bdag dang gzhan rnams mnyes par byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa gang yin pa de ni ji ltar skye ba 'di dang skye ba gzhan dag tu las dge ba'i
translated: How does one become an object of worship through the power of virtue in this life and in other lives?

original: mthus mchod byar 'gyur te mchod par 'os par 'gyur ro//
analyzed: mthus mchod byar 'gyur te mchod par 'os par 'gyur ro//
translated: One who is a yogi/nƒ´ who is diligent in worship, who worships the Blessed One with the five types of worship, and who delights oneself and others, becomes an object of worship through the power of virtue in this life and in other lives.

original: @82a * // de bzhin du ji ltar bzlas la brtson pa ste /
analyzed: @82a * // de bzhin du ji ltar bzlas la brtson pa ste /
translated: How does one become pure through recitation?

original: ngag gi bzlas pa lhur len pa'i rnal 'byor ba ni rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ngag gi bzlas pa lhur len pa'i rnal 'byor ba ni rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
translated: A yogi/nƒ´ who is diligent in verbal recitation becomes pure.

original: bzlas pa ni sdig pa nyid nye bar 'thag par byed pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde bzhin du ji ltar me la sbyin sreg brtson pa ste /
analyzed: bzlas pa ni sdig pa nyid nye bar 'thag par byed pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // de bzhin du ji ltar me la sbyin sreg brtson pa ste /
translated: Recitation has the nature of burning up evil.üîΩHow does one obtain perfect prosperity through fire sacrifice?

original: me la mchod pa byed par brtson pa dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni 'byor pa phun sum tshogs pa thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: me la mchod pa byed par brtson pa dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni 'byor pa phun sum tshogs pa thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: A yogi/nƒ´ who is diligent in fire sacrifice obtains perfect prosperity.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan brtson pa ste de rdo rje bzlas pa mthar phyin pa'i rnal 'byor bas thar pa thob pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob par ro zhes bya ba'i don te sgra ji bzhin pa'i don to ;
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan brtson pa ste de rdo rje bzlas pa mthar phyin pa'i rnal 'byor bas thar pa thob pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob par ro zhes bya ba'i don te sgra ji bzhin pa'i don to ;
translated: Likewise, the one who strives in meditative concentration, that is, the yogin who has perfected vajra repetition, attains liberation, which means that he attains the stage of Great Vajradhara. This is the literal meaning.

original: / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pas ni gsang sngags kyi dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pas ni gsang sngags kyi dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that one who abides in nonconceptual meditative concentration will attain the spiritual attainments of mantra, it is said:

original: sngags pas de ltar shes nas ni //
analyzed: sngags pas de ltar shes nas ni //
translated: The mantra practitioner, knowing this,

original: 'gro na byis pa bzhin du spyod //
analyzed: 'gro na byis pa bzhin du spyod //
translated: should act like a child when going.

original: de nas mi rtog chos nyid kyis //
analyzed: de nas mi rtog chos nyid kyis //
translated: Then, through the reality of nonconceptuality,

original: gsang sngags rnams ni 'grub par 'gyur//
analyzed: gsang sngags rnams ni 'grub par 'gyur//
translated: the mantras will be accomplished.

original: zhes gsungs te sngags pas te rnal 'byor pas de ltar sngar bshad pa'i tshul du rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa la sogs pas sngags btu ba dang sngags kyi brda dang / sngags kyi don dang sngags kyi de kho na nyid shes shing rtogs nas 'gro ba khams gsum par byes pa chung du bzhin du spyod pa ni ci nas kyang skyes pa dang bud med dang byis pa la sogs pa 'jig rten pa thams cad 'di ni smyon pa'o
analyzed: zhes gsungs te sngags pas te rnal 'byor pas de ltar sngar bshad pa'i tshul du rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa la sogs pas sngags btu ba dang sngags kyi brda dang / sngags kyi don dang sngags kyi de kho na nyid shes shing rtogs nas 'gro ba khams gsum par byes pa chung du bzhin du spyod pa ni ci nas kyang skyes pa dang bud med dang byis pa la sogs pa 'jig rten pa thams cad 'di ni smyon pa'o
translated: Thus, the mantrin, the yogi, having understood and realized the mantra extraction, the mantra sign, the meaning of the mantra, and the reality of the mantra, in the manner previously explained by the stage of vajra repetition, and so on, should conduct himself in the three realms of migrating beings like a young traveler, such that all worldly people, men, women, children, and so on, will say, ‚ÄúThis one is crazy.üîΩ‚Äù

original: zhes rnal 'byor ba la bzhad gad byed par 'gyur ba'i spyod pa byas te /
analyzed: zhes rnal 'byor ba la bzhad gad byed par 'gyur ba'i spyod pa byas te /
translated: He should conduct himself in that way.

original: ji skad su padmo rdo rje'i zhal snga nas kyis //
analyzed: ji skad su padmo rdo rje'i zhal snga nas kyis //
translated: As Padmavajra says:üîΩConduct is the same for all families,üîΩslightly crazy conduct,

original: rigs kun mtshungs par spyod pa dang // cung zhig smyon pa'i spyod pa dang // pheg rdob sgar bcas byis pa yis //
analyzed: rigs kun mtshungs par spyod pa dang // cung zhig smyon pa'i spyod pa dang // pheg rdob sgar bcas byis pa yis //
translated: surrounded by children,üîΩwith cymbals and a drum,üîΩwith the gait of vajra dance,

original: kun nas yongs su bskor ba dang // rdo rje gar gyi 'gros ldan pa'i //
analyzed: kun nas yongs su bskor ba dang // rdo rje gar gyi 'gros ldan pa'i //
translated: with the sound of the mantra.

original: rim gyis cung zad gar byed cing //
analyzed: rim gyis cung zad gar byed cing //
translated: Gradually, one should dance a little,üîΩand sing out with the sound of song,

original: glu yi sgra yang sgrogs pa dang // mi gsal rdo rje glu yang len //
analyzed: glu yi sgra yang sgrogs pa dang // mi gsal rdo rje glu yang len //
translated: and take up the indistinct vajra song.

original: des na khams gsum grags pa yis //
analyzed: des na khams gsum grags pa yis //
translated: Thus, with the sound of song pervading the three realms,

original: glu dag gsal bar blang bar bya //
analyzed: glu dag gsal bar blang bar bya //
translated: one should clearly take up the song.

original: sna tshogs sgra ldan glu blang zhing //
analyzed: sna tshogs sgra ldan glu blang zhing //
translated: One should sing the song endowed with various sounds,

original: yi dags bzhin du gang mos bsre //
analyzed: yi dags bzhin du gang mos bsre //
translated: and burn whatever one desires, like a hungry ghost.

original: skye bo'i las rnams mi zad pa //
analyzed: skye bo'i las rnams mi zad pa //
translated: The actions of beings are inexhaustible,

original: gang dang gang gis bcings gyur pa //
analyzed: gang dang gang gis bcings gyur pa //
translated: and whatever one is bound by,

original: de nyid thabs dang bcas pa yis //
analyzed: de nyid thabs dang bcas pa yis //
translated: by that very thing, together with the method,

original: srid pa'i 'ching ba las grol 'gyur //
analyzed: srid pa'i 'ching ba las grol 'gyur //
translated: one is liberated from the bondage of existence.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: spos @82b pa med pa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i rnal 'byor pa de lta bus sprul la sogs pa'i gsang sngags rnams 'grub par 'gyur ba'i 'bad pa med par zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rnams byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: spos @82b pa med pa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i rnal 'byor pa de lta bus sprul la sogs pa'i gsang sngags rnams 'grub par 'gyur ba'i 'bad pa med par zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rnams byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning is that a yogin who practices the conduct without smell will accomplish the mantras of emanation and so forth, and will effortlessly perform the actions of pacification and so forth.

original: dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: This is not the intended meaning.

original: mjug bsdu ba //
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba //
translated: Conclusion

original: gsung gi rdo rje sgrub byed pa'i //
analyzed: gsung gi rdo rje sgrub byed pa'i //
translated: This clarity of the reality of mantra

original: sngags kyi de nyid gsal ba 'di //üîΩye shes gsum gyi dbye ba yis //
analyzed: sngags kyi de nyid gsal ba 'di // ye shes gsum gyi dbye ba yis //
translated: is the accomplishment of the vajra of speech.üîΩIt is to be applied to mind-only

original: sems tsam ni sbyar bar bya //üîΩzhes pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sems tsam ni sbyar bar bya // zhes pa gsungs te /
translated: by the division of the three intuitions.

original: sngar bshad pa'i sngags kyi de kho na nyid de //üîΩrdo rje bzlas pa rim pas sngags rnams kyi de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo yongs su shes pa 'di ni gsung gi rdo rje ste /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i sngags kyi de kho na nyid de // rdo rje bzlas pa rim pas sngags rnams kyi de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo yongs su shes pa 'di ni gsung gi rdo rje ste /
translated: This is the reality of mantra explained above.üîΩThis knowledge of the nature of the reality of mantras by the stage of vajra repetition is the vajra of speech,üîΩfor it purifies discursive speech and accomplishes the vajra of the reality of clearlight.üîΩIt is to be applied to mind-only by the division of the three intuitions.

original: rnam bar rtog pa dang bcas pa'i ngag rnam par sbyangs nas 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid kyi rdo rje sgrub par byed cing yang dag par sgrub par byed pa ste /üîΩbshad zin pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: rnam bar rtog pa dang bcas pa'i ngag rnam par sbyangs nas 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid kyi rdo rje sgrub par byed cing yang dag par sgrub par byed pa ste / bshad zin pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The reality of mantra is to be applied to mind-only by the division of the three intuitions.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i tshig kyang rnam pa bzhi yod do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i tshig kyang rnam pa bzhi yod do //
translated: The three intuitions are the intuitions of voidness, of the reality of the image, and of the reality of the accomplishment of the aim.üîΩThe intuition of voidness is the intuition of the voidness of the imagined nature.

original: 'di lta ste mtshan nyid kyi tshig dang / rmi lam gyi tshig dang / gnas ngan len la mngon par zhen pa'i tshig dang / thog ma med pa'i dus can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i tshig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste mtshan nyid kyi tshig dang / rmi lam gyi tshig dang / gnas ngan len la mngon par zhen pa'i tshig dang / thog ma med pa'i dus can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i tshig ces bya ba'o //
translated: They are called the words of characteristics, the words of dreams, the words of attachment to negative tendencies, and the words of thoughts that have existed since beginningless time.

original: blo gros chen po de la mtshan nyid kyi tshig ni rang gi rnam par rtog pa las byung ba'i gzugs kyi mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: blo gros chen po de la mtshan nyid kyi tshig ni rang gi rnam par rtog pa las byung ba'i gzugs kyi mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pa las byung ba'o //
translated: MahƒÅmati, the words of characteristics arise from attachment to the signs of forms that arise from one‚Äôs own thoughts.

original: blo gros chen po rmi lam gyi tshig ni sngon nyams su myong ba'i yul rjes su dran pa dang yul nye bar snang ba las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: blo gros chen po rmi lam gyi tshig ni sngon nyams su myong ba'i yul rjes su dran pa dang yul nye bar snang ba las 'byung ngo //
translated: MahƒÅmati, the words of dreams arise from remembering objects experienced in the past and from the appearance of objects.

original: blo gros chen po gnas ngan len la mngon par zhen pa'i tshig ni sems kyis sngon byas pa'i las rjes su dran pa las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: blo gros chen po gnas ngan len la mngon par zhen pa'i tshig ni sems kyis sngon byas pa'i las rjes su dran pa las 'byung ngo //
translated: MahƒÅmati, the words of attachment to negative tendencies arise from remembering actions done by the mind in the past.

original: blo gros chen po thog ma med pa'i dus can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i tshig ni spos pa la mngon par zhen pa'i gnas ngan len gyi rang gi sa bon gyi bdag chags las 'byung ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po thog ma med pa'i dus can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i tshig ni spos pa la mngon par zhen pa'i gnas ngan len gyi rang gi sa bon gyi bdag chags las 'byung ste /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, the words of conceptualization since beginningless time arise from the self-attachment of the seeds of the negative tendencies of attachment to the imagined.

original: blo gros chen po de ni ngag gi rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: blo gros chen po de ni ngag gi rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: MahƒÅmati, that is called the four aspects of the characteristics of verbal conceptualization.

original: de bzhin du gzhan las kyang //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan las kyang //
translated: Similarly, elsewhere it is said:

original: tshig ni mchog dang lta bar byed pa dang bar ma gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: tshig ni mchog dang lta bar byed pa dang bar ma gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWords are of four kinds: supreme, viewing, intermediate, and illuminating.‚Äù

original: de la mchog ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i nang na gnas pa'i bag chags kyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de la mchog ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i nang na gnas pa'i bag chags kyi rnam pa'o //
translated: Among them, the supreme is the aspect of habitual tendencies abiding in the ƒÅlaya-consciousness.

original: lta bar byed pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin no //üîΩbar ma ni @83a * //
analyzed: lta bar byed pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin no //üîΩbar ma ni @83a * //
translated: The viewing is the nature of conceptualization based on the mental consciousness.üîΩThe intermediate is the nature of conceptualization based on the five sense consciousnesses.

original: rlung byung nas gnas rnams su thug pa las sgra mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin can gyi yi ge'i bdag nyid kyi yi ge phye mo'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: rlung byung nas gnas rnams su thug pa las sgra mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin can gyi yi ge'i bdag nyid kyi yi ge phye mo'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The wind arises and strikes the places, and from the nature of the indistinct sound, the letters are the essence of the letters, the nature of dust.

original: gsal ba ni tshig dang ngag la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis brjod par bya ba dang brjod par byed pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gsal ba ni tshig dang ngag la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis brjod par bya ba dang brjod par byed pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The clear is the nature of the words, speech, and so on, the nature of the expressed and the expresser.

original: shin tu gsal ba'i sgra'i ngo bo nyid yin pas rna ba'i dbang pos gzung bar bya ba ni tshig gsal ba zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: shin tu gsal ba'i sgra'i ngo bo nyid yin pas rna ba'i dbang pos gzung bar bya ba ni tshig gsal ba zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because it is the nature of the very clear sound, it is to be apprehended by the ear faculty. This is called the clear word.

original: de lta bu'i tha mal ba'i ngag gi rnam par rtog pa log par gyur nas 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid thob par byed pa'i sngags kyi de kho na nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bu'i tha mal ba'i ngag gi rnam par rtog pa log par gyur nas 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid thob par byed pa'i sngags kyi de kho na nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the reality of the mantra, which causes the attainment of the nature of clear light, having turned away from such ordinary conceptual thoughts of speech.

original: ji skad du tshul gcig ston pa'i mdo las //
analyzed: ji skad du tshul gcig ston pa'i mdo las //
translated: As it is said in the S≈´tra Teaching the Single Means:

original: chos 'di rnams ni sgra yi brda yis bstan //
analyzed: chos 'di rnams ni sgra yi brda yis bstan //
translated: ‚ÄúThese phenomena are taught by the symbols of sound.

original: 'dir ni chos dang sgra dag mi snang ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni chos dang sgra dag mi snang ste /
translated: Here, the phenomena and the sounds do not appear.

original: chos nyid tshul gcig dngos la zhugs nas ni //
analyzed: chos nyid tshul gcig dngos la zhugs nas ni //
translated: Having entered into the one mode of reality,

original: bzod spyod bla na med la reg par 'gyur //
analyzed: bzod spyod bla na med la reg par 'gyur //
translated: one will reach the unsurpassed stage of forbearance and practice.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: As it is said.

original: ye shes gsum gyi dbye ba ni 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ye shes gsum gyi dbye ba ni 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The division of the three intuitions will be explained below.

original: des sems can la ste /
analyzed: des sems can la ste /
translated: By that, for sentient beings,

original: 'od gsal ba'i chos nyid la sbyar bar bya ba'i 'bad par bya ba'o //üîΩde ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pas dag rnam par dben ba'i pha rol tu phyin nas de'i rjes la rang bzhin dang snang ba dang / rlung gi bzhon pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: 'od gsal ba'i chos nyid la sbyar bar bya ba'i 'bad par bya ba'o // de ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pas dag rnam par dben ba'i pha rol tu phyin nas de'i rjes la rang bzhin dang snang ba dang / rlung gi bzhon pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa'i sgo nas /
translated: one should strive to apply them to the clear light reality.üîΩThat is the stage of vajra repetition. Having perfected the transcendent state of emptiness, after that, one should cultivate the stage of the pure mind through the door of consciousness endowed with the mounts of nature, appearance, and wind.

original: sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa goms par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa goms par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the meaning:

original: dgongs pa ma yin pas bshad pa'o /
analyzed: dgongs pa ma yin pas bshad pa'o /
translated: It is not the intended meaning.

original: da ni slob ma rnams kyi snod dang snod ma yin pa brtag pa /
analyzed: da ni slob ma rnams kyi snod dang snod ma yin pa brtag pa /
translated: Now, the examination of whether the disciples are a vessel or not:

original: bla ma la brnyas rgyu can dad pa med //
analyzed: bla ma la brnyas rgyu can dad pa med //
translated: Those who are contemptuous of the guru and lack faith,

original: sngags kyis rlom zhing glegs bam mthong bas khengs //
analyzed: sngags kyis rlom zhing glegs bam mthong bas khengs //
translated: Conceited with mantras, puffed up by seeing books,

original: dad pa med cing dbang bskur dman pa la //
analyzed: dad pa med cing dbang bskur dman pa la //
translated: without faith, and of low consecration,

original: rim pa'i gtam yang bstan pa'i mi bya'o //
analyzed: rim pa'i gtam yang bstan pa'i mi bya'o //
translated: one should not even speak of the stages to him.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: slob ma ji lta bu zhe na //
analyzed: slob ma ji lta bu zhe na //
translated: What kind of disciple?

original: bla ma ste dbang bskur ba'i bla ma'i zhal snga nas la brnyas pa ni sla chos dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: bla ma ste dbang bskur ba'i bla ma'i zhal snga nas la brnyas pa ni sla chos dang bcas pa'o //
translated: One who is contemptuous of the guru, the guru who confers consecration, is a hypocrite.

original: gal te bsams pa dag par gyur na de'i tshe nyes pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te bsams pa dag par gyur na de'i tshe nyes pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: If he is of pure intention, then what is the problem?

original: sgyu can te g-yo dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu can te g-yo dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He is a deceiver, that is, he is deceitful.

original: de bzhin du dad pa med pa ni khro ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dad pa med pa ni khro ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Similarly, one without faith is angry.

original: de bzhin du sngags tsam shes nas rlom pa ni nga rgyal can no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sngags tsam shes nas rlom pa ni nga rgyal can no //
translated: Similarly, one who is conceited by merely knowing the mantra is proud.

original: tshogs pa'i nang du nga rgyal gyi dbang gis thos pa mi byed cing rang gi khyim du glegs bam bltas @83b nas bdag gis thams cad shes so snyam nas khengs pa ni ste mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa'i nang du nga rgyal gyi dbang gis thos pa mi byed cing rang gi khyim du glegs bam bltas @83b nas bdag gis thams cad shes so snyam nas khengs pa ni ste mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang bcas pa'o //
translated: In the assembly, due to pride, he does not listen, and having looked at the books in his own house, thinking I know everything, he is puffed up, that is, he has excessive pride.

original: gal te brgya la zhig thos pa la 'jug na de'i tshe dad pa med par 'dir bdag la the tshom yod do zhes thabs kyis nyan par byed do //
analyzed: gal te brgya la zhig thos pa la 'jug na de'i tshe dad pa med par 'dir bdag la the tshom yod do zhes thabs kyis nyan par byed do //
translated: If he should happen to hear it, then, without faith, he listens with the pretext of doubt, saying, ‚ÄúI have doubts about this.‚Äù

original: de'i rjes la dbang bskur ba dman pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes la dbang bskur ba dman pa ste /
translated: After that, the consecration is inferior.

original: bla ma las dbang bskur ba yang dag par ma thob pa de lta bu'i rnam pa can gan gyin pa'i slob ma de la rim pa ste rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa gtam ste gleng slong tsam yang bstan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bla ma las dbang bskur ba yang dag par ma thob pa de lta bu'i rnam pa can gan gyin pa'i slob ma de la rim pa ste rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa gtam ste gleng slong tsam yang bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: To that disciple who is of that sort, who has not received the consecration properly from the guru, the teacher should not even mention the stages, the stages of Vajra Repetition.

original: slob ma dam pa ni //
analyzed: slob ma dam pa ni //
translated: The excellent disciple is

original: gang zhig bla ma la gus dad pa ldan /
analyzed: gang zhig bla ma la gus dad pa ldan /
translated: he who has faith and devotion to the guru,

original: gus pa nyan la rtag tu mngon par brtson //
analyzed: gus pa nyan la rtag tu mngon par brtson //
translated: listens with devotion, and is always diligent.üîΩThe excellent guru should examine whether

original: thos pa 'dzin nus bla ma dam pa yis //üîΩbla ma'i drin sbyin de la brtag mi dgos //
analyzed: thos pa 'dzin nus bla ma dam pa yis // bla ma'i drin sbyin de la brtag mi dgos //
translated: the disciple is able to retain what he hears.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The guru should not be concerned about giving the gift of grace to him.

original: slob ma gang zhig chos la dad pa dang ldan zhing de ston par byed pa'i bla ma la gus pa dang bcas pa mnyan par 'dod pa la gus par nyan cing de'i don du mngon par brtson pa ste brtson 'grus dang ldan pa thos pa 'dzin pa ste
analyzed: slob ma gang zhig chos la dad pa dang ldan zhing de ston par byed pa'i bla ma la gus pa dang bcas pa mnyan par 'dod pa la gus par nyan cing de'i don du mngon par brtson pa ste brtson 'grus dang ldan pa thos pa 'dzin pa ste
translated: The disciple who is endowed with faith in the Dharma, who is endowed with reverence for the teacher who teaches it, who is desirous of listening, who listens with reverence, who is endowed with effort for the sake of that, who is a holder of what is heard,

original: / thos pas chog mi shes shing yang dang yang du thos pa goms par byed pa de la bla ma dam pas na bla ma mchog go //
analyzed: / thos pas chog mi shes shing yang dang yang du thos pa goms par byed pa de la bla ma dam pas na bla ma mchog go //
translated: who is not satisfied with just a little hearing, who is habituated to hearing again and again, for him, the excellent teacher, the best teacher,

original: bla ma'i drin sbyin pa ni rjes su gzung bar bya ba yin pa'o //
analyzed: bla ma'i drin sbyin pa ni rjes su gzung bar bya ba yin pa'o //
translated: is the one who is to be taken care of by the gift of the teacher's kindness.

original: brtag mi dgos pa ni dpyad par bya mi dgos pa ste /
analyzed: brtag mi dgos pa ni dpyad par bya mi dgos pa ste /
translated: Without the need for investigation, without the need for analysis,

original: de ni cig car rjes su gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa ma yin pas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de ni cig car rjes su gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa ma yin pas bshad pa'o //
translated: that is to be taken care of all at once. This is the non-intentional explanation.

original: da ni bla ma'i zhal snga nas kyi sku drin gyi che ba'i bdag nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni bla ma'i zhal snga nas kyi sku drin gyi che ba'i bdag nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to clarify the greatness of the teacher's kindness,

original: ri dbang rtse las 'ga' zhig lhung gyur na //
analyzed: ri dbang rtse las 'ga' zhig lhung gyur na //
translated: If someone were to fall from the peak of Mount Meru,

original: ltung bar mi 'dod kyang ni de ltung 'gyur //
analyzed: ltung bar mi 'dod kyang ni de ltung 'gyur //
translated: Even though he does not wish to fall, he falls.

original: bla ma'i drin gyis phan pa'i lung thob pa //
analyzed: bla ma'i drin gyis phan pa'i lung thob pa //
translated: By the grace of the guru, he obtains the beneficial scripture.

original: grol bar mi 'dod kyang ni de grol 'gyur //
analyzed: grol bar mi 'dod kyang ni de grol 'gyur //
translated: Even though he does not wish to be liberated, he is liberated.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: ji ltar 'ba' zhig sems gzhan du yengs nas rkang pa 'dren nas ri dbang rtse nas te ri mthon po'i kha nas lhung bar gyur na ste 'dred par gyur na'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'ba' zhig sems gzhan du yengs nas rkang pa 'dren nas ri dbang rtse nas te ri mthon po'i kha nas lhung bar gyur na ste 'dred par gyur na'o //
translated: Just as, when a person is distracted by something else and stumbles, that is, falls, from the peak of the lord of mountains, that is, from the top of a high mountain,

original: skyes bu de ltung bar 'gyur te 'dred pa 'chi ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir mi 'dod kyang ri mthon po nyid yin pas na ltung bar 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: skyes bu de ltung bar 'gyur te 'dred pa 'chi ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir mi 'dod kyang ri mthon po nyid yin pas na ltung bar 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: that person falls, even though he does not wish to, because of the height of the mountain, since stumbling is the cause of death.

original: de bzhin du bla ma'i drin gyis te rdo rje slob dpon gyis phan btags pas phan pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du bla ma'i drin gyis te rdo rje slob dpon gyis phan btags pas phan pa ste /
translated: In the same way, by the grace of the guru, that is, by the help of the vajra master, he obtains the benefit,

original: yang dag pa'i lam dang nye bar 'brel pa dang slob spon dpe mkhyud dang bral ba'i @84a * //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lam dang nye bar 'brel pa dang slob spon dpe mkhyud dang bral ba'i @84a * //
translated: that is, the connection with the true path, and the absence of the teacher's stinginess.

original: lung ste man ngag gis thob pa de ni grol bar mi 'dod kyang zhes bya ba srid du zin kyang 'on kyang grol bar 'gyur te des thar pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lung ste man ngag gis thob pa de ni grol bar mi 'dod kyang zhes bya ba srid du zin kyang 'on kyang grol bar 'gyur te des thar pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: That attainment by scripture, i.e., by instruction, is liberation, even though one does not desire it, i.e., even though one does not strive for it, still one is liberated, one attains liberation.

original: de lta bu 'di ni dngos po'i chos nyid yin par thos te /
analyzed: de lta bu 'di ni dngos po'i chos nyid yin par thos te /
translated: This is the nature of things, as one hears.

original: rjes su gzung ba'i skyes bu dus de nyid du grol ba nyid yin pas de las dus phyis de'i lus tsam gnas pa'i phyir rdza mkhan gyi 'khor lo bzhin te /
analyzed: rjes su gzung ba'i skyes bu dus de nyid du grol ba nyid yin pas de las dus phyis de'i lus tsam gnas pa'i phyir rdza mkhan gyi 'khor lo bzhin te /
translated: The person who is thus taken hold of is liberated at that very time, and after that time, his body remains only, like the potter's wheel.

original: gang gi dus su bla ma yis //
analyzed: gang gi dus su bla ma yis //
translated: As has been said: At whatever time the guru

original: rnam par mi rtog rab bstan pa //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog rab bstan pa //
translated: teaches non-conceptuality,

original: dus de kho na grol ba ste //
analyzed: dus de kho na grol ba ste //
translated: at that very time there is liberation,

original: lus tsam 'ba' zhig gnas pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa yang gsungs so //
analyzed: lus tsam 'ba' zhig gnas pa yin // zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang gsungs so //
translated: and the body remains only.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: This is the literal explanation.

original: rim pa lnga'i bshad pa nor bu'i phreng ba las rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa ste dang po'o //
analyzed: rim pa lnga'i bshad pa nor bu'i phreng ba las rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa ste dang po'o //
translated: This concludes the first chapter of the Jewel Garland commentary on the five stages, the stage of vajra repetition.

original: da ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir dang por phyag 'tshal ba //üîΩkhyod la phyag 'tshal khyod la 'dud //
analyzed: da ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir dang por phyag 'tshal ba // khyod la phyag 'tshal khyod la 'dud //
translated: Now, in order to teach the stages of the pure mind, first the homage:üîΩHomage to you, I bow to you,

original: khyod la phyag 'tshal phyag 'tshal 'dud //
analyzed: khyod la phyag 'tshal phyag 'tshal 'dud //
translated: Homage to you, I bow to you,

original: ji ltar bstod cing khyod phyag 'tshal //
analyzed: ji ltar bstod cing khyod phyag 'tshal //
translated: Homage to you, I praise you,

original: gang zhig bstod cing gang la bstod //
analyzed: gang zhig bstod cing gang la bstod //
translated: Who is praised, and to whom is it praised?

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: bod pa'i tshig kye bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes bya ba 'dir khong nas dbyung bar bya ste /üîΩ'di ltar thos pa dang rje su dpag pa dang khong nas dbyung ba ste /
analyzed: bod pa'i tshig kye bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes bya ba 'dir khong nas dbyung bar bya ste / 'di ltar thos pa dang rje su dpag pa dang khong nas dbyung ba ste /
translated: The Tibetan word kye, O BhagavƒÅn Great Vajradhara, should be inserted here.

original: gsum gyi mdo'i don bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: gsum gyi mdo'i don bstan par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the meaning of the sutra should be taught through the three: hearing, inference, and insertion.

original: de la thos pa ni mngon sum gyis dmigs pa ste dper na /
analyzed: de la thos pa ni mngon sum gyis dmigs pa ste dper na /
translated: Among them, hearing is direct perception, for example:

original: mgon po sems can kun bdag nyid //
analyzed: mgon po sems can kun bdag nyid //
translated: The protector, the nature of all beings,

original: dpal ldan bde chen la btud nas //
analyzed: dpal ldan bde chen la btud nas //
translated: Having bowed to glorious great bliss,

original: zhes bya ba der rdo rje 'chang rjod par byed pa'i tshig bde ba chen po zhes bya ba thob pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba der rdo rje 'chang rjod par byed pa'i tshig bde ba chen po zhes bya ba thob pa bzhin no //
translated: Here, the word great bliss, which expresses Vajradhara, is obtained like a direct perception.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni rjes su dpog par byed pa'i rtags kyis rtogs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni rjes su dpog par byed pa'i rtags kyis rtogs par byed pa ste /
translated: Inference is the understanding by means of a logical reason that is the means of inference.

original: khyad par gyi tshig gi rjes su dpag pas rtogs par bya ba ni yod pa ma yin pa yang rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: khyad par gyi tshig gi rjes su dpag pas rtogs par bya ba ni yod pa ma yin pa yang rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: That which is to be understood by means of an inferential statement is also understood when it is not present.

original: dper na zung du 'jug pa'i rim par //
analyzed: dper na zung du 'jug pa'i rim par //
translated: For example, in the stage of union,

original: mgon po rgyu dang 'bras bdag nyid //
analyzed: mgon po rgyu dang 'bras bdag nyid //
translated: the Lord is the nature of cause and effect.

original: ces bya ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par gyis tshig gzhan du mi 'thad pas rdo rje 'chang chen po kho na yin par rjes su dpag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par gyis tshig gzhan du mi 'thad pas rdo rje 'chang chen po kho na yin par rjes su dpag pa bzhin no //
translated: By the qualification of the nature of cause and effect, the statement is not tenable in any other way, so it is inferred that it is only Great Vajradhara.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gis dngos su ston pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gis dngos su ston pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe nature of cause and effect‚Äù does not directly teach that,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs bzhin no //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs bzhin no //
translated: like the statement ‚ÄúVajrasattva‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dir ni rdo rje 'chang zhes bya ba'i @84b tshig thos pa med cing de'i khyad par du gyur pa'i sgra'i stobs kyis rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni rdo rje 'chang zhes bya ba'i @84b tshig thos pa med cing de'i khyad par du gyur pa'i sgra'i stobs kyis rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Here, there is no hearing of the word Vajradhara, nor is there an inference by the power of the word that is its qualifier.

original: 'on kyang phyag bya ba'i tshig yod de'i phyir bstod par bya ba'i rdo rje 'chang zhes bya ba'i tshig khong nas dbyung ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang phyag bya ba'i tshig yod de'i phyir bstod par bya ba'i rdo rje 'chang zhes bya ba'i tshig khong nas dbyung ste /
translated: However, there is the word homage, and therefore the word Vajradhara, which is to be praised, is implied.

original: khong nas dbyung ba zhes bya ba ni gang du med pa'i sgra brtag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: khong nas dbyung ba zhes bya ba ni gang du med pa'i sgra brtag par bya ba'o //
translated: Implied means that a word that is not there is to be supplied.

original: khyod la phyag 'tshal te lus dang ngag dang sems kyis rab tu 'dud pa'o //
analyzed: khyod la phyag 'tshal te lus dang ngag dang sems kyis rab tu 'dud pa'o //
translated: Homage is bowing with body, speech, and mind.

original: phyag 'tshal zhes bya ba'i sgra bzhi sbyar ba ni dad pa'i phul du byung ba'i bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: phyag 'tshal zhes bya ba'i sgra bzhi sbyar ba ni dad pa'i phul du byung ba'i bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: The application of the word homage four times is for the purpose of teaching the highest faith.

original: dga' dang 'jigs sogs dbang bcas yid can gyis //
analyzed: dga' dang 'jigs sogs dbang bcas yid can gyis //
translated: Those with minds of faith, fear, and so on

original: smra ba bo rnams de bzhin bstod dang smod //
analyzed: smra ba bo rnams de bzhin bstod dang smod //
translated: praise and disparage speakers.

original: tshig ni lan cig min par smra ba gang /
analyzed: tshig ni lan cig min par smra ba gang /
translated: The words that are spoken are not spoken once,

original: de la zlos pa'i nyes pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: de la zlos pa'i nyes pa yod ma yin //
translated: and there is no fault of repetition.

original: zhes bya ba dang de bzhin du //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang de bzhin du //
translated: And similarly,üîΩin the case of the marvelous, dispute,üîΩanger, depression, ascertainment,

original: ngo mtshar gyur dang rtsod pa dang / khro dang zhum dang nges bzung dang // dad dang rjes su yi rang la //
analyzed: ngo mtshar gyur dang rtsod pa dang / khro dang zhum dang nges bzung dang // dad dang rjes su yi rang la //
translated: faith, and delight,

original: tshig gcig lan gnyis brjod par ya //üîΩzhes bshad do //
analyzed: tshig gcig lan gnyis brjod par ya // zhes bshad do //
translated: a single word is repeated twice.

original: ji ltar khyod la phyag 'tshal zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar khyod la phyag 'tshal zhe na /
translated: How do you pay homage?

original: ji ltar bstod pa ste bstod pa ji lta ba bzhin du stod par byed pa dang bstod pa dang bstod par ya ba rnams mi dmigs pa'i 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du bstod pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar bstod pa ste bstod pa ji lta ba bzhin du stod par byed pa dang bstod pa dang bstod par ya ba rnams mi dmigs pa'i 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du bstod pa yin te /
translated: Just as you praise, that is, you praise just as you praise, and those who praise, and the praise, and the three sectors of the circle are not apprehended.

original: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa'i lus dang ngag dang sems kyi bya ba dmigs pa dang bcas pa thams cad ni bsod nams tsam du 'gyur ba yin zhing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa'i lus dang ngag dang sems kyi bya ba dmigs pa dang bcas pa thams cad ni bsod nams tsam du 'gyur ba yin zhing /
translated: Because all the activities of the bodhisattva's body, speech, and mind that are associated with reference points are only merit.

original: dmigs pa med pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs su 'gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs su 'gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And those that are without reference points are the accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: gang gis bstod cing gang la bstod pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis bstod cing gang la bstod pa ste /
translated: By whom is there praise, and to whom is there praise?

original: dmigs pa med pas phyag 'tshal ba yin pas stod par byed pa'i gang zag gang la bstod pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pas phyag 'tshal ba yin pas stod par byed pa'i gang zag gang la bstod pa ste /
translated: Since there is no reference, there is no one who is the person who praises, and there is no one who is the object of praise.

original: bstod par 'os pa 'ga' yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: bstod par 'os pa 'ga' yang mi dmigs so //
translated: There is no one at all who is worthy of praise.

original: dmigs pa med par bstod pa las //
analyzed: dmigs pa med par bstod pa las //
translated: In the Praise Without Reference

original: de ltar bstod na bstod 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: de ltar bstod na bstod 'gyur gyi //
translated: If one praises in this way, there is praise,

original: gzhan du cung zad bstod pa min //
analyzed: gzhan du cung zad bstod pa min //
translated: but not in the slightest way otherwise.

original: chos rnams thams cad stong pa las ;
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad stong pa las ;
translated: Since all phenomena are empty,

original: / gang la bstod cing gang gis bstod //üîΩskye 'jig spangs pa khyod la yang //
analyzed: / gang la bstod cing gang gis bstod // skye 'jig spangs pa khyod la yang //
translated: to whom is there praise, and by whom is there praise?üîΩHow could I,

original: bdag gis bstod pa nus sam ci //üîΩbde 'gro ngan 'gro rnams spangs shing //
analyzed: bdag gis bstod pa nus sam ci // bde 'gro ngan 'gro rnams spangs shing //
translated: praise you, who are free from arising and destruction?

original: 'gro 'ong med pa bstod mi rung //
analyzed: 'gro 'ong med pa bstod mi rung //
translated: Since there is no going or coming, it is not right to praise the one who is free from going and coming.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te drang ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te drang ba'i don to //
translated: Thus it is said, and so forth. This is the interpretable meaning explanation.

original: yang na khyod la phyag 'tshal te rnam @85a * //üîΩpar snang mdzad kyi ngo bo la'o //
analyzed: yang na khyod la phyag 'tshal te rnam @85a * //üîΩpar snang mdzad kyi ngo bo la'o //
translated: Or, having bowed to you, to the essence of Vairochana,

original: yang na phyag 'tshal ba bzhin rin chen 'byung ldan dang 'od dpag tu med pa dang mi bskyod pa dang don yod par grub pa'i ngo bo la'o //
analyzed: yang na phyag 'tshal ba bzhin rin chen 'byung ldan dang 'od dpag tu med pa dang mi bskyod pa dang don yod par grub pa'i ngo bo la'o //
translated: Or else, like the homage, to the nature of Ratnasa·πÉbhava, AmitƒÅbha, Ak·π£obhya, and Amoghasiddhi.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: ji ltar bstod cing khyod phyag 'tshal //
analyzed: ji ltar bstod cing khyod phyag 'tshal //
translated: just as you praise and pay homage,

original: zhes bya ba'i 'dis ni drug pa rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ngo bo la phyag 'tshal ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i 'dis ni drug pa rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ngo bo la phyag 'tshal ba'o //
translated: by this one pays homage to the nature of the sixth, MahƒÅvajradhara.

original: 'dir ni de'i bdag nyid du rjes su 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyag 'tshal ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni de'i bdag nyid du rjes su 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyag 'tshal ba yin te /
translated: Here, it is homage characterized by engaging in the nature of that,

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid gcig tu 'gyur ba'i rdo rje 'chang chen po la de'i bdag nyid du 'jug go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid gcig tu 'gyur ba'i rdo rje 'chang chen po la de'i bdag nyid du 'jug go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: therefore, it is the meaning that one engages in the nature of MahƒÅvajradhara, who is a single identity of the five tathƒÅgatas.

original: de'i phyir tha dad pa med pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir tha dad pa med pas /
translated: Therefore, since there is no difference,

original: gang gis bstod cing gang la bstod //
analyzed: gang gis bstod cing gang la bstod //
translated: by whom is there praise and to whom is there praise?

original: ces bya ba ni chu dang 'o ma bzhin du gcig tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni chu dang 'o ma bzhin du gcig tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste nges pa'i don to //
translated: This is because they become one like water and milk. This is the definitive meaning.

original: da ni de'i bdag nyid du 'jug pa'i phyag 'tshal ba'i rang gi ngo bo dpe'i sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: da ni de'i bdag nyid du 'jug pa'i phyag 'tshal ba'i rang gi ngo bo dpe'i sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: Now, in order to teach the nature of the homage of entering into that nature by way of example, it is said:

original: ji ltar chu la chu bzhag dang // ji ltar mar la mar nyid bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar chu la chu bzhag dang // ji ltar mar la mar nyid bzhin //
translated: Just as water in water, just as butter in butter,

original: rang gis rang gi ye shes ni //
analyzed: rang gis rang gi ye shes ni //
translated: one‚Äôs own pristine consciousness

original: legs mthong gang de 'dir phyag nyid //üîΩces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: legs mthong gang de 'dir phyag nyid // ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: is well seen here, that is homage.

original: de'i bdag nyid du rjes su 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyag 'tshal ba ji lta bu zhe na dper na klung gnyis nas brug pa'i chu rgyun gcig tu 'dus nas 'dres pa dag la khyad par cung zad kyang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du rjes su 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyag 'tshal ba ji lta bu zhe na dper na klung gnyis nas brug pa'i chu rgyun gcig tu 'dus nas 'dres pa dag la khyad par cung zad kyang mi dmigs te /
translated: What is the homage characterized by entering into that nature? For example, when the water currents of two rivers merge into one, no difference whatsoever is observed,

original: chur bye brag mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chur bye brag mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the water is not differentiated.

original: de bzhin du brgya la yul grang ba dang dro ba las 'ongs pa'i chu gnyis kyi bye brag reg bya la mkhas pa rnams kyis 'dom pa'i gnas su dmigs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du brgya la yul grang ba dang dro ba las 'ongs pa'i chu gnyis kyi bye brag reg bya la mkhas pa rnams kyis 'dom pa'i gnas su dmigs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: In the same way, if the two waters that come from the cold and warm regions are measured by those skilled in the tactile sensation of water, they will be observed to be the same.

original: de'i tshe dpe gnyis pa ji ltar mar la mar nyid bzhin te mar gnyis bsres na snum pa dang kha dog gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir tha dad pa med do //
analyzed: de'i tshe dpe gnyis pa ji ltar mar la mar nyid bzhin te mar gnyis bsres na snum pa dang kha dog gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir tha dad pa med do //
translated: At that time, the second example is like butter in butter, for when two kinds of butter are mixed, they are of one consistency and color, so there is no difference.

original: de bzhin du rang ste phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi shes pa rang gi yi shes te thams cad stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi 'od gsal ba la bkod cing legs par mthong ba gang yin pa de phyag 'tshal ba
analyzed: de bzhin du rang ste phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi shes pa rang gi yi shes te thams cad stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi 'od gsal ba la bkod cing legs par mthong ba gang yin pa de phyag 'tshal ba
translated: Thus, one‚Äôs own cognition, i.e., the cognition of the characteristics of the aggregates, elements, sense-spheres, etc., is placed in one‚Äôs own cognition, i.e., in the clearlight nature of emptiness, and is well seen. To that one pays homage.

original: ste de kho na phyag 'tshal ba'i 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir phyag 'tshal ba yin no //
analyzed: ste de kho na phyag 'tshal ba'i 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir phyag 'tshal ba yin no //
translated: That is the result of paying homage, so one pays homage to that.

original: de bzhin du las dang po pa dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba'i tshe sangs rgyas 'grub pa'i shog ces de'i don du phyag @85b 'tshal bar byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du las dang po pa dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba'i tshe sangs rgyas 'grub pa'i shog ces de'i don du phyag @85b 'tshal bar byed do //
translated: Similarly, when a beginner goes for refuge to the Three Jewels, one pays homage for the sake of that, saying, ‚ÄúMay I attain Buddhahood.‚Äù

original: 'dir ni phyag 'tshal ba kho nas sangs rgyas nyid yin pas rgyu dang 'bras bu dag la tha dad pa med de /
analyzed: 'dir ni phyag 'tshal ba kho nas sangs rgyas nyid yin pas rgyu dang 'bras bu dag la tha dad pa med de /
translated: Here, since one is a Buddha just by the salutation, there is no difference between the cause and the result.

original: dgongs pa 'dis bcom ldan 'das kyis rtsa ba'i rgyud las /
analyzed: dgongs pa 'dis bcom ldan 'das kyis rtsa ba'i rgyud las /
translated: With this intention, the Bhagavat said in the Mula Tantra:

original: rdo rje gsum mchog phyag rgya min //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum mchog phyag rgya min // zhes gsungs so //
translated: The three vajras are not the mudra.

original: 'dir ni phyag 'tshal ba bkag pa ma yin te ;
analyzed: 'dir ni phyag 'tshal ba bkag pa ma yin te ;
translated: Here, the salutation is not prohibited,

original: 'on kyang de'i bdag nyid du rjes su 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyis phyag 'tshal ba brten par bzhed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang de'i bdag nyid du rjes su 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyis phyag 'tshal ba brten par bzhed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: but it is not the case that the salutation is accepted as having the characteristic of entering into identity with that.

original: gal te de ltar na phyag 'tshal ba tsam kho nas de kho na nyid khong du chud pa'i phyir bsgom pas ci zhig bya snyam du dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na phyag 'tshal ba tsam kho nas de kho na nyid khong du chud pa'i phyir bsgom pas ci zhig bya snyam du dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: If that is so, then one might think that since reality is understood just by the salutation, what is the use of meditation?

original: 'on kyang kun mkhyen rtogs med par //
analyzed: 'on kyang kun mkhyen rtogs med par //
translated: But, without the realization of omniscience,

original: de nyid nye bar dmigs mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de nyid nye bar dmigs mi 'gyur //
translated: that reality will not be perceived.

original: mun nag rab rib kyis khebs pa //
analyzed: mun nag rab rib kyis khebs pa //
translated: Like one covered by darkness and obscurity,

original: drin gyis snang ba 'thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: drin gyis snang ba 'thob par 'gyur //
translated: one will obtain the light through the kindness of the guru.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs pa'i don ni 'di yin te phyag 'tshal ba tsam gyis rtogs par 'gyur ba yin mod kyi 'on kyang ji srid du bla ma'i zhal las phyag 'tshal ba de'i rang bzhin ma shes pa de srid du ji ltar rtogs par bya'o snyam du dgongs
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs pa'i don ni 'di yin te phyag 'tshal ba tsam gyis rtogs par 'gyur ba yin mod kyi 'on kyang ji srid du bla ma'i zhal las phyag 'tshal ba de'i rang bzhin ma shes pa de srid du ji ltar rtogs par bya'o snyam du dgongs
translated: The meaning of this statement is as follows: It is true that one can understand the homage merely by reading it, but until one knows the nature of the homage from the guru's lips, one might think, how can I understand it?

original: pa'o // de'i phyir kun mkhyen ni rdo rje slob dpon yin par bzhed de /
analyzed: pa'o // de'i phyir kun mkhyen ni rdo rje slob dpon yin par bzhed de /
translated: Therefore, the Omniscient One is accepted as the vajra master,

original: bla ma dang rdo rje 'chang la bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bla ma dang rdo rje 'chang la bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference between the guru and Vajradhara.

original: de las rtogs pa ste ye shes khong du chud pa gang yin pa de med par de kho na nyid nye bar dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de las rtogs pa ste ye shes khong du chud pa gang yin pa de med par de kho na nyid nye bar dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Without that understanding, without the realization of gnosis, one cannot perceive reality.

original: rgyal ba skyed ma las dge ba'i bshes gnyen la nye bar brten nas sangs rgyas kyi byang chub 'thob bo zhes gang gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du //
analyzed: rgyal ba skyed ma las dge ba'i bshes gnyen la nye bar brten nas sangs rgyas kyi byang chub 'thob bo zhes gang gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du //
translated: As it is said, One attains the enlightenment of the Buddha by relying on the spiritual friend, the mother of the conquerors, and similarly,

original: log pa'i nga rgyal can gyis rang skyon la //
analyzed: log pa'i nga rgyal can gyis rang skyon la //
translated: The one with false pride does not know his own faults,

original: skyon du mi shes yon tan min //
analyzed: skyon du mi shes yon tan min //
translated: and does not know good qualities as good qualities.

original: dge ba'i bshes rnams brnyas par byed pa ste //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes rnams brnyas par byed pa ste //
translated: They despise the spiritual friends,

original: de nyid bdud rtsi ji ltar 'thung bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyid bdud rtsi ji ltar 'thung bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: how can they drink the nectar?

original: dpe gsungs pa /
analyzed: dpe gsungs pa /
translated: The example is stated:

original: ji ltar mun nag rab rab kyis te mun nag thibs bos khebs pa'i bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa mi gsal ba mar me'i snang ba dang phrad nas de dag nyid ming dang gzugs la sogs pa'i bye brag gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar mun nag rab rab kyis te mun nag thibs bos khebs pa'i bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa mi gsal ba mar me'i snang ba dang phrad nas de dag nyid ming dang gzugs la sogs pa'i bye brag gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as a pot, a cloth, etc. , which are covered by a thick darkness, are not clear, but when they encounter the light of a lamp, they become clear, distinguished by their names and forms, etc.

original: de bzhin du thog ma med pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyi mun pa'i tshogs kyis dri ma can du byas pa'i sems kyi rgyud la de kho na nyid yod du zin @86a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du thog ma med pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyi mun pa'i tshogs kyis dri ma can du byas pa'i sems kyi rgyud la de kho na nyid yod du zin @86a * //
translated: In the same way, although reality exists in the continuum of mind, which is defiled by the mass of darkness of the latent tendencies of the afflictions, such as desire, which have no beginning, it is not clear.

original: kyang mi gsal te bla ma'i zhal snga nas kyi bka' drin thob nas de kho na nyid de skad cig tsam gyis gsal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kyang mi gsal te bla ma'i zhal snga nas kyi bka' drin thob nas de kho na nyid de skad cig tsam gyis gsal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: But having obtained the kindness of the guru's instructions, that reality becomes clear in an instant. This is the meaning.

original: de'i phyir bla ma'i zhal gyi man ngag lhur blang bar bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don te sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bla ma'i zhal gyi man ngag lhur blang bar bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don te sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, one should strive for the guru's oral instructions. This is the summarized meaning, which is literal.

original: da ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag bstan pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: da ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag bstan pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Now, in order to teach the cause and effect distinctions of the stage of mind purification, it is said:üîΩEmptiness, utter emptiness,üîΩthe third is great emptiness,

original: stong nyid shin tu stong pa dang // gsum pa stong pa chen po dang // bzhi pa thams cad stong pa ni //üîΩrgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag go //
analyzed: stong nyid shin tu stong pa dang // gsum pa stong pa chen po dang // bzhi pa thams cad stong pa ni // rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag go //
translated: and the fourth is everything is empty.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: These are the distinctions of cause and effect.

original: sems rnam par dag pa'i skabs 'dir /
analyzed: sems rnam par dag pa'i skabs 'dir /
translated: In this context of mind purification,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ma gtogs par gzhan mi dmigs te /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ma gtogs par gzhan mi dmigs te /
translated: apart from mind and mental factors, no other concepts are observed.

original: 'phags pa byams pas /
analyzed: 'phags pa byams pas /
translated: As ƒÄrya Maitreya said:

original: yang dag ma yin kun rtog ni //üîΩsems dang sems byung khams gsum pa //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun rtog ni // sems dang sems byung khams gsum pa //
translated: False imagination

original: zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: is mind and mental factors of the three realms.

original: de'i phyir mi mthun pa dang / gnyen po'i dbye bas de rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi mthun pa dang / gnyen po'i dbye bas de rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, through the distinctions of discordant classes and antidotes, it becomes purified.

original: de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni rnam par shes pa gsum dang / de las byung ba'i rang bzhin rnam pa gsum yin la /
analyzed: de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni rnam par shes pa gsum dang / de las byung ba'i rang bzhin rnam pa gsum yin la /
translated: The discordant classes are the three consciousnesses and the three natures that arise from them.

original: gnyen po'i phyogs ni stong pa gsum yin zhing /
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs ni stong pa gsum yin zhing /
translated: The concordant classes are the three emptinesses.

original: de nyid kyi rnam grangs ni ye shes gsum zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi rnam grangs ni ye shes gsum zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The synonyms of those are called the three intuitions.

original: rnam par shes pa gsum dang de dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin rnams gang yin pa de rnams kyang gnyen por gyur pa'i snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes gsum gyi rnam par dag par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir de rnams kyi ming gis bstan te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gsum dang de dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin rnams gang yin pa de rnams kyang gnyen por gyur pa'i snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes gsum gyi rnam par dag par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir de rnams kyi ming gis bstan te /
translated: The three consciousnesses and the natures associated with them are to be purified by the three intuitions of appearance, etc., which are their antidotes.

original: char gyi byas pa'i mu ge ni char med par byas pa'i mu ge'o zhes bya pa'i don to //
analyzed: char gyi byas pa'i mu ge ni char med par byas pa'i mu ge'o zhes bya pa'i don to //
translated: The famine caused by rain is the famine caused by the absence of rain.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa kho na snang ba'i ye shes dang / stong pa nyid ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa kho na snang ba'i ye shes dang / stong pa nyid ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: Similarly, consciousness itself is the intuition of appearance, and it is to be called emptiness.

original: de ni de rnams kyi spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de rnams kyi spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is to be abandoned by them.

original: de ni yan lag gi don to //
analyzed: de ni yan lag gi don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the branches.

original: tshig gi don ni nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa stong pa nyid bcu drug po de rnams las bzhi bzhi zhing re res bsdus pas stong pa nyid la sogs pa bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa stong pa nyid bcu drug po de rnams las bzhi bzhi zhing re res bsdus pas stong pa nyid la sogs pa bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning of the words: from among those sixteen kinds of emptiness, beginning with the emptiness of the inner, each one is included in four, so there are four kinds of emptiness, etc.

original: 'di ltar stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni snang ba'i ye shes skyes par gyur pa na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa spong ba'i phyir gnyen po yin no //üîΩde bzhin du shin tu stong pa ni snang ba gsal ba'i ye shes skye bar 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni snang ba'i ye shes skyes par gyur pa na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa spong ba'i phyir gnyen po yin no // de bzhin du shin tu stong pa ni snang ba gsal ba'i ye shes skye bar 'gyur ba ni /
translated: Thus, emptiness is the antidote because when the pristine wisdom of appearance arises, the consciousness of engagement is abandoned.

original: nyon mongs ba can gyi @86b yid kyi rnam par shes pa spong ba'i phyir gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs ba can gyi @86b yid kyi rnam par shes pa spong ba'i phyir gnyen po yin no //
translated: Similarly, great emptiness is the antidote because when the pristine wisdom of clear appearance arises, the afflicted mind consciousness is abandoned.

original: de bzhin du chen po stong pa ni snang ba nye bar thob pa'i ye shes skye bar 'gyur ba na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa spong ba'i phyir gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du chen po stong pa ni snang ba nye bar thob pa'i ye shes skye bar 'gyur ba na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa spong ba'i phyir gnyen po yin no //
translated: Similarly, universal emptiness is the antidote because when the pristine wisdom of the attainment of appearance arises, the consciousness of the ground of all is abandoned.

original: bzhi pa thams cad stong pa ni 'od gsal ba skyes par gyur pa na /
analyzed: bzhi pa thams cad stong pa ni 'od gsal ba skyes par gyur pa na /
translated: The fourth, the emptiness of everything, is the arising of clear light.

original: ye shes gsum dang rnam grangs gzhan stong pa nyid gsum spong ba'i phyir 'bras bu zhes brjod do //
analyzed: ye shes gsum dang rnam grangs gzhan stong pa nyid gsum spong ba'i phyir 'bras bu zhes brjod do //
translated: Since the three exalted wisdoms and the three other types of emptiness are abandoned, it is called the result.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag go //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag go //
translated: it is the distinction of cause and result.

original: zhes bya ba la rgyu'i bye brag ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i dbye ba yin zhing 'bras bu'i bye brag ni 'od gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la rgyu'i bye brag ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i dbye ba yin zhing 'bras bu'i bye brag ni 'od gsal ba yin no //
translated: The distinction of cause is the division of emptiness and so forth, and the distinction of result is clear light.

original: da ni de kho na nyid bshad pa /
analyzed: da ni de kho na nyid bshad pa /
translated: Now, the explanation of reality:

original: shes rab thabs su sbyor ba las //üîΩrdzogs pa nye bar thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: shes rab thabs su sbyor ba las // rdzogs pa nye bar thob par 'gyur //
translated: From the union of wisdom and method,üîΩthe perfection is attained.

original: nye bar thob pa rdzogs pa las //
analyzed: nye bar thob pa rdzogs pa las //
translated: From the attainment of the perfection,

original: thams cad stong pa 'od gsal ba //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: thams cad stong pa 'od gsal ba // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: everything is empty, clear light.

original: de la shes rab ces bya ba'i sgras ni yul 'dzin pa la khyad par du shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la shes rab yin par bstan to //
analyzed: de la shes rab ces bya ba'i sgras ni yul 'dzin pa la khyad par du shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la shes rab yin par bstan to //
translated: There, the term ‚Äúwisdom‚Äù is taught to be the wisdom that is the nature of the special consciousness that apprehends objects, because it is the consciousness that engages.

original: de bzhin du yang bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa bzhi'i sgo nas 'khor ba'i 'khor lo ma lus pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir thabs ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa bzhi'i sgo nas 'khor ba'i 'khor lo ma lus pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir thabs ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa yin no //
translated: Likewise, the method is the afflicted mental consciousness, because it is the cause of the entire wheel of samsara through the four views of self and so on.

original: de dag sbyor ba las te nye bar 'dus pas rdzogs pa ni gcig tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de dag sbyor ba las te nye bar 'dus pas rdzogs pa ni gcig tu gyur pa'o //
translated: It is perfected through their union, that is, through their coming together.

original: nye bar thob pa ni nye bar dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: nye bar thob pa ni nye bar dmigs pa ste /
translated: It is attained through their union, that is, through their observation.

original: srid pa bar ma'i gnas skabs na gsal ba yin pas kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni nye bar thob pa yin no //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma'i gnas skabs na gsal ba yin pas kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni nye bar thob pa yin no //
translated: Since it is clear in the state of the intermediate existence, the foundation consciousness is attained.

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa de rdzogs pa las te /
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa de rdzogs pa las te /
translated: From the perfection of that foundation consciousness,üîΩthat is, from the abandonment of the great emptiness, yogins and yoginis attain the reality of clear light, which is the nature of everything empty.

original: chen po stong pas spangs par gyur pa las rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis thams cad stong pa'i bdag nyid kyi 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid nye bar thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chen po stong pas spangs par gyur pa las rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis thams cad stong pa'i bdag nyid kyi 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid nye bar thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de'i yang so sor bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i yang so sor bshad pa /
translated: The individual explanations of that are:

original: rgyu yi rim pa rnam dag dang // rnam shes gsum po sbyor ba dang // stong pa gsum ni mnyam sbyor las //
analyzed: rgyu yi rim pa rnam dag dang // rnam shes gsum po sbyor ba dang // stong pa gsum ni mnyam sbyor las //
translated: and the union of the three voids,

original: bla med go 'phang 'thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: bla med go 'phang 'thob par 'gyur //
translated: the unsurpassed state is attained.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is stated.

original: rgyu'i rim gyis te sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim gyis gang gi tshe rnam shes gsum ste 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa gsum dang sbyor ba zhes bya ba de dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin rnams rnam par dag par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu'i rim gyis te sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim gyis gang gi tshe rnam shes gsum ste 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa gsum dang sbyor ba zhes bya ba de dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin rnams rnam par dag par bya ste /
translated: When, by the sequence of causes, by the sequence of mantras and seals, the three consciousnesses, the three consciousnesses of entry and so forth, are united, that is, are connected, the natures are purified.

original: de ni @87a * //
analyzed: de ni @87a * //
translated: That is,

original: stong pa gsum ni mnyam sbyor las te stong pa gsum ro gcig tu gyur pa'i thams cad stong pa las bla med go 'phang ste 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid 'thob par 'gyur zhing rnyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: stong pa gsum ni mnyam sbyor las te stong pa gsum ro gcig tu gyur pa'i thams cad stong pa las bla med go 'phang ste 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid 'thob par 'gyur zhing rnyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: from the union of the three voids, the three voids becoming of one taste, the unsurpassed state, the reality of clear light, is attained, is obtained. This is the meaning.

original: 'dir bsdus pa'i don 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir bsdus pa'i don 'di yin te /
translated: Here is the condensed meaning:

original: rnam par shes pa brgyad rnam par shes pa gsum du bsdus nas /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa brgyad rnam par shes pa gsum du bsdus nas /
translated: The eight consciousnesses are included in the three consciousnesses.

original: de sngags kyi rim gyis 'di ltar spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de sngags kyi rim gyis 'di ltar spang bar bya'o //
translated: It is to be abandoned in this way by the process of mantra.

original: dang por lte ba'i gnas su chos kyi dbyings kyi 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa la padma dang zla ba'i steng du dbyangs dang po'i thig les mtshan pa bkod de mgo bo la sogs pa rnams su yi ge gsum bkod nas //
analyzed: dang por lte ba'i gnas su chos kyi dbyings kyi 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa la padma dang zla ba'i steng du dbyangs dang po'i thig les mtshan pa bkod de mgo bo la sogs pa rnams su yi ge gsum bkod nas //
translated: First, in the place of the navel, one should arrange the wheel of the realm of phenomena with eight spokes, upon which is a lotus and moon, marked with the drop of the first vowel. Having arranged the three syllables on the head and so forth,

original: de las byung ba'i 'od zer gyis mgo bo nas yi ge aom 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid bkug ste de nyid du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i 'od zer gyis mgo bo nas yi ge aom 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid bkug ste de nyid du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: light rays arise from them, and the consciousness that enters from the head in the aspect of the syllable o·πÉ is summoned and should be placed right there.
