original: de'i tshe ston ka'i dus kyi zla ba'i 'od zer lta bu'i snang ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe ston ka'i dus kyi zla ba'i 'od zer lta bu'i snang ba 'byung ste /
translated: At that time, an appearance like the light rays of the autumn moon arises.

original: de'i tshe snang ba'i ye shes skyes pa na stong pa nyid kyi de kho na nyid thob pas 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin sum cu rtsa gsum dang ldan pa nub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe snang ba'i ye shes skyes pa na stong pa nyid kyi de kho na nyid thob pas 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin sum cu rtsa gsum dang ldan pa nub par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, when the pristine consciousness of appearance arises, the reality of emptiness is attained, and the nature of the entering consciousness endowed with thirty-three vanishes.

original: de'i rjes la de nyid du nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du rdo rje la gnas pa'i tsheg drag dang ldan pa bkod de /
analyzed: de'i rjes la de nyid du nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du rdo rje la gnas pa'i tsheg drag dang ldan pa bkod de /
translated: After that, one should arrange the syllable h≈´·πÉ endowed with a visarga on a vajra on top of a sun ma·πá·∏çala in that very place.

original: de las byung ba'i 'od zer gyis lkog ma nas yi ge a'a: bkug nas de nyid du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i 'od zer gyis lkog ma nas yi ge a'a: bkug nas de nyid du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: The light rays that arise from that draw in the syllable a·∏• from the throat and insert it there.

original: de'i tshe nyi ma'i 'od zer dang mtshungs pa'i snang ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe nyi ma'i 'od zer dang mtshungs pa'i snang ba 'byung ste /
translated: At that time, an appearance arises that is like the light rays of the sun.

original: de'i tshe snang ba gsal ba'i ye shes skyes pa na shin tu stong pa'i de kho na nyid thob pas nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa rang bzhin bzhi bcu dang ldan pa nub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe snang ba gsal ba'i ye shes skyes pa na shin tu stong pa'i de kho na nyid thob pas nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa rang bzhin bzhi bcu dang ldan pa nub par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, when the gnosis of clear appearance arises, since one attains the reality of utter emptiness, the afflicted mind consciousness endowed with forty natures subsides.

original: de'i rjes la 'khor lo dang sa bon dang zla ba dang nyi ma la sogs pa bsgom pa rnams spangs nas yi ge h'um lte ba'i dbus su gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la 'khor lo dang sa bon dang zla ba dang nyi ma la sogs pa bsgom pa rnams spangs nas yi ge h'um lte ba'i dbus su gzhug par bya'o //
translated: After that, having abandoned the meditations of the cakra, seed, moon, sun, and so on, one should place the syllable h≈´·πÉ in the center of the navel.

original: de'i tshe mtshams kyi rab tu gsal ba dang mtshungs pa'i snang ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe mtshams kyi rab tu gsal ba dang mtshungs pa'i snang ba 'byung ste /
translated: At that time, an appearance arises that is like the light of the zenith.

original: de'i tshe kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa rang bzhin bdun dang ldan pa nub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa rang bzhin bdun dang ldan pa nub par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, the consciousness of the ground of all, endowed with seven natures, will disappear.

original: de'i rjes la rim pas mtshan ma lnga byung ba na rab tu gsal ba de rnams kyang med par gyur nas sprin med pa'i nam mkha'i snang ba dang mtshungs pa'i rab tu gsal ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes la rim pas mtshan ma lnga byung ba na rab tu gsal ba de rnams kyang med par gyur nas sprin med pa'i nam mkha'i snang ba dang mtshungs pa'i rab tu gsal ba 'byung ste /
translated: After that, when the five signs arise in sequence, those clear appearances will disappear, and a clear appearance like the appearance of a cloudless sky will arise.

original: de'i tshe ye shes gsum 'gags nas rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i de @87b kho na nyid bzhi pa skye bar gyur pa yin no zhes pa ni sngags kyi rim pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe ye shes gsum 'gags nas rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i de @87b kho na nyid bzhi pa skye bar gyur pa yin no zhes pa ni sngags kyi rim pa'o //
translated: At that time, the three wisdoms cease, and the fourth reality, natural luminosity, arises. This is the mantra stage.

original: phyag rgya'i rim pa ni dam tshig dang ye shes kyi phyag rgya dag las gang yang rung ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa na rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i skad cig la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'gags nas snang ba'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi dga' ba
analyzed: phyag rgya'i rim pa ni dam tshig dang ye shes kyi phyag rgya dag las gang yang rung ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa na rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i skad cig la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'gags nas snang ba'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi dga' ba
translated: The mudrƒÅ stage is when, in union with either a pledge or a wisdom consort, the consciousness that engages in the various moments ceases, and the joy that has the nature of the wisdom of appearance

original: skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: arises.

original: rnam par shes pa'i skad cig la nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'gags nas snang ba gsal ba'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi mchog tu dga' ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i skad cig la nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'gags nas snang ba gsal ba'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi mchog tu dga' ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the moment of consciousness, the afflicted mind consciousness ceases and supreme joy, which is the nature of the exalted wisdom of clear light, arises.

original: rnam par nyed pa'i skad cig la kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa 'gags nas snang ba nye bar thob pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi dga' bral skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par nyed pa'i skad cig la kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa 'gags nas snang ba nye bar thob pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi dga' bral skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the moment of separation, the all-base consciousness ceases and the joy of separation, which is the nature of the exalted wisdom of attaining clear light, arises.

original: bral ba'i rang bzhin ji ltar snang ba nye bar thob pa yin pa ni bla ma'i zhal las rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: bral ba'i rang bzhin ji ltar snang ba nye bar thob pa yin pa ni bla ma'i zhal las rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The way in which the nature of separation appears as the attainment of clear light should be understood from the guru‚Äôs instruction.

original: de'i rjes la mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i skad cig la ye shes gsum 'gags nas /
analyzed: de'i rjes la mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i skad cig la ye shes gsum 'gags nas /

analyzed: 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyi lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya'i rnam par dbye ba'o //

original: phyag rgya med na dpe'i dus su nye bar mtshon pa'i de kho na nyid rjes su dran par byas nas de'i tshul du bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i rim pa ste dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya med na dpe'i dus su nye bar mtshon pa'i de kho na nyid rjes su dran par byas nas de'i tshul du bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i rim pa ste dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //

original: da ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i phyogs dang de dag gi thabs kyi dbye bas kun rdzob kyi rang bzhin gyi ming rnams /

translated: They should be ascertained by the direct perception of the self cognizance of embodied beings.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni reg pa la sogs pa lnga dang bdun pa la sogs pa lnga dang bcu gcig dge ba dang nyon mongs pa drug dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa nyi shu dang mtshungs par ldan ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni reg pa la sogs pa lnga dang bdun pa la sogs pa lnga dang bcu gcig dge ba dang nyon mongs pa drug dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa nyi shu dang mtshungs par ldan ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't the engaging consciousness concomitant with the five such as contact, the five such as the seventh, the eleven virtuous factors, the six root afflictions, the twenty secondary afflictions and so on?üîΩTherefore how can it be said to possess thirty three natures?

original: de'i phyir chos bzhi bcu rtsa bdun dang ldan pa de ji ltar rang bzhin sum cu rtsa gsum dang ldan par brjod par bya zhen bden te ji ltar rtsa ba'i nyon mongs pa drug las nye ba'i nyon mongs pa nyi shur phye ba de rnams kyi rang gi
analyzed: de'i phyir chos bzhi bcu rtsa bdun dang ldan pa de ji ltar rang bzhin sum cu rtsa gsum dang ldan par brjod par bya zhen bden te ji ltar rtsa ba'i nyon mongs pa drug las nye ba'i nyon mongs pa nyi shur phye ba de rnams kyi rang gi
translated: It is true that it possesses forty seven factors, but just as the twenty secondary afflictions are differentiated from the six root afflictions, so too the secondary afflictions are differentiated from the root afflictions.

original: ngo bo nyid yin pa de bzhin du 'di rnams kyang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa la sogs pa rnams kyi dbye ba las bag chags phra mo'i rang bzhin yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid yin pa de bzhin du 'di rnams kyang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa la sogs pa rnams kyi dbye ba las bag chags phra mo'i rang bzhin yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Just as the nature of the mind is the nature of the seeds of all dharmas, so also these are to be known as the nature of the subtle seeds of the secondary passions, etc., by way of their divisions.

original: de bzhin du yang chags bral la sogs pa gsum ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa 'gyod pa'i nang du 'dus te /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang chags bral la sogs pa gsum ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa 'gyod pa'i nang du 'dus te /
translated: In the same way, the three, nonattachment, etc., are included in regret, a secondary passion,

original: sems kyi yid la gcags pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: sems kyi yid la gcags pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro//
translated: because they have the nature of mental remorse.

original: @88b yid kyi 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dag ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa'i bdag nyid yin te /
analyzed: @88b yid kyi 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dag ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa'i bdag nyid yin te /
translated: The comings and goings of the mind are of the nature of initial and sustained thought,

original: phra ba dang rags pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phra ba dang rags pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have the nature of the subtle and gross.

original: zhi ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni rnam par mi 'tshe ba ste snying rje yin no //
analyzed: zhi ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni rnam par mi 'tshe ba ste snying rje yin no //
translated: The thought of peace is nonviolence, which is compassion.

original: 'jigs pa la sogs pa gsum ni ma chags pa la sogs pa dge ba gsum du 'dus te /
analyzed: 'jigs pa la sogs pa gsum ni ma chags pa la sogs pa dge ba gsum du 'dus te /
translated: The three, fear, etc., are included in the three virtues, nonattachment, etc.,

original: 'jigs pa yod na ma chags pa la sogs pa rjes su bsgrub po //
analyzed: 'jigs pa yod na ma chags pa la sogs pa rjes su bsgrub po //
translated: because when there is fear, one accomplishes nonattachment, etc.

original: srid pa la sogs pa gsum dang len pa ni nyon mongs pa 'dod chags kyis bsdus kyi 'dod chags dang ldan pa la sred pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa la sogs pa gsum dang len pa ni nyon mongs pa 'dod chags kyis bsdus kyi 'dod chags dang ldan pa la sred pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The three beginning with existence and grasping are included in the defilement of passion, because craving arises in one who is full of passion.

original: mi dge ba ni nyon mongs pa zhe sdang dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa 'chab pa dang 'tshig pa dang phrag dog la sogs pa rnams su'o //üîΩtshor ba la sogs pa rnam pa gsum ni //
analyzed: mi dge ba ni nyon mongs pa zhe sdang dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa 'chab pa dang 'tshig pa dang phrag dog la sogs pa rnams su'o // tshor ba la sogs pa rnam pa gsum ni //
translated: The three beginning with non-virtue are included in the defilement of hatred, because hatred arises in one who is full of hatred.üîΩThe three beginning with feeling are included in the defilement of ignorance, because delusion arises in one who is full of ignorance.

original: kun du 'gro ba'i tshor ba rnam pa gsum du'o //
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba'i tshor ba rnam pa gsum du'o //
translated: The three beginning with feeling are included in the three universal defilements.

original: bkres pa dang skom pa dag ni reg par ro //
analyzed: bkres pa dang skom pa dag ni reg par ro //
translated: Hunger and thirst are included in contact.

original: rig pa po la sogs pa gsum ni yid la byed par ro //
analyzed: rig pa po la sogs pa gsum ni yid la byed par ro //
translated: The three beginning with the knower are included in attention.

original: so sor dpyod pa ni rtog par ro //
analyzed: so sor dpyod pa ni rtog par ro //
translated: Discernment is included in conceptualization.
